Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relative au frais scolaire des enfants, à la santé, aux goûters  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from the Kounadia group are all married. On average they are 42 years of age, have 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in N’Tjifina, in the Fana Sub-Prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They were acquainted through family connections and are in the business of retailing food condiments, grain cereals and clothing. This is the first group loan request for the Kotognontala group, which will be used to buy packages of food condiments, grain cereals, and men and women’s clothing. They get their clothing and condiment supplies mainly from Bamako and within the village. The cereals come from local producers and wholesalers. They sell at the Fana city market, in Nangola and in area market fairs, retail, cash or credit, to both men and women customers. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA each, which will be used to cover children’s school expenses, healthcare, after-school snacks, the remainder being reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments, cereals, and clothing

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley M. T. is forty-six years old, married, and has three children aged between twenty-two and ten years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. His business is located at Hazina Estate in Nairobi and it is well-known by the name 'El Shodai'. He has been selling electrical wires, bulb holders, extension cables, etc., to the local people. He has been doing this business for ten years now and has one employee. 

Stanley says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is harrassment from the local authorities. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more stock for his business. He is a visionary man.

loans.use: Electrical wires, bulb holders, extension cables, etc.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Yeredeme,  toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à N’Tjifina sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, et font le commerce de savons, de l’huile alimentaire, de l’arachide et des céréales.
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de savons de fabrication locale, 60 litres d’huile, des sacs d’arachide et de céréales.
Elles s’approvisionnent en savons avec les fabricants de Fana  et les autres produits sont achetés dans les environnants. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeredeme group, who are all married, are in average 34 yr-old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in N'Tjifina, in the Fana prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (Second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family ties, and they trade soap, cooking oil, peanuts and grains. The women of the Yeredeme group are ready for their first group loan, that they will use to buy bags of locally made soaps, 60 liters of oil, bags of peanuts and grains. They purchase their soap supplies from manufacturers in Fana and other products in the surroundings. They retail on markets in Fana and surroundings, to a client base of both women and men that they allow to pay in credit. They expect to each make an average monthly profit of 30.000F CFA that they will use towards health care expenses, food and school fees and the remainder will be re-invested into their business.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various basic goods for retail.

loans.name: Lili Filipe

texts.pt:
Lili Filipe T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de19, 14, anos e 1 de 9 meses de idade, os 2 mais velho vão a escola mas vivem com o pai. Frequenta 12ą classe, não foi possível continuar na altura devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o filho menor não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Matola afim de estar perto do seu local de trabalho. Trabalha no Tribunal Judicial de Maputo há mais de 3 anos como servente tem um horário único das 7:30h as 15:30min. Possui uma empregada que lhe ajuda nos trabalhos de casa e cuidar da filha menor. Recebe um salário mensal de 2.000.00mt e um valor não fixo de bónus de participação, que depende também de n º. de processos de julgamento. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Procredit mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também já se beneficiaram dos serviços desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, barrotes, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. 
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar perfeitamente a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família
texts.en:
Lili Filipe T. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, single, and is the mother of 3 children. The older two are 19 and 14 years old, and the third is 9 months old. The older children go to school and live with their father. Lili studied up to 12th grade, but wasn't able to continue studying because she couldn't afford it. She lives in her own home with her youngest child, and doesn't support anyone else financially. She moved from the city of Maputo to Matola in order to be close to her work. She has worked in the court system of Maputo for more than 3 years as an assistant. She has a set work schedule, from 7:30 AM to 3:30 PM. She also employs someone to help her with housework and to care for her youngest daughter. She receives a monthly salary of 2000.00 meticales as well as a variable work bonus that depends in part on the number of court cases being tried. She uses her earnings to cover household expenses and also saves some in her bank account. Lili had taken out loans before with Banco Procredit, but later decided not to continue working with them. She heard about Hluvuku from neighbors of hers who had taken advantage of the services it provides. This is her first loan, in the amount of 10,000.00 meticales. She plans to use it to buy construction materials (iron, support beams, cement, sand and other items) to continue with her home improvement project. She promises to repay this loan as agreed, in order to be eligible to take out others in the future. She would like to take out other loans in order to finish working on her house and then furnish it, in order to offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (iron, cement, sand and other items)

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badenya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de céréales et de charbon de bois.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 3 sacs de céréales et plusieurs sacs de charbon de bois.                                                                          
Elles s’approvisionnent en produits sur place et dans les environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  22500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Badenya group, who are all married, are in average 31 yr-old with 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Zagnenabougou, in the Fana prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (Second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family ties, and they trade spices, grains and charcoal. The women of the Badenya are requesting their 4th group loan, that they will use to buy 3 bags of grains and several bags of charcoal. They purchase their supplies and retail them in Zagnenabougou as well as its surroundings. They have a client base of women and men that pay either cash or credit. They expect to each make an average monthly profit of 22.500F CFA that they will use towards health care expenses, food and school fees and the remainder will be re-invested into their business.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various basic goods for retail.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric S. J. is twenty-six years old, married, and has one child aged three months old. They hope to give their child a good education to the university level. 

Eric's business is located at Kitengela, just behind Kitengela market, and it is known by the name Matinyani Furniture Mart. He sells chairs, wall units, sofa sets, tables, tools and others to the local people. He has been in this business for the last five years and has four employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints and that wood is not readily available. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Eric is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more materials for making sofa sets. He hopes to expand his business. He is very hard-working, honest and determined.

loans.use: Materials for sofa sets

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font le commerce de céréales, d’articles ménagers en plastiques  et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 500Kg de céréales et 50 paniers de condiments alimentaires.                                                                           
Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales et en condiments sur place et dans les  villages environnants. Tous les produits sont  vendus sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour amorcer le prêt, les dépenses familiales telles la santé, la nourriture, les frais scolaires et le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group, who are all married, are in average 36 yr-old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Zagnenabougou, in the Fana prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (Second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They met through professional and family ties, and trade grains, spices as well as plastic household items. The women of the Benkadi are requesting their 4th group loan, that they will use to buy 500 kg of grains and 50 baskets of spices. They purchase their supplies in Zagnenabougou as well as its surroundings. They also retail in their village and surrounding villages to a client base of both women and men. They expect to each make an average monthly profit of 30.000F CFA that they will use towards the loan, health care expenses, food and school fees and the remainder will be re-invested into their activity.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains and spices

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more rice, fish, oil and eggs to cook and serve to her customers

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font essentiellement le commerce des céréales et quelques articles divers.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  2 tonnes de céréales (mil, maïs etc.)                                                                          
L’approvisionnent  se fait au niveau du village et dans les villages environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune en moyenne un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group are all married. On average, they are 38 years old and have three children. They all live in extended traditional families in Zagnenabougou, subprefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The group members know each other through professional and family ties and make a living by buying and selling cereals and a few other items. The women of Danaya Group apply now for their fourth solidarity loan which they will use to buy 2 tons of cereals (millet, corn, etc.) They get their supply in their village and in the nearby villages. They retail their products on location and in the nearby trade fairs, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs each, which they will partly spend on healthcare, food and school fees, and partly reinvest into their businesses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de céréales.                                                                                      
Les membres du groupe Djiguitougou sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des paquets de  condiments et 5 sacs de céréales.                                                                          
Les produits sont achetés sur place au village et le plus souvent dans les environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguitougou group, all married, on average are 37 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Zagnenabougou, in Fana sub-prefecture in Koulikoro (the second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). Through their business and family ties they are well known, and trade in condiments and food grains. They have applied for their fourth loan, to be be used to buy packets of condiments and 5 sacks of grain. The products are purchased locally, in their village but mostly in neighboring communities. They sell door-to-door and also inn nearby marketplaces for cash and credit to both women and men. They hope that they will each make an average profit of 25,000F CFA to spend on health, food, and school fees. Anything left over will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments and food grains

loans.name: Alifaga

texts.en:
Alifaga F. is married and has four children. He was born in 1952. He and his family live in Fuzuli region.

Alifaga F. has been in his business for nine years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy four calves for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font le commerce de céréales, d’ustensiles de cuisine et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 sacs de céréales et des condiments destinés  à la restauration.                                                                         
Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales avec les grossistes de la place et les condiments sont achetés dans les foires voisines. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Kotognontala group are all married, have an average age of 36 years old, an average of four children and all live in extended traditional families in Zagnenabougou, the subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through their businesses and via relatives, and they trade in cereals, kitchenware and food condiments. The women in the Kotognontala group are on their fourth group loan, which will be used to buy four bags of cereals and condiments for catering purposes. They get their supplies of cereals from local wholesalers, and their condiments are purchased at neighboring fairs. They sell locally and in surrounding fairs, on a retail basis for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of women and men. They are expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover expenses relating to health, food and school fees; the balance will be reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. M. is fifty-four years old, is married, and has two children aged twenty-eight years and twelve years.

Susan’s business is located at Kitengela, behind Kitengela market, near the Chief's office. She has been selling clothes, mattresses, towels and other items for the last year to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is limited space. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Susan is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more mattresses to expand her business. She hopes to have many business outlets. She is very honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses and blankets to sell

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredon, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et  professionnels, elles font le commerce des condiments alimentaires (tomates fraîches, aubergine, gombo séché etc.) et des céréales.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Yeredon  sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des paquets de condiments et des sacs de céréales.                                                                          
Elles s’approvisionnent en produits sur place et dans les environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22 500F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeredon group are all married, have an average age of 32 years old, an average of three children and all live in extended traditional families in Zagnenabougou, the sub-prefecture of Fana in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through relatives and through their business, and they trade in condiments (fresh tomatoes, aubergine, dried "gombo" or okra etc..) and cereals. The women of the Yeredon group are on their fourth group loan which will be used to buy packets of condiments and bags of cereals. They get their supplies locally and in the surrounding areas. They sell locally and at surrounding fairs, for cash on a retail basis and on credit, to a customer base made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA each, which will be used to cover expenses relating to health, food and school fees; the rest will be reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire.  Tous les  prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font le commerce  d’habits,  de condiments alimentaires,  de gingembres, d’éventails, d’huile alimentaire  et de  la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 2 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants, 3 pièces de pagnes real,  50kg de gousses de gingembre, 20kg de sucre, 5 types d’encens,  3 kg de tamarin, 10 paquets de sachets en plastique, 5 colis de condiments, 3 colis d’éventails, 7 bidons de 20litres d’huile végétale et 2 sacs de 100kg de graines de haricot et 1chargement de charrette en fagot  pour  la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Kadiolo ville, au marché, à domicile et dans les écoles pendant la récréation, de façon ambulante, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the Benkadi group are married; they have an average age of 40 years old and an average of three children. They live in monogomous families in Noumoussou, one of the districts of the town of Kadiolo, in the third administrative region of Mali. They have been collaborating with the microfinance company, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and they are on their tenth group loan. All the previous loans have been paid without problem. They trade in clothes, condiments, ginger, fans and (edible) oil, and they are also in the catering business. With their new loan, they are planning to buy two dozen sets of clothes for children, three pieces of "pagne real" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric), 50kg of ginger pods, 20kg of sugar, five sorts of incense, 3kg of tamarind, ten packets of plastic bags, five parcels of condiments, three parcels of fans, seven cans of vegetable oil, two 100kg bags of bean seeds and one barrowload of firewood for catering. They get their supplies at the large market in Kadiolo town and in the neighboring villages. They sell in Kadiolo town, at the market, at home, in schools during break times, and door-to-door, for cash and often on credit to a customer base made up of men, women and children. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA each, which will be partly saved and used for family needs, and partly to invest in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama B. est marié à deux femmes et père de huit enfants. Il est né le 31 Décembre 1972 à Zanso un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo - 3eme région administrative  de la république du Mali.  Il vit entre Zanso et Loulouni ville où il a  une de ses épouses.
N’ ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école il s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment le commerce qu’il mène depuis maintenant 
 7ans. Très expérimenté en raison des années passées dans le commerce, il le fait avec assez de réussite. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  5 colis  constitués de différents articles pour boutique (lait, sucre, huile, thé, savons, biscuits, bonbons, café, lipton, œufs de poules etc). 
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants et à Sikasso ville et effectue sa vente  dans son kiosque à Loulouni ville en détail, au comptant,  souvent à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera utilisée dans les dépenses familiales.
Il ambitionne se procurer d’un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. is married to two women and is father to eight children. He was born on 31st December 1972 in Zanso, one of the villages in the prefecture of Kadiolo, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He lives between Zanso and Loulouni town, where one of his wives lives. As he did not have the opportunity to go to school, he showed an early interest in income-generating activities, notably in commerce in which he has been engaged for seven years now. In view of the number of years he has been active in commerce, he is now very experienced and quite successful. This is his first collaboration with the micro-finance company, Soro Yiriwaso. With his loan, he is planning to buy five parcels of various shop articles (milk, sugar, oil, tea, soaps, biscuits, sweets, coffee, Lipton tea, chicken eggs etc.) He gets his supplies in the neighboring villages and in Sikasso town and he retails his products in his kiosk in Loulouni for cash, and often on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, of which a large part will be used to build up his business and the rest for family expenses. His ambition is to procure a plot of land in Sikasso town to live on.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various shop articles

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata K. lives in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, with her husband and her son. She sells rice by the cup, garden eggs (eggplant), bottles of oil, salt and groundnuts at Tengbeh town market in Freetown.

Isata K. has been with LAPO, SL for two years now. With the profit that emanated from her business she has built a house.

With the help of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 leones. With  this loan she intends to expand her business by buying more rice, garden eggs, oil, Maggi cubes (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), salt and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice, garden eggs, oil, Maggi cubes, salt and groundnuts

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is 54 years old, married with three children, and her husband is a retired civil servant. Vero in this picture is wearing a black bead necklace and earring because she is bereaved of her sister.

Vero owns a grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks. She started this business four years ago. Her major challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Yemisi, a widow, has five children under her care. She has been a member of LAPO Microfinance for the past two years with a good record. She sells tailoring materials and accessories to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She also sells  sarongs to her customers. She has been in the business for over five years. She makes sure customers' demands are met while she equally improves herself financially. Yemisi hopes to offer her fatherless children a higher level of education.

Yemisi is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and accessories to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and accessories to sell

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 42-year-old married man and father of 5 children of whom three are unemployed. He has owned a vegetable shop since 2006 with a previous 8 years of experience in this occupation. He offers all types of vegetables according to the season and he's making a good income. 

Today, Mohsen is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy more vegetables from some farmer in addition to vegetable boxes to present his products to his customers.

loans.use: buy more vegetables from a farmer in addition oto vegetable boxes

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi sells groceries and drinks; she has been in this business for five years. She is a hard-working woman and she believes in helping her husband in meeting the family needs. Her husband is a civil servant in Delta State. 

Ngozi is blessed with two children. Her elder child is 12 years old while the younger is 8 years old and they are in primary school. Ngozi is 39 years old. She hopes to expand her groceries and drinks business in order to make more sales and profits. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks for sell

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
"El banco de Emprendimiento BELEN, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias  como presidenta esta:

La Sr. Claudia quien es la lider del grupo tiene 2 hijos pequeños, como negocio tiene la venta de comida  en la Av. S., es una persona responsable y dinamica, el dinero del grupo lo uyilizara para la compra de viveres.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Maria del Carmen quien es casada y tiene su negocio de artezanias en las fiestas patronales es una de las socias mas antiguas y que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, el dinero del credito es para la compra de herramientas para la realizacion de sus productos.

La Secretaria es la Srta. Eliana  quie es soltera y tiene su negocio una tienda de barrio  en su propio domicilio es una persona joven y muy activa, el dinero del credito es para la compra de refrescos y asi poder surtir su tienda.

Es un grupo muy responsable en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien, las socias que son estrictas en su cobranza, son muy unidas entre ellas. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Belen Communal Bank is in their third cycle. It is comprised of responsible and hard-working people. This bank is represented by the following members. The president is: Claudia is the leader of the group. She has two small children. Her business is selling food on S. Avenue. She is a responsible and dynamic person. She will use the money from the group to buy supplies. The treasurer is Maria del Carmen. She is married, and her business is making handicrafts for the national holidays. She is one of the oldest members, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments. The money from the loan is to buy tools to make her products. Eliana is the secretary. She is single, and her business is a neighborhood store in her house. She is a very active young person. The money from the loan is to buy soft drinks in order to be able to stock her store. It is a group that is very responsible with their payments. They live in the same neighborhood, and they know each other well. The members are strict about their collections, and they are very united. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 63-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Said has owned a grocery store since 2000. He sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc… He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 

Said is special in his work because he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. His customers are his friends, neighbors, and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to supplement his wife’s income, and also, he always wanted to work for himself. In future, he plans to keep on improving his store by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has been working as a home and interior painter since 2006. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools. 

Mahmoud has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan. He is speciA. in his work because he does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 43-year-old lady who is married to Stephen Karanja. The two of them have three school-going children.  She has been selling second-hand clothes in Naivasha town since 2005.

Florence was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan, after applying for a previous loan which she repaid well and on time.  She plans to buy more clothes for sale as the current stock she has is getting finished.

She plans to move from selling her clothes on the roadside into a permanent place.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 34 years old, married to Nancy Gathoni, and they have two school-going children.  He has been selling clothes in a store within Naivasha town for the last two years.

This will be Moses' third loan, after repaying the previous loans well and on time. He plans to buy fabric which he will sell mostly to tailors in the area as it’s in high demand.

He plans to diversify his business and start selling shoes.

loans.use: To buy fabric for sale

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 43-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Naser has been working as a painter since 1996. Naser requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

He is special in his work because of his efficiency. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Naser first started his business, he had to face competition. He decided on doing his work because of his experience and he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 40 years old, married, and blessed with two children. Her children attend a government school and this gives her joy. She is married to I. and he sells medicines to support their home. Patience cooks and sells mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods, drinks and groceries. During the holidays, her children assist her in sales. She hopes to increase her sales and purchase more drinks, cooking items, and groceries to sell. 

Patience is requesting the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old, married to John Mwangi, and they have two school-going children.  She has operated her sewing and knitting shop in Naivasha since 2004 and she  knits sweaters (cardigans) for sale.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She had earlier applied for a loan of Kshs 30,000 which she repaid well and on time.  She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy more knitting thread and in bulk.

She plans to knit on a large scale and open a tailoring school in future.

loans.use: To buy knitting yarn in bulk

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and married to Jane Muthoni. They have two school-going children.  He operates a retail shop in Naivasha town and this he has done for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to add to his stocks of dry foodstuffs, e.g., sugar, maize flour and rice for his shop.

His future plan is to grow his business to a wholesale outlet.

loans.use: Buy dry foodstuffs for sale, e.g., maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 20 -year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Kamel has been working as a motorcycle repairer for almost three years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a machine for his work. This machine will help him improve his work, as well as his quality of work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.  

Kamel is special in his work because of his efficiency and punctuality in repairing motorcycles. His clients are his friends and neighbors, but sometimes people from the surrounding villages. When Kamel first started his business, he had to face competition. He decided on doing his work because of he has been practicing it since he was a boy and wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for his work

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 23-year-old single lady who is a tailor by profession. She opened her tailoring shop in Olkalou eight months ago and thus far, business has been good.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to expand by buying new fabric for making new clothes for sale but on order.
 
She plans to grow her business and to diversify to be a distributor of fabric in Olkalou town, a fast-growing town in Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Elba Luz

texts.es: Elba Luz C. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, una niña de 9 años la cual se dedica a estudiar, una bebé de 15 meses de edad, y su abuela de 68 años de edad, quien le ayuda con el cuido de sus hijas y los quehaceres del hogar. Elba se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, las cuales son un platillo típico hecho a base de plátano, con el cual se forma una masa y se hace una bolita que se rellena ya sea de leche o de frijoles y luego se fríe y al servirlas se les agrega azúcar. Las empanadas son hechas en su casa, proceso en el cual su abuela le ayuda, ya que hacen una cantidad bastante razonable, las cuales comercializa en una escuela del lugar con todos los jóvenes de educación media. Así mismo las vende en su casa con ayuda de su abuela y Elba se encarga de venderlas a parte de la escuela de forma ambulante por colonias y cantones. Elba se esfuerza mucho por vender todo su producto cada día, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, así mismo porque ella es la única que sostiene a su familia y se encarga de todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de plátanos, leche, frijoles, azúcar  y aceite, lo cual es la materia prima de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elba Luz C. M. is 28, and she lives in the Morazán department. She lives with her two children. She has a nine year old daughter who goes to school and a 15 month old baby. She also lives with her 68 year old grandmother who helps her take care of her daughters and do the household chores. Elba makes empanadas. This is a typical dish made with a banana base, which is formed into dough. It is shaped into a small ball and has a milk or bean filling. Then it is fried and served with sugar on top. The empanadas are made in her house. Her grandmother helps with the process because they make a fair amount. She sells them to middle school students at a school in her area. She also sells them at home with help from her grandmother. Elba is in charge of selling them away from the school as a traveling vendor in neighborhoods and cantons. Elba puts forth a lot of effort to sell all of her product everyday because it is the only source of income that she has. She is the only one supporting her family and paying all of the household expenses. That is the reason she is asking for Integral for a loan. With the loan she will be able to buy a larger quantity of bananas, milk, beans, sugar, and oil. These are the raw materials of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, milk, beans, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Ghandi

texts.en:
Ghandi is a 41-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ghandi has owned and operated a grocery store for eleven years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

Ghandi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His customers are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to supplement his family’s income, and he also wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his store by increasing his stock.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Nelson Jaime

texts.es: Nelson Jaime P. L. de 39 años de edad, posee una panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar diferentes tipos de pan, ya sea dulce o salado. La panadería está en su propia casa de habitación, la cual está ubicada en Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 5 a los 19 años de edad, de los cuales todos estudian. Desde hace 20 años que Nelson posee esta panadería, ganando muchos clientes, y así mismo experiencia para poder mejorar su servicio y de esta forma poder brindar mayor variedad de pan. Nelson posee un negocio muy bien establecido, en el que envían a 6 repartidores de pan a dejarlo a los negocios de cada cliente. Nelson solicita un préstamo a integral, con la buena intención de comprar mayor cantidad de harina, azúcar, miel, y muchos otros ingredientes que son vitales para la realización de este oficio. Para Nelson es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar su negocio ya que su extensa familia lo necesita mucho, esto debido a que es la única manera de ganarse la vida. Así mismo sus hijos se encuentran muy orgullosos de su padre ya que siempre lo han visto trabajar y esforzarse al completo por ellos.
texts.en:
Nelson Jaime P. L. is 39 years old, and he has a bakery. In the bakery he makes different types of bread, be it sweet or salty. The bakery is in his own house, which is located in Santa Tecla in the La Libertad department. He lives with his wife and their five children. They are between 5 and 19 years old, and they go to school. Nelson has had the bakery for 20 years, and he has won many customers. He has the experience to be able to improve his service and offer a greater variety of bread. Nelson’s business is very well established, and there are six bread deliverymen to leave the bread at each customer’s business. Nelson is asking Integral for a loan to buy a larger quantity of flour, sugar, honey, and a lot of other ingredients that are vital to do this job. It is very important to Nelson to be able to improve his business because his extended family needs it a lot. That is because it is his only way of earning a living. His children are very proud of their father because they have always seen him work and put forth all of his effort for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, shortening, and other products to make bread

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane G. is 38 years old, married to Julius Kinyua, and they have a nine-month-old baby girl.  Jane runs a private primary school in Ndunyu Njeru, a rural town in Kenya.  The school opened its doors in 2004 and has seen tremendous growth with student numbers rising to over 60 in just four years.  Considering it’s a private school in a rural town, that’s a great achievement.  Due to the increase in the number of students, she wants to build another classroom to accommodate the ever-increasing number of students.

While seeking for a financier, she was introduced to KADET by her friend and she applied for this loan, which is her first with the organization.

Through more funding from KADET, she hopes to grow her school by building new classes and she has a target of getting over 500 students within the next five years.

loans.use: To build another classroom

loans.name: Remaz

texts.en:
Remaz is a 31-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife. Remaz has owned a clothing shop for four years. He sells men's clothes, as well as shoes, men's accessories like belts, perfumes, bracelets and more; he also sells men's suits. 

Remaz is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and offer a good quality of merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he faced competition. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop since the new season is coming. This is the first time that Remaz has requested a loan.
 
In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his men's shop

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 50-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Emad has been working as a builder for twenty years now. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 

He is special in his work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he already had experience and had built up networking. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: María Gumercinda

texts.es: María Gumercinda D. C. D. C. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado D. una empresa privada y junto a su suegra. María es una mujer muy trabajadora quien no se queda D. brazos cruzados ante la situación tan difícil que vive junto a su familia, es por esta razón que ella se encarga D. vender medicinas naturales, las cuales comercializa desD. hace 5 años atrás, por diferentes pueblos D. Oriente D. país, tales como La Unión y San Miguel. Cada día María se dispone a vender su producto D. forma ambulante, ofreciéndolos  a muy buenos precios. Así también es gracias a la confiabilidad que María ha brindado a las personas y sumándosele todos sus años D. experiencia, que  es porque posee muchos clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a través D. cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar medicinas, esto debido a que en su mayoría, venD. su producto a crédito, y muchas ocasiones no cuenta con el dinero necesario para aumentar su inventario. Esto lo hace sobre todo con las intenciones D. poder ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos D. hogar, D. manera que puedan contar con una mejorar estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and resides in Morazán Department. She lives with her husband who is an employee in a private enterprise, and with her mother-in-law. María is a very hard working woman who doesn't stand around with arms crossed when faced with the difficult situation she and her family endures. That's why she began selling natural medicines some 5 years ago in communities in the east, such as La Unión and San Miguel. Each day she sets out on foot to sell her products, offering very good prices. The confidence she stirs in people, plus her many years of experience, is why she has so many customers. She requests a loan in order to have the money necessary to buy the medicines, because in most cases, she sells her products on credit and often, she lacks the money necessary to augment her inventory. She does this primarily with the intention of helping her husband with the costs of the home, so that they can count on greater economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NATURAL MEDICINES TO SELL

loans.name: Klara Group

texts.en:
The group name is 'Klara'; it is made up of three ladies who are living in the region of the Aley, Mount Lebanon. 

-Ihssan is a 40-year-old married woman who has five children. Ihssan has been producing handicrafts for twenty years. She also does embroidery. This is the first time that Ihssan has requested a loan. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase supplies such as thread and some accessories. 

Ihssan is special in her work because of her experience and of her good taste in her work. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties except making herself known by the public and offering original products. She decided on doing her business because she has good networking, thanks to her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her work. 

-Yassmien is a 26-year-old single woman. Yassmien has been working as a seamstress for fifteen years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials like thread and accessories for her work. This is the first time that Yassmien has requested a loan. 
 
She is special in her work because she likes it and does it well. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Yassmien decided on doing her work because of her need to provide for herself. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Rwaydah is a 25-year-old married woman who has one child. Rwaydah has been selling scarves from her home for five years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new scarves like pashminas and thinner scarves for the spring season. This is the first time that Rwaydah has requested a loan. 

Rwaydah is special in her work because of her good quality of products. Her customers can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Rwaydah decided on doing her work to raise her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase goods needed for their businesses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen L. D. M. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Osicala, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, y dos hijos D. 8 y 5 cinco años D. edad, y una pequeña niña D. 1 año D. edad. Carmen se dedica a la venta D. productos plásticos, como depósitos para comida, o para agua como también pequeñas sillas. Así mismo venD. deferentes tipos D. cosméticos. Todos estos productos los comercializa D. manera ambulante, obteniendo ganancias diarias, las cuales en su mayoría son invertidas en su familia y en el hogar, situación la cual le impiD. en gran manera invertir en el negocio, lo que le dificulta crecer. Es por esta razón por la cual Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo a Integral, D. manera que pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. cosméticos, D. manera que tenga la capacidad D. ofrecer diferentes tipos y precios D. maquillajes, lo cual le permita abarcar más clientela. Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza a diario por el bienestar D. su familia, ya que ella desea poder darles todo lo mejor a sus tres hijos, D. manera que nunca les haga falta lo más básicos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old and lives in the municipality of Osicala, located in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband and two sons, ages 8 and 5, and baby daughter, age 1. Carmen sells plastic products, such as food or water storage containers. She also sells small chairs and different types of cosmetics. She sells all of these products on foot, making a daily income, most of which she must spend on her family and on household expenses. This makes it difficult for her to invest in her business and making it difficult for her to grow it. For this reason, Carmen is requesting a loan through Integral, so that she can have the necessary funds to buy cosmetics in bulk, so that she can offer various types at various prices, allowing her to attract more customers. Carmen works hard every day for the well-being of her family. She would like to give only the best to her three children and ensure that they are never in need of their basic requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Al Kareem Group

texts.en:
The group name is 'A. Kareem'; it is made up of three ladies who are living in the region of the Aley, Mount Lebanon. 

-Mona is a 62-year-old married woman who has four children. Mona has been selling Tupperware for seven years. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. 

Mona is speciA. in her work because of her experience in sales. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she has good networking. In the future, she plans on expanding her work. 

-Majid is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. Majid has owned a fruit and vegetable shop for two years. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. 

She is speciA. in her work because she is welcoming. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Majid decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family income and have a work for her own. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Nabila is a 56-year-old married woman who has three children. Nabila has been selling clothes from her home for seven years. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the new collection. This is the first time that Nabila has requested a loan.
 
She is speciA. in her work because of her good quality of products. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Nabila decided on doing her work to support her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her Tupperware business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Danaya ont en moyenne  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Djinina dans la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires, du sucre, du poisson séché, des tubercules et de la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  6 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires, des colis de poissons séchés et des ingrédients pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  en gros en condiments alimentaires à Bamako (capitale du Mali), à Mopti pour le poisson et  sur place pour les autres articles. Elles effectuent leurs ventes, à Djinina, au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group have an average age of 38 years old and an average of four children each; they all live in extended traditional families in Djinina in the sub-prefecture of Konobougou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other through relatives, and they trade in food products such as condiments, sugar, dried fish and tubers, as well as doing some catering. Having repaid the six previous loans without incident, the women of the Danaya group are on their seventh group loan, which will be used to buy a large quantity of condiments, parcels of dried fish and ingredients for catering. They get their supplies of condiments wholesale in Bamako (the capital of Mali), their fish in Mopti and the other items locally. They sell their products in Djinina, at the market in Konobougou town and in surrounding fairs, for cash, on a retail basis and on credit to a customer base made up of women and men. They are expecting to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 FCFA each, which will be used for expenses relating to health, food, school fees; the rest will be reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Fousseiny

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Fousseiny S. est marié à une femme et n’a pas d’enfant. Il est né le 02 Octobre 1979 à Sanzanan, un des  villages de la préfecture de Sikasso - 3eme région administrative  de la république du Mali.   Il vit dans sa maison avec son épouse à Loulouni.
Depuis maintenant 8 ans Fousseiny  mène son  activité de commerce d’articles divers. Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce,  il le fait avec assez de réussite. 
Il est à sa deuxième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et  le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Il compte acheter avec ce deuxième prêt, 10 douzaines de tasses, des baignoires, des seaux, des louches et des assiettes en plastique. 
Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans les localités de Loulouni au comptant ou à crédit, au marché de Loulouni les jours de foire (au comptant) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mr Fousseiny S. is married and has no children; he lives at home with his wife in Loulouni. He was born on the 2nd of October 1979 in Sanzanan, a village in the Sikasso municipality, the third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali. For the past eight years Fousseiny has made his living by selling various products, and thanks to years of experience is very successful. He is working with Soro Yiriwaso for the second time, after his first loan was successfully repaid. He aims to use his second loan to buy ten dozen cups, bathtubs, buckets, ladles and plastic plates. He sources his goods in bulk from the Sikasso market and takes cash or credit sales in Loulouni and cash-only sales at the Loulouni market from a male and female customer base. He anticipates generating a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA which will primarily be used to increase his business funds.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic cooking utensils.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Virginia es casada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Virginia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Virginia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras.
Los sueños de Virginia son mejorar su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the Ruby Community Bank. Virginia is 46 years old and is married with 3 children. Virginia has a stall at the April 12th Market where she sells vegetables daily. Virginia needs a loan of 1050 soles with which she will buy vegetables. Virginia's dreams are to improve their home and educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nely Carmela

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Nely es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Nely tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Americas en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada.
Nely necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel.
Nely sueña son tener un restaurante y que sus hijos sean profesional.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the Ruby Community Bank. Nely is 35 years old and married with 2 children. Nely has a stall in the Las Americas Market where she sells food daily early in the morning. Nely needs a loan of 1800 soles to invest the the purchase of rice, sugar, oil and paper. Nely’s dreams are to have a restaurant and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil and paper.

loans.name: Severina

texts.es:
Severina es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Severina es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Severina viaja 3 veces por semana a las diferentes ferias D. la región  en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras y D. las ferias compra quesos y cereales.
Severina necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. verduras y bolsas.
Los sueños D. Severina son salir adelante y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Severine is a member of the Ruby Community Bank. Severine is 50 years old and is married with 7 children. Severina travels 3 times a week to different fairs in the region where she sells groceries, vegetables and buys cheese and cereal. Severina needs a loan of 1050 soles to be invested in the purchase of vegetables and bags. Severina's dreams are to get ahead and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and bags.

loans.name: Edith Sofia

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Edith es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Edith vende ropa, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Edith trabaja en un Jardín como auxiliar.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, polos.
El sueño de Edith es tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Twenty-five years old, she is a live-in partner and has one child. Edith sells clothing to friends and relatives and works in a garden as an assistant. Edith needs a loan of $425 to invest in sweaters and Polo shirts. Edith's dream is to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters and Polo shirts

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Victoria se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos de la región, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a tiendas y también en el mercado.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar y levadura.
Los sueños de Victoria son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su horno.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Twenty-seven years old, she is a live-in partner and has one child. In a rented oven, she bakes breads which are typical of her region. She sells to stores and also in the market. Victoria needs a loan of $500 to purchase flour, sugar, and yeast. Victoria's dream is to buy land on which to build her oven.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and yeast

loans.name: Marilu Norma

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Marilu es soltera y tiene 28 años, Marilu tiene una botica llamada Farmasol, en un local alquilado, tiene un personal que le apoya en la atención, también vende ropa de niños y recargas telefónicas.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
Los sueños de Marilu son tener casa propia y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. She is single and twenty-eight years old. In a rented site, she has a pharmacy called Farmasol. She has an employee who helps her with customers. She also sells children's clothing and recharges telephones. Muarilu needs a loan of $1050 for the purchase of medicines. Marilu's dreams are to have her own home and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines

loans.name: Megy

texts.es:
Megy es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Megy es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Megy se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos de la región, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a tiendas y también en el mercado.
Megy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, levadura y azúcar.
Los sueños de Megy son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y horno, comprar un carro para repartir sus productos.
texts.en:
Megy is a member of Iris Communal Bank. Megy is 29 years old and she and her partner have 1 son. Megy is dedicated to the production of typical regional breads, which she bakes in a rented oven. The breads are sold in stores as well as the local market. Megy needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of flour, yeast and sugar. Megy's dreams are to buy land for the construction of her house and oven and to buy a car to distribute her products.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Madame Sadio S. est une femme mariée, née vers 1959 à Sibiraso, un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Sadio est  mère de 4 enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux et leurs enfants à Gongebougou. 
Madame Sadio S.  n’a pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales et s’est très vite intéressée au commerce auprès de sa mère. Aguerrie par de nombreuses années passées dans cette activité, elle est  très expérimentée et jouit d’une notoriété sans égale.  
Après  4  prêts tous correctement remboursés, elle est  à son 5eme prêt solidaire. Madame Sadio S.  compte acheter avec son prêt, 20 sacs de maïs et 17 sacs de sorgho. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants  Loulouni et  à Nimbougou. Elle les revend au comptant aux marchés de Dallen, Nimbougou et Loulouni à une clientèle composée généralement d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. 
Elle ambitionne avoir un magasin et véhicule de transport de marchandises.
texts.en:
Ms. Sadio S. is a married woman who was born around 1959 in Sibiraso, a village in the prefecture of Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She is the mother of four children and lives in a traditional extended family with her husband and their children in Gongebougou. Ms. S. did not attend school for societal reasons and very quickly became interested in commerce from her mother. Hardened by numerous years in this business, she is very experienced and enjoys unparalleled fame. After four loans, all properly repaid, she is now on her fifth solidarity loan. She intends to use her loan to buy twenty sacks of corn and seventeen sacks of sorghum. She stocks up in the villages surrounding Loulouni and in Nimbougou. She makes her sales for cash at the markets of Dallen, Nimbougou, and Loulouni to customers compose generally of men. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for the most part for increasing her working capital. Her ambition is to have a store and a vehicle for transporting merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grain

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Antonia es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, además Antonia tiene un taller de confeccione de prendas.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fideo, arroz, leche, azúcar.
El sueño de Antonia es ir de vacaciones a otro país.
texts.en:
Antonia ia a member of group Lirio. She is married, 58 years old and has 7 children. Antonia has a general store where she sells household goods, meats and vegetables. As well, she has a shop where she makes clothes. Antonio needs a loan of 300 soles that will be invested in rice, beans, milk and sugar. Antonio`s dream is to go on vacation to another country.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of beans, rice, milk and sugar

loans.name: He Is Able Group

texts.en:
Abraham M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'He Is Able'. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children who range from 5 to 20 years old. He was only able to attend school through high school.

For 4 years, Abraham has been running his food shop at the Du-Port Road Junction in Paynesville. He sells good food and has a nice manner of interacting which keeps customers returning.  

Abraham plans to use his 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods.  His goal is to grow his business into a restaurant and to improve his family's living conditions.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Abraham is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Siaka O.  est marié à deux femmes et père de six  enfants. Il est né le 23 Août 1962 à Zanso un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo - 3eme région administrative du Mali.   Il vit dans sa maison dans le dit village avec ses épouses et ses enfants.
Il mène son commerce depuis maintenant 4 ans.  Très expérimenté, il le fait avec assez de réussite. 
Il est à sa sixième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous ses  prêts précédents ont  été remboursé sans aucune difficulté.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  2, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, petit mil, mil et riz). Il s’approvisionne à Zanso et dans les villages avoisinants. Il vend  souvent sur commande à Zanso mais la plupart de ses ventes se font au marché de Loulouni le jour de foire au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Siaka O. is married to two women and is the father of six children. He was born on August 23, 1962 in Zanso, a village in the prefecture of Kadiolo – 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He lives in his house in the aforementioned village with his wives and children. He has been operating his business for four years now. A very experienced man, Siaka has done fairly well in it. He is on his sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. And all of his preceding loans have been repaid without any difficulties at all. He intends to use his loan to buy 2.5 tonnes of grain (corn, pearl millet, millet, and rice). He stocks up in Zanso and in neighboring villages. He often sells on special order in Zanso, but most of his sales are made at the Loulouni market on market days. He accepts cash from customers composed of women and men. He envisions making a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for the most part for increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grain

loans.name: Dunia Mayela

texts.es: Doña Dunia es una mujer emprendedora, de 41 años de edad, se dedica al negocio de  venta de ropa, muebles y comida desde hace varios años, el cual inicio con dinero que su esposo dio, producto de su trabajo en mecánica automotriz. Juntos  han construido su casa toda de concreto y con las ganancias de sus ventas también ayuda con los gastos básicos de agua,  luz y gastos de estudios de sus dos hijos. Pero a un le hace falta construir la cocina es por eso la necesidad de este préstamo para comenzar ante del invierno el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, madera y zinc para comenzar la obra, y poder estar en mejores condiciones de trabajo. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para lograr mejores márgenes de ganancias, como mejor equilibrio en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Dunia is a hard working woman who is 41 years old. She has sold clothes, furniture and food for many years. She started this activity with money her husband gave her, product of his work as a mechanic. Together they have constructed a house made entirely of concrete. The profits from their sales help with costs like water, electricity and school fees for their two children. Still they have yet to construct a kitchen and it is for this that they need a loan to begin before winter. They will buy constuction materials like stone, sand, cement, wrought iron, wood, and metal roofing to begin the work which can be in better conditions. Their plans are to continue investing in their business to obtain better profit margins, to balance their sales.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, wrought iron and metal roofing to begin to construct a kitchen

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Isabel es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Isabel vende carne al por mayor, Isabel viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde compra ganado, además Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche.
Los sueños de Isabel son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 37 year old member of the Lirio Communal Bank who is married with 3 children. She sells meat wholesale and travels to different fairs to buy stock. Isabel also has a grocery store at home. She needs a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase sugar, rice, and milk. Isabel's dreams are to purchase a car to transport her products and to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, and milk

loans.name: Alba Luz
