texts.es: La señora Alba tiene la edad de 53 años, Vive en el barrio 380, su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos, pues fue herencia de su esposo el cual falleció hace mucho tiempo. Fue difícil afrontar esta perdida, pero tiene nietos a quien apoyar. Anteriormente tenia una pulpería que por ventas bajas cerro, Es por eso comenzaron con el negocio del alquiler el cual ha sido su fuente de ingreso. Con este préstamo va a dar mantenimiento a las habitaciones para dar un mejor servicio y tener mejores costos. El cual comprara zinc para mejorar el techo, pintura para pintar las habitaciones, hacer mejoras en los baños. El cual espera captar clientes nuevos y mejorar sus ingresos. Gracias a los financiamientos de la institución ha mejorado la infraestructura de su negocio el cual se siente contenta por hacer posible esta inversión.
texts.en:
Alba is 53 years old and lives in the "Barrio 380" neighborhood. She has a business renting rooms, which she inherited from her husband who died a long time ago. It was difficult to deal with this loss, but she has grandchildren to support. Previously she had a small grocery store that she closed due to low sales. For this reason they started with the business of renting rooms, which has been her main source of income. With this loan she will do maintenance on the rooms so that she can provide better service and have lower costs. Specifically, she will buy sheets of corrugated metal to improve the roof, she will paint the rooms, and will make improvements to the bathrooms. With these improvements she hopes to attract new customers and improve her income. Thanks to financing from this institution she has improved the infrastructure of her business, and she feels very pleased now to be able to make this new investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her rented rooms: repair the roof, paint, and improve the bathrooms.

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssouf D. est marié à deux  femmes et père de 3 enfants.  Il est né le 1er Décembre 1981 à Kaï, commune rurale de la sous préfecture de Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Il vit dans sa maison avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à Kaï.
Il est commerçant  depuis plusieurs années. Il  fait l’achat et la vente d’articles divers  de boutique et  le commerce de céréales sèches. Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce, Il les mène avec réussite.
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il compte acheter,  3 paquets d’articles divers pour sa boutique et 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs et mil). Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et au marché de Loulouni les jours de foire auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Il vend au comptant ou à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf D. has two wives and is the father of three children. He was born on December 1, 1981 in Kai, a rural community in the subprefecture of Loulouni, prefecture of Kadiolo, the third administrative district of Mail. He lives in his house in Kai together with his wives and children. He purchases and resells various everyday goods and dry cereals. He has been engaged in this activity for many years, and his experience allows him to manage his business well. This is his first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiwaso. He plans to purchase three bags of various articles for his shop and two tons of cereals (corn and millet). He buys his stock in the town of Sikasso and at the Loulouni market on market day from farmers and wholesale traders. He sells for cash or on credit (wholesale and retail) to a customer base that is composed of both men and women. He anticipates having a monthly revenue of approximately 65,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to boost his business capital and the other part will be put away as savings since he would like to build a house for his family in the town of Sikasso.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cereals and everyday goods for resale

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Rayda es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Rayda vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
Rayda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
El sueño de Rayda es tener una tienda de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Rayda is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. She lives with her life partner, is 29 years old and has one son. Rayda sells catalogue cosmetics to her friends and family members. Rayda needs a 900 sol loan to buy cosmetics. Rayda's dream is to have a cosmetics store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe Lafia quatre femmes mariées et une veuve, ont  en moyenne  35 ans, 5 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro, un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur douzième  prêt solidaire.  Tous les précédents prêts ont été  remboursés sans difficulté.
Elles font l’achat et la  vente  de tasses, de pomme de terre,  de tomates et de tissus.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 douzaines de tasses en plastique, 5sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, 12 paniers de tomates fraiches et  une vingtaine de complet pour hommes et femmes en tissus. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville, dans les villages avoisinants et au Burkina faso. Elles vendent aux marchés de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Lafia group, four married women and a widow, are on the average 35 years old, have 5 children, and mostly live in polygamous marriages in Kamelen Sirakoro, a village in the Sikasso community, the 3rd administrative district in Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better satisfy their customers’ demands, and this would be their 12th joint loan. All previous loans have been repaid without any issues. They purchase and resell cups, potatoes, tomatoes and fabrics. With this new loan, they plan to purchase five dozens of plastic cups, five bags of potatoes (100 kg or about 220 lbs each), 12 baskets of fresh tomatoes and fabric for about 20 outfits for men and women. They purchase their supplies in the market of the town of Sikasso, in the villages nearby and in Burkina Faso. They sell their goods at the markets of Kamalen Sirakoro, on the street or in their homes, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. They plan to reach a medium monthly income of approximately 35,500 West African Francs for each member of the group; a part of that income would be used for their families’ needs and for savings, and the rest invested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles for resale

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Alejandrina tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zanahoria.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member ofl the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. Alejandrina is married, 45 years old and has 4 children. Alejandrina has a vegetable stand in the city's wholesale food market; she is open for business every day. Alejandrina needs a 1250 sol loan to buy carrots. Alejandrina's dream is to have a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carrots.

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.es:
Umbelina es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Umbelina es casada, tiene 64 años y 6 hijos, Umbelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. lanas, hilos, loceria y otros productos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Umbelina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. hilos.
Umbelina sueña con tener su negocio en el centro D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Umbelina is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. She is married, 64 years old, and has six children. She has a stand in Mariscal Cáceres market where she sells wool, thread, dinnerwear and other products every day. Umbelina needs a 1000 sol loan to buy thread. Umbelina dreams with having a store downtown.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread.

loans.name: Mougnoun Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Mougnoun sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 37 ans et 4  enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kamalen  Sirakoro, un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire.  Tous les prêts  précédents  se sont dénoués. 
Elles font la vente  d’arachide, d’atiecké, de poissons frais, de chaussures et de  pagnes.  
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 150kg  de grains d‘arachides, 100kg d’atiécké, 10kg de poissons, 3 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et  10 pièces de pagnes real. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent aux marchés de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the Lafia group are married women who, on the average, are 37 years old and have 4 children, and who mostly live in polygamous marriages in Kamalen Sirakoro, a village in the Sikasso community, the 3rd administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better satisfy their customers’ demands, and this would be their fourth joint loan. All previous loans have been repaid. They sell peanuts, atiécké (a starchy food made from cassava), fresh fish, shoes and pagnes (a type of West African wrap cloth). With this new loan, they plan to purchase 150 kg ( 330 lbs) of peanuts, 100 kg (220 lbs) of atiecke, 10 kg (22 lbs) of fish, 3 dozen pairs of plastic shoes and 10 sets of pagnes. They purchase their stock in the market of the town of Sikasso and in the nearby villages. They sell their goods at the markets of Kamalen Sirakoro, on the street or at home, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. They plan to reach a medium monthly income of approximately 23,500 West African Francs for each member of the group; a part of that income would be used for savings and for their families’ needs, and the rest invested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles for resale

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Eulogia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Eulogia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eulogia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Eulogia son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa con material noble.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. She lives with her life partner, is 40 years old, and has two children. Eulogia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and meats every day. Eulogia needs a 900 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Eulogia's dream is to enlarge her store and to build her house with substantial materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: New Foundation Business Group

texts.en:
T. H. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called New Foundation Business. He is 42 years old, married, and has four children who range from 12 to 21 years old.  He is a bachelor degree holder.

For 10 years, T. has been running his medicine store at the Jacob Town and GSA road intersection in Paynesville. He sells standard drugs and talks to customers in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

T. plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more medicine.  His goal is to own more medicine stores and live an improved life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, T. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Sabali,  trois femmes mariées et deux veuves  ont en moyenne  42 ans  et 5 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kamalen  Sirakoro, un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire.  Tous les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font la vente  de condiments alimentaires, de chaussures en plastique, du charbon de bois et du poisson fumé.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  5 colis  de condiments, 85 sacs de 100kg de charbon de bois, 12 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et  35 kg de poisson fumé. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans  les villages avoisinants.  Elles vendent aux marchés de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabali group (three are married and two are widows) are on average 42 years of age and have five children. Most live in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, one of the villages in the Sikasso area, in the third administrative region of Mali. They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs and are now requesting a tenth group loan. All preceding loans have been correctly repaid. They sell food condiments, plastic shoes, charcoal and smoked fish. With the loan they intend to buy: • 5 packages of condiments • 85 100-kilo bags of charcoal • 12 dozen pairs of plastic shoes • 35 kilos of smoked fish They go to the central market in Sikasso and in area villages to resupply. They sell in the markets of Kamalen Sirakoro, as itinerant vendors or from their homes, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 20,500 FCFA each, part of which will be used for savings and family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is aged 41, married with five children, and her oldest child is 19 years old. She provides catering services for her clients, which she started some years ago. She works hard to ensure she gives the best service to her customers.

Victoria is asking for a loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more baking items – baking flour, baking powder, and more in bulk, as this will enable her to get better discounts and make more profits. She promises to pay back promptly and says a big thank you all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking items in bulk.

loans.name: Thelma Olimpia

texts.es: Doña Thelma de 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Sebastián, tiene un hijo mayor, su esposo trabaja como conductor de cabezal, desde hace varios años inicio su negocio con apoyo de su esposo, compro ropa usada primero vendiendo solo en su barrio, y cercanías pero luego compro mas y comenzó a vender en los departamentos en donde le quedaba mas ganancias. Luego nació la iniciativa de un video juegos en su casa que junto a su hijo administran ahora, y sigue teniendo su venta de ropa de segunda mano que se vende por ser bonita, buena y accesibles de precios. Con este financiamiento lo que desea es compra dos video juegos para dar mejor atención a sus clientes ya que a veces se llena y hace falta es por eso la necesidad de esta inversión, así como invertir en pacas también para seguir ofreciendo su ropa, el cual le deja buena ganancias.
texts.en:
Thelma, 50, lives in the San Sebastián neighborhood. She has an adult son, and her husband drives an industrial truck. Some years ago she started her business with the support of her husband. She bought used clothing and started to sell initially just in her neighborhood and surrounding areas. Later she bought more and started to sell in other departments (regions) where she could earn more income. Later she took the initiative along with her son to set up a video game parlor in her house, which her son manages now. She continues to sell second-hand clothing that is in good condition, attractive, and affordable in price. With this loan she wants to buy 2 video games to provide better service to her customers, since at times the business is full, and so she needs to make this investment. In addition, she will invest in some bales of clothing so that she can continue to offer her clothing, which gives her good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 video games to provide better service to her customers, and to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Leonilda es casada, tiene 65 años y 9 hijos, Leonilda teje a mano chompas, colchas, ropa de bebes, y otras prendas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Leonilda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo, lana, tela.
Los sueños de Leonilda son tener una tienda de abarrotes y construir el tercer piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. Leonilda is 65 years old, married and has 9 children. Leonilda hand knits sweaters, bedspreads, baby clothes and other articles of clothing every day. She needs a 2000 sol loan to buy thread, wool and fabric. Leonilda's dream is to have a grocery store and to build a third story on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool and fabric.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells foodstuffs like groundnut oil, tomato paste and frozen food. She sells to sustain herself and family financially. She supports her husband in providing for her family's needs – food, clothing, etc. She has been in this trade business for the past eight years; she said her business has experienced great improvement since she joined LAPO Microfinance.

Thanks to LAPO organization and KIVA lenders who have greatly improved my business and family lives, she is grateful to all.

Mary is requesting a loan of NGN70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell and promises to repay at the due date. Once again thank you to all lenders.
Mary is 42 years old, married with three children, and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguitougou sont  des femmes mariées, ayant en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier pour l’assainissement. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers (alimentaires, habillements, artisanat etc.)
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce  elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont  à leur 9ème  prêt solidaire  après avoir remboursés les huit précédents.
 Elles comptent acheter, avec ce nouveau prêt,  20 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 complets de pagnes brodés, deux  rouleaux de voiles, 10 couvres lits et 200kg de poissons frais qui seront transformés en poissons fumés. Parfois elles se ravitaillent en poisson fumé à Mopti pendant les périodes de soudure. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso, au grand marché et au marché Château de Ségou. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile, en ambulant et aux marchés de Médine et Château. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCA qui servira  dans le remboursement du prêt, à l’épargne et à l’achat de denrées de 1ère nécessité.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguitougou group are married women who have an average age of 41 years old, an average of three children and all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through neighbors and relatives and also because they all belong to the same traditional women's sanitation association. This group of women are primarily trading a variety of articles (foods, clothes, crafts etc..). With a view to increasing their business they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, and they are on their ninth group loan, having repaid the eight previous loans. With this new loan they are planning on buying 20 pieces of "pagne-wax" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric), 15 sets of embroidered "pagnes", two rolls of netting, ten bedcovers and 200kg of fresh fish which will be transformed into smoked fish. Sometimes, during the lean season (in between harvests), they stock up on smoked fish in Mopti. They get their supplies at the large market in Burkina Faso and at the Château de Ségou market. They sell on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women, at home, walking around and at the markets in Médina and Château. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, as well as for savings and for the purchase of basic foods.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Maria es soltera, tiene 63 años y 1 hijo, Maria vende panes típicos en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas, además Maria se dedica al hilado de lana.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes y lana.
Maria sueña con mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. Maria is single, 63 years old, and has a son. She sells traditional bread in the city's bus terminals every morning; she also knits wool. Maria needs a 1000 sol loan to buy bread and wool. Maria dreams with making home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread and wool.

loans.name: Sandra Jaqueline

texts.es: Sandra Jaqueline A. C. de 32 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, en las cercanías de la playa del Puerto de la Libertad. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 15,11 y 3 años de edad. Sandra reside en un rancho frente a la playa, el cual se encarga de cuidar ya que no es de su propiedad; a pesar de esto ella tiene permiso para hacer diferentes ventas dentro del lugar, de manera que pueda ganarse su sustento diario. Ella hace y vende cocteles de conchas, desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo vende jugos y sodas. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de mariscos, los cuales son la materia prima para la elaboración de sus ventas, y así mismo más bebidas. Ella desea invertir más en su negocio, sobretodo en esta temporada en la cual se aproximan las vacaciones de verano, tiempo en el cual la afluencia de turistas a las playas aumenta sorprendentemente. Esto le dejara muchas ganancias y le permitirá ahorrar para el bienestar de sus tres hijos los cuales dependen por completo de ella, ya que Sandra es madre soltera, la cual trabaja muy duro por seguir adelante junto a su familia. Razón por la cual ella deposita sus esperanzas de mejorar en su negocio con el préstamo obtenido por Integral.
texts.en:
Sandra Jaqueline A. C., 32, lives in La Libertad department near Puerto de la Libertad's beaches. She lives with her three children, who are 15, 11 and 3 years of age. Sandra lives in a rustic dwelling facing the beach; she watches over the property but does not own it. Despite this, she has permission to use the place for her sales so that she can earn her daily support. She makes and sells conch cocktails, breakfasts and lunches; she also sells juices and soft-drinks. Sandra is asking for funding so that she can buy larger quantities of seafood, which is her main raw ingredient for her sales, as well as more beverages. She wants to invest more in her business, especially now when summer vacation is about to start, a time when the number of tourists coming to the beach increases dramatically. This will generate much profit for her and will allow for some savings for the wellbeing of her three children, who are completely dependent on her because Sandra's a single mother. She works very hard to get her family ahead in life. For this reason, she is hopeful that her business will improve with help from Integral's loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood and beverages.

loans.name: Prosperity Group

texts.en: Dehkontee M. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Prosperity Group. She is 40 years old, single, and has two children who are 9 and 15 years old. She is a high school graduate. For 15 years Dehkontee has been selling coconuts at the Red Light Market which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells very good quality coconuts which keeps customers returning. Dehkontee plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more coconuts. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her living conditions. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Dehkontee is the one holding the sign. Oretha B. is inset at lower left. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Jesucita

texts.es:
Jesucita es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Jesucita es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Jesucita viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas y D. las ferias compra quesos que venD. en el mercado. Además Jesucita tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Jesucita necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Jesucita son construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesucita is a member of the El Roble (oak tree) Communal Bank. Jesucita is married and 35 years old with 2 children. Jesucita travels to different markets of her region where she sells vegetables and fruits and purchases cheeses which she resells. Jesucita also has a grocery shop in her home.

Jesucita needs a loan of 900 soles. She will invest this money in the purchase of rice and sugar. Her goals are to enlarge her house and offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of United Women (Banco Mujer Mujeres Unidas) Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Bank of United Women (Banco Mujer Mujeres Unidas) Group is comprised of eight women members from Bratsi, Limón, a rural area located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Each member has applied for a loan of 200,000 colons which will be used to make general investments in the expansion of their productive activities.

The women of this group are engaged in various entrepreneurial projects including plantain harvesting, the rearing and sale of livestock (poultry products) and the purchase of catalogue products for resale.

Specifically, this loan will be used to finance the purchase of all necessary materials, nutrients, and equipment that are used to plant and harvest plantains. Additionally, this loan will be used to increase working capital and facilitate the purchase of various household and clothing products which will be sold at a later date in the Bratsi community. Finally, this loan will enable group members to buy livestock (chickens) and animal feed to ensure the good health of animals and, in turn, guarantee a high quality final product.

According to the group, a common goal is to secure a steady stream of revenues in order to maintain a constant level of working capital. This will allow the women to continually re-invest in their businesses and attract new clients. The women hope to increase sales so they will be able to use the revenues to help pay for their children´s studies.

The women of this group face many obstacles. The lack of job opportunities in Bratsi has led the members to take it upon themselves to create a way to make a living. The hot and humid climate of the Caribbean region creates an environment where livestock become susceptible to diseases. Maintaining the health of their animals has been a constant struggle for the members of this group. For the women involved in the planting and harvest of plantains, flooding has caused problems. As they cannot predict when a flood might occur, their livelihoods are at the mercy of Mother Nature.

A major obstacle for all the women of this group has been a lack of financial resources to develop their entrepreneurial activities. This loan will help extend the reach of financial services to a poor community of hardworking women.

The name of this group, ¨United Women¨, symbolizes the philosophy of solidarity and support expressed amongst members. These women have banded together because, they say, ¨individually it would be more difficult for us.¨

Sara M. G. is the president of this group. This will be her second loan with Fundación Mujer. Sara is in the business of rearing and selling chickens and eggs. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of livestock and animal feed in order to expand her business and sell more poultry products.

loans.use: To invest in plantain harvesting, catalogue products and the purchase of livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Sérieux sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier pour l’assainissement. 
Ce groupe fait essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 3 ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  25 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 complets de pagnes brodés, un colis de friperie, 3 cartons de pommades, 2 sacs de riz et  8 sacs de mil. 
Ces céréales seront transformées en galettes traditionnellement (fourou-fourou et mommi). Pour préparer de la galette, on décortique les céréales, les débarrasse des sons, les lave, les transforme en semoule, les pétris avec de la bouillie enrichie de sel ou de sucre selon la convenance de la clientèle puis on ajoute un peu de levure. La pâte ainsi obtenue est ensuite grillée pour avoir de la galette. 
Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes, friperie et pommades à Bamako (capitale du Mali), quand aux autres produits, au grand marché de Ségou et dans les foires de Konodimini, Siribala et Boussin.  Elles revendent, en détail,  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au marché Château. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé dans les soins de santé des enfants et comme épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sérieux group are married women, the majority living in polygamous families. They are on average 34 years old with four children. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and met through neighbors, relatives and their belonging to the same women's traditional neigborhood association for sanitization. This group essentially trades in a variety of items. Having repaid two previous loans without incident, they are on their third group loan, which will be used to buy 25 pieces of "pagnes-wax" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric), five sets of embroidered "pagnes", a parcel of second-hand clothes, three boxes of ointments, two bags of rice and eight bags of millet. These cereals will be made into traditional flat cakes ("fourou-fourou" and "mommi"). To make the flat cake, one has to hull the cereals, take out the bran, wash them, make them into semolina, fill them with either a salty or sweet mushy cereal according to the customer's taste, then add a bit of yeast. The resulting dough is then grilled to produce the flat cake. They get their supplies of "pagnes", second-hand clothes and creams in Bamako (the capital of Mali), and their other products at the big market in Ségou and at the fairs in Konodimini, Siribala and Boussin. They retail these products for cash or on credit to a customer base made up of men and women, at home, and wandering through the various neighborhoods and at the Château market. They plan to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA. This profit will be used to cover the children's healthcare and for savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase wood to make more furniture

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina B. D. M. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a Carlos M. quien es su esposo y junto a su único hijo D. 18 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Cristina posee su negocio propio, el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, negocio el cual inicio con el deseo D. poder mejorar la economía familiar, razón por la cual el esposo D. Cristina logro ponerla con mucho esfuerzo, dicho negocio inició con muy pocos productos, todo lo que la capacidad económica D. Carlos le permitiera invertir en un inicio, poco a poco el negocio ha ido creciendo pero aún falta mucho. Es por esta razón que Cristina acudió a integral con el deseo D. obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar su inventario, sobre todo con aquellos productos los cuales se piden mucho en el lugar. Todo esto es con el enorme deseo D. poder mejorar su calidad D. vida, y poder vivir D. una manera más relajada en cuanto a la economía familiar, ya que las ganancias percibidas son D. mucha ayuda para poder solventar gran parte D. los gastos del hogar, lo cual le permite a Carlos poder invertir más en los estudios D. su hijo. Cristina es una mujer muy resposnable y trabajadora, quien se dedica por completo a la tienda y a los quehaceres del hogar, la cual siempre atienD. a sus clientes D. la mejor manera, ya que es gracias a estos que ella pueD. obtener sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Cristina B. D. M., 59, lives in San Miguel department with her husband, Carlos M. and their only son, who is 18 years old and a student. Cristina has her own business, which is a grocery store. She started her business wanting to improve her family’s economy. Her husband, with much effort, managed to launch the business. It started off with few inventory items; it was all that their finances permitted. Gradually, however, the business has grown but it still lacks many products. For this reason, Cristina has called upon Integral hoping to get a loan that will allow her to increase her stock inventory, above all with such products that are in highest demand in her location. She does all this with the great desire to be able to improve her quality of life and to live in a more relaxed way with respect to family finances because profits earned are of great help to meet household expenses. This then allows Carlos to be able to invest more in the education of their children. Cristina is a very responsible and hard-working woman who is completely dedicated to her store and to her household chores. She always takes care of her customers in the best way possible because, it’s thanks to them, that she can obtain her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Paula del Socorro G. , tiene 50 años de edad es casada y su marido, es jubilado, ella es profesora de un colegio, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y profesionales, la menor esta actualmente estudiando la univeridad.

Dentro de las principales prioridades de la familia, esta la remodelación de su hogar, para esto ella solicita un prestamo para la construccion del porche de su casa, con el dinero quiere entechar y acondicionar para que toda su familia goze de un espacio mas confortable, dentro de los planes que tiene tambien esta la compra de un vehiculo, espera que se le apoye económicamente para ayudarla a mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Paula del Socorro G., age 50, is married. Her husband is retired. She is a teacher at a high school. Most of her children are grown and work as professionals. Her youngest currently is studying at university.

Among the principal priorities of the family is the remodeling of their home. That’s why she is applying for a loan for the construction of a porch for her house. She wants to roof it and set it up so that her family can enjoy a more comfortable space. Among the plans that she has is the purchase of a vehicle. She hopes that she can provide economic support to her family in order to help improve their standard if living.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch for her hosue

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To puchase additional milk, sardines and onions.

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es: Ania es una joven, de 25 años de edad, vive en el barrio  las Ameritas, casada, su esposo es policía, tiene una pulpería que inicio hace un año en donde vende una variedad de productos, inicio este negocio con ahorros y liquidación de su trabajo el cual renuncio con el objetivo de poder crecer y administrar su propio negocio. Ella aun no tiene casa propia, pero si tiene un terreno que su mama dio, que espera pronto poder comenzar hacer su casa ya que es lo que mas anhela. Junto a su esposo alquilan la casa en donde viven, con este financiamiento desea invertir en compras como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, cereales, gaseosas, productos enlatados, lácteos, huevos, pollo y carne para aumentar las ventas y cada día lograr un mejor capital que espera con las ganancias ahorrar para la construcción de su casa. El cual espera lograr con estos financiamientos que le permita gozar de mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Ania is a 25-year-old young woman who lives in the Ameritas neighborhood with her husband who is a policeman. She has a small general store in her house that she started a year ago. She started this business with savings and severance pay from a job she recently left, hoping to grow and manage her own business. She still doesn't have her own home, but does has some land her mother gave her that would to able to start building her house on -- this is what she most longs. She and her husband are renting a home. With this loan she would like to invest in the purchase of: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, sweets, cereals, soft drinks, canned goods, milk products, eggs, chicken, and meat to increase her sales achieving better capital each day. She hopes to save her earnings to build her house. What she would like to get from this loan is to be able to have better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cereals, sweets, soft drinks, milk products, and meat to increase sales.

loans.name: God Is Our Witness Group

texts.en:
David K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is Our Witness.  He is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are 5 and 10 years old.  He was only able to attend school through junior high.
For 11 years, David has been selling dry goods at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. He says he sells good products, which keeps customers returning.
David plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods. His goal is to expand his business by opening a store and to improve the living standard of his family.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, David is the one holding the sign.
About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional dry goods.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Sonnie K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Group.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are 6, 11 and 19 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.
For 25 years, Sonnie has been selling clothes at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She says she sells good quality clothes, which keeps customers returning.  
Sonnie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her goal is to expand her business to have additional locations and to improve her living conditions.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sonnie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more women's jeans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more jeans.

loans.name: Felicidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Felicidad, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 25 socias. Las socias son D. la Asociación Covadonga.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. emoliente, comidas, abarrotes en general, condimentos, pollos, verduras, animales menores, mercería, bebidas y brindan servicios D. carpintería y cerrajería.

Como es el caso D. la señora Julia que es presidenta por tercera vez en su Banco Comunal, Julia es casada, tiene 59 años y 4 hijos que viven con ella, Julia junto a su esposo tienen un taller D. carpintería, sus productos los venD. en la feria dominical D. San Juan, Además Julia venD. comida en el mercado D. su barrio. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara madera.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 8,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, verduras, carnes, frutas, madera, leña, bebidas y animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Felicidad (Happiness) communal bank has 25 members and is in its fourth loan cycle; the members are all from Covadonga. The members are engaged in a variety of commercial activities like: herbal tea sales, grocery sales, spice sales, the sale of chickens, vegetables, small farm animals, general merchandise, beverages; some are carpenters and others are locksmiths. A typical case is Julia. She is president of the communal bank for the third time. Julia is married, 59 years old, and has 4 children that live with her. Together with her husband, she has a carpentry shop. She sells her products in San Juan’s Sunday market. In addition, Julia sells food in her neighborhood market. She will use the loan to buy lumber. The members need loans in various amounts ranging from 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, totaling 8100 soles for the communal bank as a whole. The loans will be used to buy rice, vegetables, meats, fruits, lumber, firewood, beverages and small animals. The members’ dreams are to enlarge their businesses, that their children finish their schooling and to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Don Marlon es un hombre de negocio, de 32 años de edad, vive en el barrio Reparto Schik junto  a su esposa y un hijo de 12 años de edad, el cual cursa la primaria. Su negocio es la venta de películas, dvd de música, de videos, controles, carcasas, portacd, y lo que le encarguen sus clientes, el inicio este negocio, con dinero de su trabajo pues se dedicaba a la construcción, trabajo cansado las dificultades es que había semana en donde no trabajaba por falta de proyectos, lo cual comienza ahorrar y pone su  venta de cd, el cual poco a poco comenzó a invertir, ahora solo se dedica al negocio, otras dificultades es cuando se va luz y no puede probar la música a sus clientes en donde se le bajan las ventas por la desconfianza del cliente que el disco le salga malo. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar accesorios de celulares, películas, música, controles, batería para radio, cargadores de celulares y otros que le generen ganancias. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras en el local de sus ventas ya que es cerrado de zinc y teme que se le metan a robar es por eso le urge las mejoras que espera pronto hacer para mejor beneficio  de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon, 32, is a businessman. He lives in the Reparto Schik neighborhood with his wife and 12-year-old son, who is in elementary school. Marlon sells movies on DVD, music DVDs, videos, remote controls, cases, CD cases and whatever else his customers order from him. He launched his business using savings from his job in construction. This was exhausting work and often he would go for weeks without any job offers. He started to put away some savings to set up his CD sales shop. Gradually, he invested more and now this is his sole source of income. Among his challenges are power failures. When this happens his customers are unable to sample the CDs and his sales drop because they don’t trust that the CD will be in good condition. He will use the funds to buy cell phone accessories, movies, music, controls, radio batteries, cell phone chargers and other items that will generate profits. His plans are to make improvements to his shop because it’s currently just secured with zinc metal sheeting and he fears that robbers could gain access. For this reason, improvements are urgent and he hopes to do them for the benefit of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy DVDs, CDs, cell phone cases, chargers, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fashion flip-flops and sandals.

loans.name: Jomah Business Group

texts.en:
T. F. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Jomah Business. He is 45 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 18 to 22 years old. He is presently a college student. For 35 years, T. has been a photographer in the Parker Paints community in Paynesville, Liberia. He produces good photos, which keeps customers returning.

T. plans to use his 15,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 45,000 Liberian dollar group loan to expand his business by purchasing more photo equipment. His goal is to own a modern photo studio and to become successful.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, T. is the one holding the sign. Esther T. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy photo-making equipment.

loans.name: José Cristóbal

texts.es: José Cristóbal M. C. de 54 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a su hijastra. José posee una venta de plantas ornamentales, las cuales comercializa sobre la calle llamada Simeón Cañas, la cual es una de las calles más congestionadas del lugar, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para José. Así mismo posee un pequeño vivero en su propia casa, en el cual vende platas, abono y tierra negra. Él posee 8 años de depender de este tipo de trabajo el cual le permite obtener buenas ganancias, ya que vende flores muy bonitas y a precios bajos. José solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de mejorar su negocio, invirtiendo más en el, comprando diferentes tipos de flores, sobre todo de las cuales se venden más. A José le llena de mucha ilusión, el que pueda aumentar sus ventas, haciendo lo que a él más le gusta, lo que es sembrar y cuidar plantas. Así mismo le incentiva saber que podrá aportar más a su familia, la cual depende por completo de José.
texts.en:
José Cristóbal M. C., 54, lives in San Miguel department with his wife, who is a housewife and his stepdaughter. José sells ornamental plants on Simeón Cañas street, which is one of the busiest streets in town; this has been very useful for José. He also has a small nursery at home where he sells plants, fertilizer and planting soil. He has been in this line of work for 8 years. It produces good profits because he sells pretty flowers at low prices. José is requesting funds from Integral to improve his business investing more in it, buying different varieties of flowers, especially the ones that are the best-sellers. José gets very excited to think that he may be able to increase his sales doing what he loves to do, which is to plant and care for plants. In addition, he is motivated knowing that he will provide more for his family, who are completely dependent on José.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ornamental plants.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel V. V.  de 39 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Panchimalco, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa la cual es ama de casa y junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Miguel posee una venta de tortas, las cuales son hechas de carne, aderezos, escabeche, aguacate y jamón. Su venta está ubicada en las afueras del Estadio Mágico González, lugar en el cual ya tiene 9 años de vender su productos, el cual es consumido por las personas que pasan por el lugar, trabajadores y atletas que entrenan diferentes deportes dentro del estadio. A pesar que es un negocio pequeño Miguel obtiene ganancias diarias muy buenas, las cuales en su mayoría son destinas a los gastos del hogar, lo que no le ha permitido poder ser propietario de su propio carretón, el cual es en el que cocina la carne y prepara las tortas, ya que el que posee es la actualidad es alquilado y debe pagar diariamente por el. Miguel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar su propio carretón, lo cual sería de mucha ayuda para él ya que no tendrá que pagar diario por alquilar uno. Miguel es un hombre lleno de muchos deseos de seguir adelante y de trabajar más para brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel V. V. , 39, lives in the town of Panchimalco, San Salvador department, with his wife, who is a housewife, and their three children, who are 11, 9, and 7 years of age, who are students. Miguel sells tortas (a sandwich-like dish) made from meat, sauces, pickled vegetables, avocado and ham. His cart is located outside the Mágico González Stadium; he has been located here for 9 years. His main customers are passersby, workers and athletes who train in different sports inside the stadium. Despite it being a small business, Miguel earns good daily profits, most of which are destined to household expenses. This has prevented him from owning his own sales cart in which he cooks the meat and prepares the tortas; the one he has is leased and he must pay a daily rental fee to use it. Miguel is asking for funding so that he can have enough money to buy his own cart. This would be of great benefit to him because he will no longer have to pay a daily rental fee for one. Miguel is filled with desire to succeed in life and to work even harder to provide for all his family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sales cart.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulker H. is 41 years old and has sold foodstuffs in her grocery for ten years. She began her business as a street vendor near the local school of her community. Over time, she has expanded her business and now she has a stall in the central bazaar.

Every week Ulker travels to the neighboring town to purchase new goods. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase foodstuffs to expand her business. She needs this to provide a bright future for her three beloved children.

Ulker sincerely thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with her loan repayments.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Izay

texts.en: Izay I. is a successful father and dedicated husband. Together with his wife he has two kids. Izay began a small grocery store three years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery becomes more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods sold in his store. Izay is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business through this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of good sold in his store.

loans.name: Amirkhan

texts.en:
Amirkhan Q. is married with two children and he has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Amirkhan sells fruit and vegetables. He began this enterprise twenty years ago with a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication. Over time he expanded his business and today his business has become domestic as his family is also engaged in it.

Today, Amirkhan needs to buy additional items to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

We believe Amirkhan’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials necessary for the creation of party products and to buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Agakhalil

texts.en:
Agakhalil S. is 36 years old and is married with three children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of seasonal fruit and vegetables in the main street of the village in which he lives. He is not alone in this business - his whole family actively helps him with sales.

Agakhalil is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Currently he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad D. is 41. He sells an assortment of different kinds of good quality flour. Because he buys the flour wholesale, his price is cheaper than the price of his competitors. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market in the Agsu region.

Today, Rashad has great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take out an individual loan. He has requested a loan of 1,600 AZN to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for land

loans.name: Khudakerim

texts.en:
Khudakerim R. is a 39 year-old married man with four children. Khudakerim is a hardworking man who started his own business as a source of  income and for savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased sheep and this motivated him to start his own business more than 15 years ago.

Over time he has increased his sheep sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well. Now Khudakerim needs additional capital to expand and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,600 AZN to purchase additional sheep to sell. More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing.

Khudakerim and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and feed

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mariana S. es socia del banco comunal Haciendo un mundo mejor, es una socia luchadora y siempre ve por el porvenir de su familia, este es su tercer crédito con la  fundación y se enteró de la existencia de la institución  gracias a un vecino de su comunidad y por su hija que se integró al grupo antes que ella y la invito a ser partícipe del banco.

Mariana se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, pollos, borrego, cuyes  que los vende los días jueves en la feria del ganado o en la  feria libre de Cuenca, en ocasiones los vende  en su propia casa a sus vecinos de la comunidad, además  se dedica a la agricultura cultivando sus propias tierras.

Ella vive en la parroquia Turi en la comunidad Santa Anita, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 25, 24, 23, 10 años,  su primer  y tercer hijo ya son casados y viven  independientes con la familia que formaron, su hija de 24 años es soltera trabaja y le ayuda un poco económicamente tanto para los gastos de la casa como para el estudio de su hermana menor,  su esposo trabaja en la rama de la construcción, profesión que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia  y con mucho sacrifico lograr construir su casa propia.

Con el nuevo crédito que reciba de la fundación va a comprar cría  de pollos, maíz, balanceado y vitaminas  para el crecimiento de sus aves y agrandar su negocio. Tiene como  meta ir incrementando poco  a poco pollos y cuyes  para contar con  un criadero grande y ser distribuidora de los mismos.
texts.en:
Mariana S. is a member of the “Haciendo un Mundo Mejor” (Building a Better World) communal bank. She is a tenacious woman who is always looking after her family’s future. This is her third loan with the foundation. She became aware of the institution thanks to a neighbor and to her daughter, who became a member before she did, and invited her to participate in the bank. Mariana raises farm animals like: cows, chickens, goats, guinea pigs. She sells them on Thursdays at the Cuenca free cattle market. Sometimes she also sells them from home to her neighbors; she also farms her own farmlands. She lives in Turi parish, Santa Anita. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children, who are 25, 24, 23 and 10 years of age. Her first and third sons are married and live independently with their own families. Her 24-year-old daughter is single and is employed; she helps out economically both with household expenses and with educational costs for her younger sister. Her husband is in construction, an occupation that has made it possible for him to get his family ahead in live and, through much sacrifice, to build their own home. She will use the new loan to buy chicks, corn, nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins for the birds and to enlarge her business. Her goal is to gradually increase her chicken and guinea pig production so that she can have a large nursery and become a distributor of them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, corn, nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make repair to his café

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir M. is 39 years old, married, and the father of two children. He also has his parents under his care.

Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Mahir has been selling cattle for the last twenty years. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, Mahir buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more.

Today Mahir would like to expand his business by increasing his capital so that he can maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase calves. He counts on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj Z. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. Sevinj is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Nine years ago she got an idea to start breeding sheep to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband. 

Slowly the number of sheep has increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of sheep she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN . Be an important part of the growth of Sevinj’s business!

loans.use: purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ileana

texts.en:
Ileana C. T. is a 44-year-old single mother who lives with her 3 children in Paraiso de Cartago, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Ileana provides beauty services for both men and women, from her home in Paraiso. She has been working under the business name ¨Unas Ili, ¨ which translates roughly as Ili´s Nails, over the past 8 years. Ileana says she opened her business to earn an income for her children and because she likes the work. 'Ili´s Nails' was opened with an initial investment of 25,000 colons.  In a good month, Ileana can expect to earn 390,000 colons, in a bad month, only 238,000. 

Ileana is a hard-working entrepreneur. She dedicates the hours from 10 am to 6 pm (7 days a week) to her business. Ileana´s specialty and passion is working with nails. Nail painting, applying decorative (fake) nails and giving manicures and pedicures represents the majority of Ileana´s workload. She has employed her two daughters who work roughly 12 hours a week and earn 25,000 colons each (per week). One of her daughters specializes in cosmetics and the other works with hair. As a team, they can provide a range of beauty services including hair, nails and cosmetics.

This will be Ileana´s first loan with Fundación Mujer. She plans to use it to make general investments in the expansion of her beauty business. Specifically, she would like to purchase a hair-washing machine, a hair straightener, nail polish and fake nails, among other nail maintenance products. 
Ileana´s goal is to improve the services she offers her clients and expand her business, little by little, every day. She is well aware of the highly competitive market that exists for beauty services and products in her community. 

Ileana´s revenues have been affected by competitors under-cutting each other’s prices for services in an effort to attract new clients and to keep old ones. Ileana is confident that she will maintain the loyalty of her clients because she uses high quality products and is not willing to compromise that quality in exchange for profits.

loans.use: To purchase equpiment and products necessary to the provision of beauty services

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Patricia C. R., tiene 28 años es casada y su esposo es agricultor ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años y el menor de 3 añitos, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la agricultura.

Uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido la escaces de agua de la zona, la afectaciopn de las plagas y por concecuencia las enfermedades de la tierra, ella comenzo involucrandose en las actividades agricolas gracias a su esposo que trabajo con su papa, ella solicita de este prestamo para la compra de material vegetativo e insumos fertilizantes, estos materiales le ayudaran  a sus tierras a que su producción, sea de mejor calidad, dentro de los planes a futuro esta la instalacion de un sistema de riego para tener un plan de contingencia cunado tenga problemas de escaces, espera se le ayude a mejorar us condiciones de vida y por concecuencia las de su familia.
texts.en:
La señora Karla Patricia C. R., tiene 28 años es casada y su esposo es agricultor ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años y el menor de 3 añitos, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la agricultura. Karla Patricia C. R., 28, is married; her husband is a farmer. They have two children, who are 7 and 3 years of age. She has been a farmer for 8 years. Among the problems she has faced are the lack of water in the area, the pests that attack her crops and the plant diseases that are in the soil. She began to be involved in farming thanks to her husband, who is a potato farmer. She is asking for funding to buy farm supplies like: seed and fertilizers. These supplies will help the land to be more productive and produce better quality crops. Her plans for the future include installing an irrigation system so that she can have a fall-back in place when rain is scarce. She hopes this will help to improve her living conditions and, as a result, that of her family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: El señor Carlos trabaja como cadete de taxi desde hace varios años, su edad es de 54 años, junto a su esposa se han esforzado para hacer las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian, y labora para un almacén, las dificultades de don Carlos es cuando se le daña el vehiculo y no trabaja lo cual no cubre la alimentación a sus hijos. Con el crédito anterior logro hacer el sumidero para el inodoro, y compro material para la construcción pero como no ajusto con el dinero. Terminara la obra con este financiamiento en hacer el baño y el inodoro para una mejor privacidad e higiene de su familia. Sus planes es poder lograr un financiamiento grande para comprar un taxi propio y poder tener un mejor ingreso para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 54, has worked as a taxi driver for several years. Together with his wife, he has struggled to make needed home improvements. She has three children, who are students, and she works in a store. When his vehicle isn’t running right, Carlos can’t work and can’t earn enough for food for his children. The previous loan made it possible for him to dig a sewer drain for the toilet and he bought building supplies; however, he ran out of money. This loan will be used to finish the bathroom and toilet so that the family will have more hygiene and privacy. His plan is to qualify for a large loan so that he can buy his own taxi thereby improving his income to help support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maura Colombia

texts.es:
Maura A. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es soltera y sin hijos.

Maura inicio vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y artículos de papelería a las afuera de su casa, cuando obtuvo ingresos suficientes invirtió en productos Gardens (productos naturales).

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano también compro una maquina masajeadota para el negocio, en ocasiones sale a vender los productos naturales por el sector donde vive, una de las dificultades es el dolor de piernas que le causa el caminar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos naturales y cuadernos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas surtido y así poder ayudar económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Maura A., 38, lives in a periurban area of Fortín de Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic services. She is single and has no children. Maura started out selling notebooks, pens and stationery supplies outside her home. When she had enough earnings, she invested in Gardens products (brand of natural products). Now, she works every day from early on. She also bought a massage machine for her business. Sometimes she goes out into her neighborhood to sell her natural products but a difficulty she faces is pain in her legs when she walks. She will use the funds to buy natural products and notebooks for her business. In the future, she wants to have a better-stocked business so that she can help out her parents financially.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Marcia Eralda

texts.es:
Marcia M. de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos. 

Marcia inicio vendiendo dulces y snack en su casa. Pasaron uno pocos años para que ella surtiera mejor su tienda.

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00, vende enlatados, bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. En ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan en la tienda. Con las lluvias que hay ahora los ingresos de la tienda han decaído un poco. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener otra tienda para que sus hijos la administren.
texts.en:
41-year old Marcia M. lives in the suburb of Paraíso de Guayaquil in a cement-block house which has basic services. She is the single mother of three children. Marcia started out selling candy and snacks from her house. Several years went by as she built up the stock in the store. She now works there every day from 6 in the morning until 11 at night selling canned products, drinks, rice, sugar etc. Her children sometimes help in the store. Because of the current rainy season, income from the store has dropped a little. With the loan Marcia wants to buy rice, sugar, and oil for the store. Some time in the future she would like to have another store for her children to operate.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Parvaz

texts.en:
Parvaz Q.  is 43 years old and a beekeeper who  runs his business in the small village of Agsu. He has about 20 years of experience in selling honey. In the same time Parvaz cultivates pomegranates and sell them during the harvest period which comes in autumn and winter. 

Parvaz sells honey all year long and because of its excellent quality, his honey sells in a few days. Parvaz is married and has 3 sons. He believes one day one of them can continue the beekeeping business which Parvaz started long ago. Let’s do our best to help this hard-working man!

loans.use: improve his work conditions and purchase more beehives

loans.name: Jabir

texts.en:
Jabir A. is 24 years old, married with one son. He was born into a simple, rural family and has worked with livestock for ten years. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock as well as meat and milk.

Jabir is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to enable him to purchase more cattle. This will enable him to increase milk production as well as meat he can sell. The income will enable Jabir to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality products.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Intiqam

texts.en:
Intiqam M. is a 43-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his three children. 

Intiqam has been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has 25 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Intiqam has become a very successful businessman in a short period. He works hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now Intiqam wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So he applied for a loan of1600 AZN. Intiqam thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.en:
Makhbuba A. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all of her courage. She is married and has six children.

Makhbuba works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide a considerable part of the household income.

Makhbuba wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy calves. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Jamalladin

texts.en:
Jamalladin Q. is a very loving father who is devoted to the needs of his children whom he adores. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children.

Jamalladin works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he must purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly.

Jamalladin needs working capital of 1,600 AZN, and at the moment he does not have that much money. Therefore, he is requesting this loan. He counts on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Martin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Martin Antonio V. L.   tiene 3 años de dedicarse al desarrollo de ternero,  habita en la comarca  petaquilla El Sauce, 
EL está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ternero en desarrollo  lo que  venderá a un mejor precio  así obtener  mayores ingreso y  abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Martin Antonio V. L. has raised cattle for the last 3 years. He lives in the El Sauce region. He is seeking a loan to purchase calves to raise which he will then sell at a better price to improve his income and provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Qarkhun

texts.en:
Qarkhun N. is 31 years old and is married with two children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising and sale of large livestock at the local market.

Every year, Qarkhun buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today, Qarkhun is thinking about expanding his business since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional calves and, to do this, he needs to invest an additional 1,600 AZN in his business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Savalan

texts.en:
Savalan Z. is 43 years old and is married with three sons. He lives in small village of Agsu city and has land for cultivating seasonal fruits. His wife helps him on the plantation.

Savalan now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer, so he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

You could become an important part of his family's life. Savalan deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer
