loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa R. is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.

Eight years ago Vafa got the idea of starting to raise cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband. Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more.

With an endless list of requests, Vafa has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. You can be an important part of the growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María F. de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo trabaja como cargador en un centro comercial con el tiene tres hijos.

María inicio el negocio de venta de detergente porque se quedo sin trabajo, sus últimos ahorros los invirtió en detergente y comenzó a venderlo afuera de su casa.

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 07h30 hasta las 22h00, implemento en su negocio la venta de artículos para baño. En ocasiones también vende bebidas. Una de las complicaciones de su negocio es la delincuencia del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pintura para mejorar la estructura del negocio. En el futuro quiere tener bien construida su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria F. is 41 years old and lives in the semiurban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. She has a cement home which has all the basic utliities. Her husband works as a carrier in a shopping center; she has three children with him. Maria started her own business selling detergent because she was unemployed. She used all her savings to invest in detergent inventory and began selling it outside of her home. She works everyday from 730 am to 10 pm and now sells a variety of bathroom products. Sometimes, she also sells drinks. One of the problems in her work is the petty crime in the area. With the loan, she will purcahse cement, blocks, and paint to improve the structure of her business. In the future she would like to improve the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, blocks and paint

loans.name: Niyamaddin

texts.en:
Niyamaddin R. is 37 years old. He buys and sells bulls from different markets and has been in business for the past eight years, when his salary as a school teacher wasn’t enough even for a loaf of bread. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Niyamaddin is married and the father of three children. With the loan he requested, he plans to purchase more bulls for trade and this, he says, will increase his turnover. 

His dream is to have his own farm one day. Lets do our best to help Niyamaddin approach his dream.

loans.use: Purchase three bulls

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.en:
Zakhir M. is married and has two children. He has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Zakhir has a grocery store, where he sells different kinds of food. With a starting capital of $100 USD, he began this enterprise nine years ago. Over time, he expanded his business, and today, this business has become domestic as his children and wife are also engaged in it.

Today, Zakhir needs to buy additional food to increase the range of his selling goods. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

We believe Zakhir’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and increase the range of goods that he sells

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose and Vanessa enjoy selling things, particularly the car audio equipment that they themselves love to listen to while driving around town. When Jose’s boss of eight years decided to abandon his post selling audio parts at San Jose’s Berryessa Market, the couple made the decision to go into business for themselves. And so, drawing upon Jose’s years of experience as a salesman and Vanessa’s accounting savvy (her area of study in school in Mexico), DGO Audio was born.

Jose and Vanessa have been successfully selling since April of 2008. In addition to their weekends spent at the flea market, Jose works full-time and Vanessa cares for their two daughters. “I love having our own business because it allows me to make my own schedule and spend time with the girls,” says Vanessa.

Of the business name, Jose explained that, “DGO is the initials of the city of Durango, Mexico, where we are from. That is well known in the region, so our name helps attract Hispanics that shop at the market. It builds on our sense of community.” The pair said that they enjoy working to run the business together and are confident that they will be able to continue growing. While there are other audio-parts sellers operating at the market they distinguish themselves with different brands, lower prices, and a familial atmosphere.

Jose will use the $2,500 loan to make monthly trips to Los Angeles, where they can find a much larger supply of car radios, speakers, tweeters and other radio components at a better value to sell in San Jose. These trips will help their business to remain competitive and, ultimately, grow. “This loan opens up possibilities we didn’t have before. With a little investment, we have the chance to earn much more. In a few years, when the economy is better, we would like to open our own store,” says Jose.

loans.use: To increase his car audio inventory

loans.name: Marvin Santiago

texts.es: El señor Marvin Santiago Martínez R. tiene 2 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera, actualmente habita en la comarca Ocotal, caserío Las Minitas, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su unidad productiva, la que tiene 6 años de estar a su cargo. Es necesario mencionar que tiene explotación del café orgánico, lo que significa un gran potencial para la zona.
texts.en:
Marvin has been working with this financial institution for 2 years. He currently lives in the Ocotal region in the hamlet of Las Minitas and El Sauce. He works in agriculture and has a piece of land that has been in his charge for 6 years. It is necessary to mention that he produces organic coffee, which has great potential in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair fences and to build a trough and animal pen.

loans.name: Yadira Alicia

texts.es:
El la comarca jícaro bonito del municipio de somotillo la señora Yadira Alicia H. Santeliz, se dedica las actividades agropecuarias como son: la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino, avícola y cultivos como maíz, frijol blanco, y ajonjolí los cuales proveen de los ingresos necesarios para sus necesidades básicas de sus familia la cual la integran tres hijas, ella trabaja de 6 a 3 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
El crédito solicitado será empleado para la compra de un panel solar puesto que en su comarca no existe el servicio eléctrico, de esta forma pretende mejorar las condiciones sociales de su familia.
texts.en:
In the beautiful Jícaro region in the town of Somotillo, Yadira Alicia H. Santeliz works in agriculture, raising cattle, pigs and poultry and cultivating corn, white beans and sesame. This work provides the income needed to provide the basic necessities for her family, which is comprised of 3 daughters. She works from 6am to 3pm each day of the week. The loan requested will be used to buy a solar panel, since in her region electrical services are not available. In this way she aims to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia G. tiene ya más de un años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza y del hogar por catalogó.
Alicia también es empleada de una fabrica en el departamento de producción, con sus compañera de trabaja vende los productos, para tener mas ingreso a su familia. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para surtir.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que con el ingreso de su trabajo pagara los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia G. has been selling beauty and home products by catalog for more than one year. Alicia also is employed in a manufacturing plant in the production department, and she sells to her colleagues at work in order to generate more income for her family. She seeks a long to be able to buy merchandise as she has several pending orders and doesn’t have the necessary money to buy the products. She plans on repaying the loan with the profits from her business, because with her job’s income she pays her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: A la vivienda del señor Esteban
texts.en:
Esteban’s home is missing the inside fixtures. He has two small children, so the walls are stained and marked and he needs to paint them and make some other repairs. At the moment he does not have the money he needs to make the improvements, so he is requesting this loan. He plans to repay with part of the money he ears at his job.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: La Sra. María Del Pilar E. A. de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo menor. Tiene casa propia de adobe ubicada en el Caserío de Santa Vicenta. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente recibe otros ingresos de una pensión mensual de alimentacion de parte del padre de su hijo. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento
texts.en:
Sra. María Del Pilar E. A. is 28 years old and a single mother of a young child. She has her own home made of adobe in the village of Santa Vicenta. María works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial business and has two years of experience. In addition, she receives other income from a monthly food pension on behalf of the father of her child. María is an enterprising person, and thanks to her efforts, she was able to acquire her own property.

She is requesting a loan to finish the construction of her house. Her dream is to finish her entire house so that she can achieve a better quality of life. She is extremely grateful for the support being provided through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of her house

loans.name: Mrs. Suon Sor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who made a village bank loan all live in Boueng Kroam village, Kandal province. Mrs. Suon S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they all will use the loan for different purposes. 

Suon S. and her husband, Phall Meak, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops for sale to support their family. However hard they try to work with their field, they earn less income because their crop field has infertile soil and is far from irrigation systems. Thus, in order to improve and have a productive crop, Suon S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Lizeth G. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y zapatos.   
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y de temporada de verano ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que tenga ya se tipo de ropa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder surtir de mercancía y así complacer a sus clientes.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que del negocio ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como encargada de una lavandería.
texts.en:
Lizeth G. has sold clothes and shoes for more than three years now. The business needs more variety of merchandise for summer because her customers are asking her to have that type of clothing available. She is asking for funds to stock up on merchandise so that she can please her customers. She plans to repay the loan with profits from the business since family expenses are covered by her salary as a laundry attendant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Mr. Him Soen Group

texts.en:
Him S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members of the loan; they all will use the loan for different purposes. This village bank loan has 20 members, who are villagers in Prey Totong village in Kandal province. 

Him S. and his wife, Sokchan Chork, are farmers who own a small plot of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family. The idea is to provide the farmland with proper care, so that the crops will produce the best possible sale price when the time comes to sell them. Thus, Him S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel for his crop field. He is the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the other is too young to go to school or work. All the members are shown in the picture, but some faces are just slightly blocked by others.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel for crops

loans.name: Brenda Margarita

texts.es:
Brenda D. M. es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Ella y su esposo tienen un negocio de control de plagas y seguridad para los negocios o casas particulares el negocio es llamado “Asesoria Empresarial” este ya lleva 6 años dando servicio a personas quien tengan algún problema de animales rastrero y extinguidores para cuando haya un incendio.
Ahora están pensando en invertir más ya que día tras día van teniendo mas clientes y necesitan tener bien surtido para no quedar mal con los clientes
texts.en:
Brenda D. M. is an enterprising woman with much desire to work and get ahead in life. She and her husband have a pest control and security business for homes and businesses called "Asesoria Empresarial." They have had this business for six years; they provide pest eradication services and they provide fire extinguishers for fire prevention. They are planning to invest more because they get new customers daily and they need to have their business well stocked so as no to disappoint the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business.

loans.name: J Trinidad

texts.es: El señor J Trinidad es un señor trabajador que opto por poner un negocio desde hace 9 años en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad llamado “Miscelánea G.” donde el tiene una venta de abarrotes en general. Este negocio lo atiende el y su esposa aunque ya son personas grandes quieren seguir trabajado para el sostén de ellos mismos, pues sus hijos ya se encuentran casados y no quieren ser una carga para ellos. Este negocio tiene de todo como refrescos, comida enlatada, botanas y mucho mas, solo que ahora el señor Trinidad quiere comprar mercancía para estar bien surtido.
texts.en:
J. Trinidad is a hard-working man that chose to open a store called, “Miscelánea G.,” 9 years ago on a very busy city street where he sells general merchandise. He and his wife tend the store; even though they are seniors they want to continue to work and support themselves because their children are married and they don't want to be a burden to them. The store has everything like: soft drinks, canned food, snacks and many more items. Trinidad wants to buy more merchandise so that he can be well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda T. is a 36-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is the mother of three children who are all of minor age. She is married to Wilfredo T., a vendor, and the salary of her husband is insufficient for their daily needs.

As a mother with big dreams, in 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a Microfinance Institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She started selling small items and it really helped them to meet their needs. 

Now on her ninth loan, she requests the amount of 20,000 pesos to purchase more inventory of her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for remote controls, antennae, playing cards, lighters, manicure sets, cotton buds, nail cutters, mirrors, tooth brushes, and other supplies.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her three children in school. She also dreams of building a concrete and durable house of their own.


About ASHI: Ahon SA Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her sales business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is 43 years old and married with ten children. She lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband, Bienvinido, a carpenter. The couple works hard to raise their big family. For almost four years, Remedios has been selling fruits and vegetables. She is hard-working, determined, and dedicated. Remedios would like to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her business. She enjoys selling fruits and vegetables in the local community.

As a very active member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006, Remedios has been a model member, demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. With the help of ASHI, she has continually funded the education of her children.  

Remedios' dreams are for her seven youngest children to complete college. Additionally, she hopes to continue her business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

About ASHI: Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her fruit and vegetable vending business

loans.name: Mrs. Oeung Soung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 12 people, who all live in Prasat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Oeung S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate for supporting her family, while her husband, Mr. Oeurn Neum, is motorbike taxi driver and also a chef. 

With the rice field, this family has a problem because their field has infertile soil. Thus, in order to improve and have productive rice, Mrs. Oeung S. decided to ask for a loan to bU. fertilizers to increase the rice yield. She is the mother of a child who is a worker in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. L. is 58 years old and married with four children. All of her children have finished their education and hold degrees through the support of educational loans form ASHI. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband, Eulogio, works as partner in her business. To supply additional income for her family, Teresita is expanding the family's primary business of farming, which has been in operation for almost ten years. 

For supplementary income, Teresita would like to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase an additional computer for her secondary business of operating computer rentals, and remaining loan monies will be used to support their farming business. As a dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1995, Teresita is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  
 
With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that both businesses will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life. She hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term by launching a larger computer cafe, and to support the educational needs of her grandchildren.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer for her computer rental business; the remainder of the loan will support her existing farm business

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Sok Ngem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 13 members who live in Prasat village in Kandal province. Leang Sok N. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use the loan for different purposes. 

Leang Sok N. raises cattle in the local village, while her husband, Sokea Morn, is a policeman. Leang Sok N. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding, which will help her to increase her income. Through this activity they support their five children, two of whom are policemen, while another is too young to attend school or work, and the others attend the local public school. 

All the members are shown in the picture, but some of tH. are blocked.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou D. is a three-year member of ASHI. She feels happy for joining the institution, not only for its financial services offered, but for the training and activities she attended. Through these her potential and capabilities as a woman were enhanced to become productive. Now, she found her confidence to manage and grow a business that she started using her loan since the time of her membership.  

Marilou’s dream is very simple. She wants to put up a stall in a stable place where she can sell her fruits and vegetables. She is requesting for a larger amount of loan money through ASHI and its partner, Kiva. Its proceeds will be used to support the education of her children until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase larger volume of fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Mrs. Pablita T. is a PDP-LP member. She is 45 years old, and married with four children.  She is from Upper Tiparak,Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, which supports their daily basic needs. She has owned a sari-sari store (neighborhood convenience store) for almost three years, earning approximately 4000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support, and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to extend her sari-sari store so that she can accommodate more customers. Mrs. T. now has a new loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC, which will be used to fund additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mr. Sam Uon Pum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Prasat village, Kandal province have formed a village bank to request a loan, which they will all use for different purposes. Mr. Sam U. P. has been chosen by the other members to act as the village bank president. He is a construction worker; his wife, Mrs. Sokey Phei, is an employee at a garment factory. He is the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled at the local public school, while the other is too young to attend school or go to work. 

Their family has problems with their crops being damaged by animals near their house.  Mr. Sam U. P. is seeking a loan to construct an enclosure around his house to protect their crops.

loans.use: To construct an enclosure to protect crops

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B. hopes that through Kiva (ASHI Partner) lenders she will be granted the loan she is requesting to improve her transportation-for-hire business. 

Her husband, who manages their business, believes that their tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) can attract more passengers--especially students--once it looks nice and efficient. Therefore, the couple agreed that the loan Lorna is requesting will be used to purchase a new motorcycle.  

Proceeds from their tricycle business are their means to improve their lifestyle and to support the education of their only child (an eight-year-old son) until he graduates from college.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's tricycle business

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en:
Mataniu T. is 44 and married with 6 children (ages 5 - 19).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mataniu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Mataniu needs a loan of WST $2250 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2007, Mataniu joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mataniu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mataniu T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene E. is the mother of two children, aged six months and five years old. 

Airene’s husband is very supportive of her every endeavor, especially in growing her fish-selling business. Therefore, when Airene shared with her husband her plan to rent a stall in the public market to acquire more customers and increase profits from selling fish, her husband supported her decision to request a loan for a much larger amount. 

Airene hopes that through Kiva, private individuals all over the world will extend their benevolent support to improve her business so that her family will be raised out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a huge volume of fish for re-sale in the local market

loans.name: Mrs. Choen Chhay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has twenty people who are living in the village of Prasat in Kandal Province. Mrs. Choen C. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Choen C. and her husband, Mr. T. Yeung, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice to support their family. Through this activity, the couple supports four children. One of their children works in a garment factory, and another child sells sugarcane juice. Their other children are enrolled in local public school. In their rice field, they have some problems: the rice field is infertile, and they do not have enough rice seed. Thus, in order to improve productivity, Mrs. Choen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

(All group members are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked by others.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Sielaa

texts.en:
Sielaa P. is 52 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup).  Sielaa has 4 years of experience in this business.  Sielaa needs a loan of WST $1700 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 tala or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sielaa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sielaa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sielaa P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: In the village of Prasat in the Kandal province, there are four women who have joined together to request a group loan. One of these members, Mrs. Phally N., was selected by all of the members to be the group leader. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phally N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice in order to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sam Orat, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Phally N. works hard in her field, but she does not earn a lot of income because her rice field has infertile soil, and she does not have enough seeds to grow. Thus, Mrs. Phally N. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to improve her yield of rice this year. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a waiter. The others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Mrs. Makk Yann Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-six people from the village of Kork Romiet in the Kandal province have requested a village bank loA.. Mrs. Makk Y. was selected by all of the members to be the village bank president. All of the members will use the loA. for different purposes. Mrs. Makk Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice and other crops to support her family. She is a widow who lives with six members in her household. She has some problems with her crop field because it is on time to grow, but she does not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Makk Y. decided to ask for a loA. to buy morning glory seed, fuel, and fertilizer in order to improve her farming. All of the members are shown in the picture, but some of tH. are blocked.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seed, fuel, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mr. Morn Meun Village Bank Group

texts.en: In the village of Kork Romiet in the Kandal province, a group of fifteen people have requested a village bank loan. All of the members selected Mr. Morn M. to be the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Morn M. is an electrician, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Korn, is a tailor in the local village. Mr. Morn M. and his wife work hard at their businesses, but they do not earn enough money because their sewI. machine does not have the electricity it needs to run. Thus in order to improve the family's livI. conditions, Mr. Morn M. decided to ask for a loan to buy electrical supplies for his sewI. machine. He is a father of a child who is too small to work or go to school. All of the members of the village bank loan are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en: Jovelyn V. is from the town of Bautista, San Agustin. She is 41 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn V.'s Group. Jovelyn is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Jovelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marlen G.'s group. Marlen is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2010, Marlen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Marlen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
At 74, the role of being a mother has never ended yet for Ofelia C.. Though her eldest 46-year-old child and her family live along with her and the rest of her six children whose ages range from 31 to 45 years old, and they incur a large amount of daily expenses, Ofelia feels happy being with them always and being a mother to them. None of her children has reached college. Though they went to a high school, they were not able to graduate thus being employed in an office is impossible for them. However, Ofelia’s children are hard working and know how to earn money in a hard way and be able to survive their everyday lives in spite of poverty. Despite that fact, she still wants her small “sari-sari” (variety) store to grow to a grocery store with large volume of inventory. She also wants her fishing business to grow by purchasing her own fishing boat to be managed by her male children. For this to materialize, she is requesting a larger loan from Kiva through ASHI. 

Ofelia and her children are very much hopeful that someday, through their business finance with her loans, they will be able to improve their standard of living and will share some of her profits with her children and grandchildren by providing them with their daily needs. Though they will not be as wealthy as other people in their village, at least they will live a peaceful kind of life.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for fishing and inventory for her store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: In her years of experience in farming, Nenita learned that extra care is essential. She said that to be able to achieve quality produce, enough time and attention should be spent at the farm. “Enough financing is also a must in having abundant harvest”, she added. With her husband’s approval, she applied to CEVI to avail of its financial program. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves N. is a married woman who supports her family with her general store and jewelry retailing. She lives in Cabangahan, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and their two children. Her children are 10 and 12 years old and are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and her buy and sell jewelry business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,000.

Nieves is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can expand her general store and her buy and sell jewelry business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nieves aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Рахимова Фотима проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж в Росии на заработках. Сама Фотима занимается пошивкой национальных платьев. Так как мужа нету она одна обеспечивает семью. Этот бизнес приносит ей доход. На полученный кредит хочет купить у оптовых паставщиков, ткань.
texts.en:
Fotima Rahomova lives in the Yavan district. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Fotima is involved in sewing traditional dresses. Since the husband is not there, she is the sole provider for the family. This business brings her income. Fotima wants to use this loan for the purchase of fabric from wholesale distributors.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a 37-year-old married woman, raises hogs for a living. She has three children and her oldest child is now 18 years of age. One of the challenges she currently faces is her children’s education. School fees are increasing but she is determined to have them finish college. Her hog raising business is what her family depends on to provide their needs. She wants this business to prosper so she does her best to make it so. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI that she will use to buy additional piglets and feed for her hogs.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Flordeliza's Group

texts.en:
Flordeliza G. is from the village of Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Flordeliza is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Flordeliza is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Germana

texts.en: Germana, 60, is the mother of five children. She earns a living through dressmaking. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. In 1985, she started dressmaking. She lacks capital to run her business and now seeks help from the micro-finance institution. She likes CEVI because it has a low interest rate. This loan will enable her to provide for the needs of family.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en: Victoriana is thankful to have gained access to CEVI’s program. She is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur and she would borrow money from lenders who charge a high interest for their loans. It brought difficulty to her and she hardly earned from her harvest because of what she had to pay. Now that she is a member of CEVI, she is hopeful that the loan she requested would be truly helpful because of its low interest. She asked for PHP 5,000, which she would use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs needed for her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Mrs. Luzviminda A. has been farming for quite a while now. She is married to Ronelo and they have five children. She continuous to tend her rice farm because it is the only source of income her family has. She is starting to raise hogs to add income for her family. She applied to CEVI and she is hopeful that its program will be really helpful to her business. She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000. She said she would use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers and hopefully acquire a piglet.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Behsood Khaas Group

texts.en: Wakeel is the leader of the Behsood Khaas group. He is a 51-year-old man who is married with six children. He lives in the Behsood district of Nangarhar Province. He is an experienced and diligent person.  He runs a retail shop. Currently his business income is not enough to meet all his family's needs. He wants to take a loan to purchase the essential materials for his shop to increase his business income, broaden his business capacity and meet all his family's needs. He is grateful for all AFS and Kiva lenders and their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en: Lucina, 41 years old, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She invested in rice farming in 1995. She still does farming now with her husband. She said that farming is a big help to her family. It gives them food and is also a source of income. She wants this business of hers to prosper. She applied to CEVI to have financial support for her business. She asked for a loan, which amounts to PHP 5,000. With this amount, she will be able to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 35 years old and married with one child who attends school.  He has been running a glassware business for six years.  His business is located in Kibera and he does not have any employees.  Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business.  He dreams of owning a wholesale glassware business in the future.  He describes himself as hardworking and, therefore, he has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy glass for resale.

loans.use: Add to his stock of glass

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: “Thankfully, my business is going well. My husband and I make sure we have abundant harvest every time”, Annabelle shares of her rice farming. A 30-year-old woman, she has two young children that motivate her to work hard. Now, she needs farm inputs for her rice farm. She asked for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said the loan would be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rosana's Group

texts.en: Rosana M. is from the city of Sta. Rosa, Santiago. She is 42 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosana M.'s group. Rosana is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is seeking financial support for his rice and banana farm. He is 56 years old and married with six children. The farm being the source of his family’s income, Nelson spends most of his time making sure the farm will be productive. He is currently short financially to continue his business so he applied to CEVI for a loan. He would like to ask a loan of PHP10,000 to supply his farm with inputs like seeds and fertilizers. Receiving this loan would be truly helpful to Nelson’s farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alimahmad

texts.ru: Жалов Алимахмад проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Основной вид деятельности в этом районе, животноводство. Он более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Имеет коровник и несколько бычков. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этот бизнес приносит ему доход. Узнав про возможности получения кредита, решил обратиться и получить кредит. На полученный кредит он хочет купить молодых телят и увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Alimahmad J. lives in the Yavan district. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. Animal husbandry is the primary business activity in this district. Alimahmad has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He owns a cowshed and several bulls. He mainly feeds up and sells livestock. This business brings him an income. Having learned about the possibility of obtaining a loan, Alimahmad decided to request the loan. He wants to use this loan to purchase young calves and increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ruvilyn's Group

texts.en: Ruvilyn M. is from the city of Calao West, Santiago City. She is 28 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. Ruvilyn is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Ruvilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en: Teresita D. is from the village of F.. She is 45 years old and is the group leader of a twenty-one-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Teresita D.’s Group. Teresita is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothes in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Teresita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Susan's Group

texts.en: Ma. Susan S. is from the village of San J.. She is 31 years old and is the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ma. Susan S.’s Group. Ma. Susan is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. Ma. Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Susan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan B. is a 34-year-old aspirant of ASHI. She hopes that through the loan she is requesting through ASHI now, she will make her dream of rice wholesaling come true. The amount she is requesting will enable her to buy several sacks of rice, which will be supplied to a retailer in their village and in other neighboring villages. Through the support of her husband, she is optimistic that this kind of business will be successful and will become profitable in time. By then, Susan will have a cash flow for her family, especially for the needs of her three children (ages from one to nine years old). Because she knew and she felt through her inner core how hard it is to become poor and to live with it, she doesn’t want her children to have that kind of life in the future. As much as possible, she will graduate them from college with a better career and options to cope with life’s challenges.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of rice to wholesale.

loans.name: Nematkul

texts.ru: Одинаев Нематкул проживает а районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Он намерен купить дойную корову и обеспечить свою семью молоком и кисло- молочной продукцией.
texts.en:
Nematkul O. lives in the Yavan district. He is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. He is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry at the same time. Nematkul raises and sells livestock. His wife helps him with it. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. Nematkul intends to buy a dairy cow and provide his family with milk and dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Jeffers

texts.en:
Jeffers is a 36-year-old married man with one child. He has a motor bike, which he uses for his own transport, and he offers motorbike servicing to other people. He goes from one place to another within the city of Nairobi, servicing motorbikes. He has been doing this kind of trade for the last year. He stays in Zimmerman estate where operates his business. He is strategically placed because Zimmerman is a highly populated region and there is more need for motorcycle services.

Jeffers was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. This is his first loan with KADET, having had no previous borrowing history. He wants to use the money from this loan to buy spare parts for servicing motorbikes, and to buy nine other motorbikes so that he can fully venture in to the taxi/transport industry. He will employ other people to manage the motorbikes for him.

He hopes to open and operate a garage and own at least 10 motorbikes.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a 33-year-old single and successful entrepreneur.  He bakes cakes and mandazi (Kenyan doughnut), a business he has been running for seven years, and has one employee.  He was previously selling bread before he ventured into this business. He hopes to expand his business by opening other branches to improve his standard of living. He has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 to buy sugar, an oven, flour and cooking oil. He describes his business as promising and exciting.

loans.use: To buy sugar, an oven, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 45-year-old married lady with three children. She raises chickens for sale at her place in Githurai. She has been in this business five years. Besides poultry farming, Purity wants to open a tailoring shop so that she can boost her income for the family’s well being. She already has the sewing machines, so all she needs is the materials and a place to set up the shop.

Purity was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. This is her fourth loan and she has had no previous loans from other micro-finance institutions. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed, and in addition she also plans to stock the tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed, and to open a tailoring shop

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people who are living in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vanna S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They each will use a loan for different purposes. Vanna and her husband, Mr. Phai Thuch, sell coconuts to support their family. They have four children, one of whom is a laborer on a mango farm, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

The family has a problem because their house is too old to live in. Thus, in order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Vanna S. decided to ask for a loan to construct another house.

loans.use: To construct a house

loans.name: Morris Maina

texts.en:
Morris is the father of three children and he is 36 years old. He operates a barber shop at Mwiki trading center near his home. He has been in this kind of business for ten years. 

Besides the barber shop, Morris also operates a green grocery stall within the same trading center. His wife Mercy is also a businesswoman.

Morris was introduced to KADET by a staff member during a marketing exercise. This will be Morris' second loan with KADET and he has not borrowed from other financial institutions before. He plans to add more stock to the grocery stall with things like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, kale and others. This will help him get more income. 

He hopes to buy his own pickup (a small truck) to transport tomatoes and other farm produce in the area.

loans.use: To add stock to his grocery stall.

loans.name: John Muturi

texts.en:
John is a 52-year-old gentleman who is married to Catherine and they are both farmers. They have one daughter, aged 20 years. John has been doing small-scale farming for the past ten years. He has been planting crops like maize and beans, but he specializes mostly with dairy farming.

He was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach in his home town - Gatundu. He plans to purchase a Friesian dairy cow with the loan he has applied for, and with the extra income that he hopes to generate he will add still another dairy cow. 

He hopes to be a famous dairy farmer and he describes himself as a hardworking farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Treob's Group

texts.en:
Four people who live in Thmey village in Kandal province make up this group loan. Mrs. Treob H. is the group leader who was selected by all the members and each of them will use a loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Srorn Sreng, are farmers who own a small piece of land. To support their family they grow crops to sell. On their land they have some problems because the soil is infertile, far from irrigation, and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Treob H. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizers, fuel and pesticide to increase crop production this year. Through their farming this couple supports three children, one of whom is a worker in a garment factory, another is attending the local public school and the last is too young to go to school or to work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fuel, and pesticide

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally P., who is a villager in Preay Totueng village in Kandal province, is 55 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Chhum Chory, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family. However, though this family tries to work hard, they cannot earn enough income because their field is far from an irrigation system, and they do not have enough money to support it. They would also like to start a new business. 

Thus, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Phally P. decided to seek a loan to buy a water machine, some piglets for breeding, and food for the pigs. She is the mother of two children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, some piglets, and pig food

loans.name: Susan Wanjiku

texts.en:
Susan Wanjiku is a 70-year-old lady who is married to Charles, and they are both farmers. Susan has been doing small-scale farming for the past 38 years. She has planted crops like maize, beans and bananas, but she specializes in dairy farming.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client and she plans to expand her dairy farming business with the loan for which she has applied. Susan intends to purchase another dairy cow to boost her farming business. 

Susan hopes to become a famous dairy farmer in her district and she describes herself as a hardworking farmer.

loans.use: To expand her dairy farming project

loans.name: Koemloeng

texts.en: Mrs. Koemloeng V. is 54 years old and she is a villager in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province. She is a widow who has one child who is a grocer. She lives in a house with five other people. She owns a general store where she sells groceries and other products. No matter how hard she tries to work with her business, she cannot earn enough income. Thus, in order to expand her business, Mrs. Koemloeng V. decided to apply for  a loan to buy more groceries for re-selling.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Simon Kamau

texts.en:
Simon is a 40-year-old farmer. He has one son and two daughters, aged 21, 17 and 7 years. Simon has been doing small-scale farming for the past fifteen years, planting crops like maize and beans. He also works at dairy farming, selling the milk for profit.

He was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach at his home town, Gatundu. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to expand his dairy farming business. Simon intends to purchase more dairy cows with the extra income he hopes to generate. 

His future hopes are to be a dairy cow breeder, and he believes his hard work will make this dream possible.

loans.use: To expand his dairy farming business by purchasing another cow

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret, a 38-year-old lady, is married to Charles and they are both small scale farmers. They are blessed with three daughters and one son whose ages are between 11 and 18. Margaret has been practicing both dairy farming and poultry keeping for the last ten years. This has been her source of income.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. She plans to expand both her dairy farm and poultry keeping with the loan for which she has applied. She has no credit history with any other MFI or Bank. Margaret intends to expand her poultry farm with the extra income generated from her farming businesses. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be a supplier of eggs and milk in large quantities, and she describes herself as a hardworking farmer.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farm and her dairy farm.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy C., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Chhun, 42, have been married since 1989 and have three sons, all of whom are in school. They live along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. Thy has been a construction worker for three years while his wife has been a garment factory worker for five years.

Thy does not have transportation for commuting to work and it’s difficult for him because he has to spend a lot of money for traveling cost. Facing this, Thy is asking for his first loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

This couple hopes to support their children’s further education so that they have good jobs when they finish their studying.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rours

texts.en:
Mrs. Rours Y. is a villager in Toul Krang village in Kandal province and she is 52 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family.

Her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Sriy, shown on the right in the photo, owns a wedding hall for people to rent when they have wedding ceremonies, parties and so on. Since he has a small wedding hall, Mr. Chamroeun Sriy wants to buy another wedding hall. Thus, Mrs. Rours Y. decided to seek a loan to buy another wedding hall for her husband’s business.

Mrs. Rours Y. is the mother of a child who owns many loudspeakers to play at wedding parties, other parties and so on.

loans.use: To buy another wedding hall

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab S., 38 (pictured here), has been married to her second husband since 2009. She has two daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Leab has been a garment factory worker since 2000. She is in the process of building a new house to live in, but the house is not finished yet. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to finish it and to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To finish her house building and to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Mrs. Loh K. is a village woman who lives with other family members. She lives in the west of Cambodia, about 12 km from Phnom Penh, the capital. To earn a living, she sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier or from fishermen. She is married, and blessed with six children. One is married and living away from home, and the other five are single. Both of her daughters work as employees in the garment industry. 

Also, Loh K. relies on extra cash that is earned by her husband, who drives a motorcycle taxi. Loh K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to improve her fish sales; any remaining money from the loan will decorate her old house.

loans.use: To improve her fish sales

loans.name: Yann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yann S. is a villager who lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. She is 42 years old and the leader of a group loan which consists of 6 members, offered by AMK. This loan will be used to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Yann S. is farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. For this farming, she owns a plowing machine to support her farming business, but one of the wheels of her plowing machine is broken. She would like to purchase a new wheel with her loan. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Yann S. is a widow of five children, three of whom are farmers and another who is a farming laborer, while the youngest one is 11 years old.

loans.use: To purchase a new wheel

loans.name: Leak

texts.en: Miss. Leak L. (shown in the photo), 23, is single, lives with her parents and brothers and sisters in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Leak has been a silk weaver for eight years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Leak is requesting her first loan in the amount of $900 to purchase silk material for her weaving business. She also will use a part of her loan to help her father to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for his farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and help her father to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for his farm.

loans.name: Alzira Salvador

texts.pt:
Alzira Salvador S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade casada e mãe de 6 filhos de 18, 16, 14, 11, 8 e 4 anos de idade, os 5 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Maputo para Boane em 1991 quando se juntou ao seu marido, local onde residem até hoje. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 18 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha cerca de 10 horas de tempo todos os dias. O seu marido também é negociante e ajuda nas despesas familiares. Alizira consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa para responder necessidades prévias que possam surgir.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku um dia quando passava perto da instituição, tendo entrado e se informar das modalidades. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (Capulanas) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais o seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 13.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt, ambos para a mesma actividade.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. O seu maior projecto é construir casas tipo dependências para aluguer, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar ainda mais no comércio.
texts.en:
Alzira Salvador S. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children who are 18, 16, 14, 11, 8 and 4 years old. The 5 older children attend school. Alzira only studied through 5th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents' lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own home, and apart from her children she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. Alzira left Maputo for Boane in 1991 to join her husband, and they still live there today. She has had her own business for more than 18 years and does not have any other employees. She works around 10 hours every day. Her husband is also a business owner and helps to pay the household expenses. Alizira earns approximately 5500.00 Meticales each month, which go towards paying the household expenses. She also saves some money at home in order to cover any unforeseen needs. Alzira had previously taken out loans with the credit cooperative TCHUMA but later decided not to continue for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] one day when she was passing by the Institution, as she entered and found out about the options available there. This is her 3rd loan, for the amount of 25,000.00 Meticales. She will use this money to buy capulanas [long pieces of fabric that have various uses] in order to increase and diversify the products she sells. Her earlier loans were for 13,000.00 Meticales e 18,000.00 Meticales, and both were used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. Her main project is the construction of small houses to rent out. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of capulanas

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mrs. Un S., 60, a widow with three daughters, has been producing Khmer noodles since 1980, selling her product in her village and to nearby villages. Un is asking for a loan of $600 to help her daughter purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for her rice farm.

loans.use: To help her daughter purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for her rice farm.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El M., a 28-year-old married mother, lives with her husband and children in a small house located in a village near Phnom Penh. There, she earns a living selling clothes door-to-door. She and her husband awake early each morning to prepare their clothes and then deliver them by motorbike to sell, generating on average $8 each day which they use to support their family needs and especially to ensure that one of their young children is able to attend school.

In order to make more revenue, El M. is requesting a loan both to purchase a motorcycle trailer to enable her husband to begin a passenger service and to improve her clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle trailer and improve her business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 29 years old, is a married woman and the mother of a young child who is enrolled in school. Her husband (he is pictured) has a small business where he sells many sets of cooking supply as mobility in and around the provinces of Cambodia.

In addition, C. is an internal staff member working in a garment factory. C. finds that her husband's produce sale trade is a very profitable one and it also provides the family with a good standard of living. Recently her husband has lacked a supply of cash to buy additional products to better meet the needs of his customers, so that is why C. pursues a loan.

loans.use: To buy additional products.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea C. is 33 years old and she is a group leader for a loan that consists of 4 members offered by AMK located in Preak Ta Ong 1 village in Kandal province. These members will use the loan to support different purposes. 

Mrs. Sophea C. and her husband, Mr. Kimsieng C., are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate sesame. In order to support her growing crop, Mrs. Sophea C. is now requesting 800,000 Riel from AMK to buy sesame seed to grow her sesame farming business. Mrs. Sophea C. is a mother of three children, two of whom are students in the local school, while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy sesame seed to grow

loans.name: Bunnarith

texts.en:
Mr. Bunnarith H. is a motor remoque driver and has been married to Mrs. Sokmoeun Yoy since 1994. A remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and the other one is still young. They are living in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bunnarith has already asked for a Kiva loan twice. He now is applying for another loan in the amount of $700 to make a handrail for his house and build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.use: To make a handrail for his house and build a restroom for the family to use.

loans.name: Olarewaju

texts.en:
Olarewaju sells motor spare parts at retail prices to his customers and has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell.

Olarewaju is a hardworking man. He is 35 years old and married with two children. His children attend school and this gives him joy. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sou Phorn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of four members and is offered by AMK, is led by Mrs. Sou P. N.. She is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is a salesperson (Marketing Officer), another is a driver, while the others are students in the local school. They all are live in Pou Thum village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Sou P. N. is a farming laborer and her husband, Mr. Thary Taem is a soldier who receives a small salary to support his family. Now, Mrs. Sou P. N. is requesting 800,000 Riels from AMK to add to her savings to build her house.

loans.use: To add her savings to build her house

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
