Laurence G. is 48 years old and is a rice farmer. He has four children and his income is being utilized to supply all their needs and to pay school fees. He told CEVI that, aside from farming, he also raises pigs to supplement the family income. His dream for his children is for them to graduate in their studies so that they land good employment when they are older.

Laurence would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is hopeful that, by starting a small business, she will be able to make a profit, which she can use to support some of her family's needs. This is especially true of her four children, whose ages range from one to nine years old. To support their education until college, she hopes to grow and stabilize her business.

Since her husband is a fisherman, she wanted to start a business selling fish by using the loan she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI. Aside from that, Anecita and her husband want to use the natural resources in their surroundings in order to earn money for their family. They live along the seashore in the municipality of Hamtic in Antique Province. Thus, fishing and selling fish is one of the most common livelihoods of the people.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El M. is a local fish trader living in the capital of Phnom Penh. She has been engaged her own business at the market for years. Through her business she has the ability to provide enough food for her family. A widowed mother, she is bringing up two children while another two of her children are married and live separately. She has a daughter who is employed and provides little cash for the family. 

El M. always uses a very old motorbike to travel or supply the transportation for the business. Recently the motorbike broke down which she was using it for work and she hopes to exchange it. Because El M. doesn’t have enough money, she decided to ask for a loan of US$ 500 which will enable her to achieve her purpose.

loans.use: To exchange an old motorbike

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him S. is a Cambodian worker who has been working in the local garment industry located in the middle of Phnom Penh for more than eight years. Her husband helps her support their family by fishing. She is aged 40 years and has given birth to four children. Two of them are married and employed and the other two attend school or go to work. 

Him S. will use this loan to add to her savings in order to repair/decorate her old house. This will provide her with a comfortable living place for her family.

loans.use: To repair/decorate her old house

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en:
Wahab is happily married with 4 children. He is 60 years old and he is also a grandfather. He sells motorcycle spare parts in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is very happy with his business. He uses his experience in business to attract and retain customers. He hopes to expand his business. 

Wahab needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy P., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sy Hoem , 43 (pictured together), have been married since 1990 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and other three are in school. The family lives in a small village located seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.
	
Chanthy has been selling fish for ten years. She buys fish from fisherman in her village and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction worker for seven years. She hopes to expand her business so she will able to get additional income. So she is asking for her first loan in the amount of US$ 600 to buy more fish for resale.

Chanthy also will use a part of her loan to purchase a trailer for her son-in-law to use as a motor 'remorque' taxi. A 'remorque' is a motorbike attached to a trailer at the back.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale and a trailer to attach to a motorbike

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree S. is a 24-year-old single parent to her two children aged two and four years old. She faces the challenge of raising her children alone and provides them with the basic things they need every day. 

Since this is the case, Desiree wants to have a stable source of income. With low educational attainment, she believes that the only way she can attain this is by growing her own business since she cannot get employed in any government or private office. 

Fortunately, she heard about ASHI and the services it offers to poor women. After she was recognized as an official member of the institution just recently, she requested a loan to start up a fish-selling business. 

She expects that the profit from this business that is just getting started will be small. However, it would be of great help to Desiree and her children. Someday she wishes that, through Kiva and ASHI, she will be able to request for a much larger loan in order to achieve her vision of a grown business.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Sop

texts.en:
Because of income, Mrs. Sop S., age 58, sells both used and new clothes at the local busy market. From that she is able to feed her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband divorced her when her child was very small. Now her child is grown and can support the family by selling a few groceries. 

Recently Sop S. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Szana

texts.en:
Szana is 30 years old and married to a spare parts dealer. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance and has maintained a good relationship for some years now. Szana sells 'fairly used' clothes to make a living and has been in the business for the past six years.

Szana is asking for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more fairly used clothes to sell, as this will enable her to get a better discount and more profit on each sale. She said this will also give her a better opportunity to save for the future. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Savann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savann V. is a villager who lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She is 30 years old and the leader of group loan which consists of 4 members, offered by AMK. 

Mrs. Savann V. is a tailor who can earn only a little income to support her family. She wants to expand this business. Thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabric to make clothes for customers. With this loan she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.  Her husband, Mr. Sophal Sok, is a construction worker who can make a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to make clothes for customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 52 years old, is from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. She has a farm, which she hopes can provide her family with their daily needs. She has two children. Aside from the farm, she has also ventured into a hog-raising business. She wishes to sustain her livelihood and moreover, to be able to improve their family's economic condition. 

Victoria wants to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 through Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste Chitchango nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 18 e 15 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Fez somente 9 ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com o seu esposo que é motorista de profissão e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu do bairro onde vivia com os seus pais para o bairro de Jardim junto ao seu marido. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha sem horário fixo, fazendo cerca de 12 horas de trabalho por dia. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique semanal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, tijoleiras e outros) para melhorar as condições de Habitação na sua família.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar ainda mais na sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Celeste Chitchango was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 37 years old, married, and is the mother of 2 children who are 18 and 15 years old. Both children attend school. Celeste only studied through 9th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents' lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her husband, who works as a driver, and she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. She left the neighborhood where she lived with her parents to go to the Jardim neighborhood with her husband. She has owned her own business for more that 2 years and doesn't have any other employees. She doesn't work on a fixed schedule but works around 12 hours a day. She earns approximately 5500.00 meticales each month, and uses this money to pay for household expenses. She also saves some money each week through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Celeste has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a neighbor who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stones, bricks and other items) in order to improve her family's living conditions. Her earlier loans were for 13,000.00 Meticales e 18,000.00 Meticales, and both were used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards her business activities.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, and other items)

loans.name: Alapo

texts.en: Alapo is a 55-year-old married man with four children. His children are making progress in their business and school. He sells drinks at retail prices to his customers. He has a bar where he sells drinks. Business is very good for Alapo in the evenings because it is the time when his customers get together to drink and chat after the day’s job. He loves this business because he does not sell on credit to his customers. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to make more profits. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Samoeun I., 60 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Onn Pich, 52 years old (pictured together), live about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of them is a construction worker, another one is a blacksmith, and the other two attend school.

Samoeun has been a physician for 30 years. His wife stays at home and does housework. By the way, under his wooden house is an open-air space, which makes it difficult for him to protect his home from the elements. Hence, he is asking for a loan of $600 to build a brick room under his wooden house.

loans.use: To build a brick room under his wooden house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen B. has been married for 31 years. She is a rice grower from Norala, South Cotabato. She has five children. The income that she gets from growing rice has helped her family a lot—in buying food and meeting other basic needs. Now, she has a little problem in financing her rice farm, which is why she needed to apply for a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Abdul

texts.pt:
Abdul Remane B. nasceu no Distrito da Moamba, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de idade casado e pai de 6 filhos de 24, 22, 20, 18, 10 e 8 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 9ª  classe, não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar Obrigatório. Vive na casa do Governo com a sua família, ainda sustenta a mãe e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Moamba para cidade de Maputo em 1962, onde tem a sua própria residência. Depois de regressar da Tanzânia onde foi como militar, foi afecto em Boane ainda como membro do ministério da Defesa em 1975. Actualmente continua trabalhar neste Ministério como Administrativo e responsável pela logística onde trabalha cerca de 8 horas de tempo e tem um salário de 13.075.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Millenium Bim mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também já se beneficiaram dos serviços desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 16.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Abdul Remane B. was born in the district of Moamba, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 55 years old, married, and has 6 children who are 24, 22, 20, 18, 10 and 8 years old. All of them are in school. Abdul only finished 9th grade. He didn't continue with his studies because he had to fulfill the obligatory military service. He lives in a government house with his family, and also takes care of his mother and two nephews who live with him. He left Moamba for the city of Maputo in 1962, where he now has his own home. After returning from Tanzania, where he had been sent as a soldier, he began to work in Boane for the Ministry of Defense in 1975. He still works for the Ministry in administration and is responsible for logistics. He works around 8 hours a day. He has a monthly salary of 13.075.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account each month. Abdul had taken out loans before with the Banco Millenium Bimbank, but he decided not to continue for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who have also benefited from working with the institution. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, stones, sand blocks and other items) in order to continue working on his construction project. His earlier loan was for 16,000.00 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement and other items)

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
António V. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 59 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 30, 24, 22, 17, e 12 anos de idade, os 2 mais novos é que vão a escola. Fez somente 7 ª classe não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia, e sustenta o pai enviando dinheiro para as despesas de casa. 
Saiu de Inhambane Para Maputo com os pais quando tinha 3 anos de idade, mais tarde foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório no tempo colonial. Depois da sua desmobilização começa a trabalhar na empresa Telecomunicações de Moçambique, onde fez acima de 25 anos de carreira profissional. Actualmente é reformado desta empresa e tem uma pensão de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 28.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, pedra, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 11.200.00mt, 20.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência para oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
António V. was born in Inhambane province, in southern Mozambique. He is 59 years old, is married and has 5 children, ages 30, 24, 22, 17, and 12. The two youngest go to school. António only finished 7th grade; he didn't continue with school because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and he supports his father by sending him money for household expenses. He left Inhambane for Maputo with his parents when he was 3 years old. Later, he was drafted into military service in the colonial era. After his demobilization, he began to work for Mozambique Telecommunications, where he spent more than 25 years of his professional career. He is currently retired from this company and has a pension of 5,500 MZN per month, which he uses for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account. António has never taken out loans from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his fourth loan. He is asking for 28,000 MZN, with which he wants to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, stone, cement, sand and other items) to continue building his house. The earlier loans were for 11,200 MZN, 20,000 MZN and 20,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out more loans. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to finish his home and offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement and zinc sheets)

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda D., 50 years old, is a rice farmer and has six adult children. She said that she is always praying to God that He will bless her family with good harvests to provide for their daily needs. Recently, she has been busy preparing for the next planting. However, she said, she still needs additional money to complete the process. She would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Her children are still young, and they are dependent on her. Her husband is a mechanic, and he also supports their home. She sells motor spare parts to make a living. She has been in this business for 11 years, and she is itching for expansion in her business. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. She needs a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa T. is hoping to start a small fish-selling business using the loan she is presently requesting from Kiva through its partner ASHI. Proceeds of this business will be used to support the needs of her family. She has two children, ages 12 and 13 years, to raise and support and thus wants to augment the small and sporadic income of her husband.  Josefa wants to work hard to earn money and be able to improve the kind of life she can offer to her children. Though the enterprise may not provide abundance, at least it could be enough for them to enjoy and have worthwhile lives.

loans.use: To purchase fish for selling.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly M. (pictured above), is a 55-year-old widow with two sons and four daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, while another is a garment factory worker and other two attend university and high school respectively. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Ly has been a farmer since 1979, growing rice and vegetables on her farmland in the village. She hopes to continue increasing the volume of her productivity and so is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for her farm.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has a shop where she sells men's and women's clothing,  e.g., trousers and shirts, bags, and more.  She buys in bulk and sells retail. She travels out of Lagos to purchase goods to sell at a discount and she has been in this business since 2005.

Lilian is 33 years old; with the income from her business she has been able to care for her aged parents who lived with her in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothing to sell. She says thanks to all lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Salvador Caetano

texts.pt:
Salvador Caetano António nasceu no Distrito de Chinde, Província da Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 14, 10, 05 anos e 1 de 06 meses de idade, os 3 mais velhos é que vão a escola. Fez bacharelato na faculdade de ciências pedagógicas. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia, e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele. 
Saiu de Zambézia para Maputo a casa da sua irmã para dar continuidade com os seus estudos, depois da formação no Instituto de Magistério Primário na Matola, ingressou no Ministério da Educação onde trabalha ate então como docente sem horário fixo. E do Quadro deste ministério a mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário mensal de 6.444.44mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos em outros bancos (Novo Banco) e mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, pedra, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores que obteve no Novo Banco foram de 15.000.00mt, 25.000.00mt e 38.000.00mt todos foram fechados também destinados para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência, assim como para iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Salvador Caetano A. was born in the district of Chinde, in the province of Zambezia in the central region of Mozambique. He is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children whose ages are 14, 10 and 5 years, and 6 months. The 3 older children go to school. Salvador has a degree in Pedagogical Sciences. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of two brothers who live with him. He left Zambezia for his sister's house in Maputo in order to continue with his education. After finishing his studies at the Instituto de Magistério Primário [Institute for Primary Education] in Matola, he began to work for the Ministry of Education as a teacher. He continues to work in the same job today, with a relatively free work schedule. He has been employed by the Ministry of Education for more than 5 years and doesn't employ anyone else to help him. He has a monthly salary of 6444.44 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is occasionally able to save some money in his bank account. Salvador had taken out loans before with another bank (Novo Banco), but he decided not to continue for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who have also worked with the institution. This is his 1st loan, for the amount of 25,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (zinc plates, stones, cement, sand and other items) in order to continue working on his construction project. His earlier loans from Novo Banco were for 15,000.00, 25,000.00 and 38,000.00 Meticales All were repaid and were used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and also to start a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, blocks, and other items)

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Tom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang T. is 48 years old and she is president of a village bank that consists of 22 people located in Prey Ampok village in Takeo province. These members will be using this loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Leang T. and her husband, Mr. Sothun Prak, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn too little income to support their family. Now, Mrs. Leang T. wants to start a new business, thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and make a pigpen. The rest of the loan she will use to buy pig feed for her breeding pigs. 

This couple has five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other four are attending in local school and also help their parent with farming.

loans.use: To buy piglets and make a pigpen and buy feed

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
The smiling man appearing in the picture above, Mr. S., age 30, resides in a village located near Phnom Penh city. He currently owns a truck that he uses to provide transport service for a profit. He has a partner in his wife who stays at home to do housework. 

This couple married a few years ago, but they do not have a child yet and they plan to have a child next year. From the business, S. is able to generate an average of US$ 10 per day to cover family expenses. Recently his truck’s motor often has broken down during the process and his income has also been affected. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to be used to hire a mechanic to mend his broken down truck.

loans.use: To hire a mechanic to mend his broken-down truck

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Gilda M. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província do Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade que não vai a escola ainda. Fez 10ą classe e mais tarde fez a formação de professores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a mãe enviando valores monetários para despesas caseiras.  
Saiu de Manhiça para Boane através de uma transferência dos serviços, é docente funcionária do Ministério de Educação a 8 anos. Foi formada pelo Instituto de Magistério Primário de Chibututuine a 8 anos, faz cerca de 8 horas de trabalho por dia, não possui nenhum empregado e conta com um salário de 7.872.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pregos, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Gilda M. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, married, and is the mother of a 5-year-old son who does not yet attend school. Gilda studied through 10th grade and later completed a degree in teaching. She lives in her own home with her family, and she helps to support her mother by sending her money for her household expenses. She left Manhiça for Boane because she was transferred at work. She has been a teacher, working for the Ministry of Education, for 8 years. She completed her studies in Education 8 years ago at the Instituto de Magistério Primário [Institute for Primary Education] in Chibututuine and now works around 8 hours a day. She doesn't employ anyone else to help her and she earns approximately 7872.00 Meticales each month. She uses this money to pay for household expenses and also saves some money each month in her bank account. Gilda has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, nails, zinc plates and other items) in order to finish her construction project. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and then furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (zinc plates, cement and other items)

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa C. has always been spending her loan from ASHI wisely in a business which enables her to have an income for her family. This time, she is requesting for a much larger loan from Kiva through its field partner, ASHI to be able to finance her dream of growing her small variety store business into a big grocery store which can give her customers convenience in accessing their daily basic needs. 

With this loan she is planning to purchase rice and animal feed such as for hog-raising and chicken-raising to be sold in her store. For her family especially for her two children and grandchildren, she really works hard to sustain the business and increase its profit. In this fashion, her family’s way of life will be improved and will be raised above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store.

loans.name: Adelia Silvino

texts.pt:
Adélia Silvino L. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província da Maputo, fronteira com a Suazilândia, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 18, 07,04 e 2 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos é que vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a Gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia, e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da sua família. 
Saiu de Namaacha para Boane ainda jovem com os pais, depois do casamento continuou a viver nesta cidade com a sua família. Tem um negócio próprio que exerce desde o ano de 2007, aprendeu esta actividade sozinha em sua casa, onde conta com uma empregada. Vende mais perfumes, deodorantes onde trabalha das 07h as 18:30horas todos os dias. Consegue um rendimento diário de cerca de 800.00mt a 1.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (perfumes, pomadas de beleza, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto e satisfazer o seu mercado. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir um meio de transporte próprio.
texts.en:
Adelia Silvino L. was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children who are 18, 7, 4 and 2 years old. The two older children attend school. She only studied through 8th grade, and didn't continue because of an early pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her family and she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. She left Namaacha for Boane with her parents when she was young. After marrying she continued to live in Boane with her family. Adelia has owned her own business since 2007. She learned how to run a business on her own at home, where she has one employee. She works selling perfumes and deodorants from 7:00 AM to 6:30 PM each day. She earns approximately 800-1000 Meticales a day, and uses this money to pay for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account. Adelia has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy merchandise (perfume, beauty creams, and other items) in order to increase the products she sells and satisfy her customers. Her earlier loan was for 12,000 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to buy her own means of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products, paper and other goods

loans.name: Savinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Savinh D. (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Boeun Chea, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and have been married for over thirty years. They have six children, two daughters and four sons. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, one is a soldier, another is a construction worker and the youngest one is in school. 

Savinh has been a silk weaver since she was 27 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.  She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Angelica Alberto

texts.pt:
Angélica Alberto T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casada não tem filhos. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa dos serviços sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ela, o marido é também professor. 
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane transferido pelos serviços, trabalha como docente no Distrito de Boane a mais de 2 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Trabalha cerca de 8 horas por dia. Naõ tem empregado e aufere um salário de 4.822.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, carrinha de mão e outros) para iniciar com a construção da sua residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a obra de construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Angelica Alberto T. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 30 years old and married with no children. She studied through 12th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives in a service workers' house with her husband, who is also a teacher, and she helps support a nephew who lives with her. Angelica left Maputo for Boane due to a job transfer. She has worked as a teacher in the Boane district for more than 2 years, and is employed by the Ministry of Education. She works around 8 hours a day. She has no employees working for her and takes home a monthly salary of 4822.00 Meticales, which she uses to cover household expenses. She is sometimes able to save some money in her bank account. Angelica has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues of hers who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 15,500.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (zinc plates, cement, a wheelbarrow and other items) in order to start construction on her house. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to continue with her home construction project.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates and other items)

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa J. farms a small rice field. She is from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato and is living with her relatives because she doesn't have a husband yet.  Now, she is busy raising pigs. She needed additional money to buy piglets and feed. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to support her piggery.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Orlando Siquela

texts.pt:
Nao foi possivel a foto no local ddo negocio 

Orlando Siquela F. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 15, 8, 6, 4 e 2 anos de idade, 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã mais velha enviando valores monetários para custear as despesas caseiras. 
Saiu da cidade do Maputo para Boane quando o irmão vendeu a casa, fixaram nova residência e continuaram com o seu negócio. Trabalha numa empresa de produção e venda de banana (Bananalandia) e faz cerca de 8 horas de trabalho por dia. Nos tempos livres desenvolve a sua actividade de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Tem um salário mensal de 1.500.00mt, e um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt do seu negócio, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (açúcar, arroz, óleo, amendoim e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.  
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a área de construção e para a criação de animais de venda como forma de desenvolver mais o seu negócio
texts.en:
It was not possible to take a photo at Orlando's place of work. Orlando Siquela F. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. He is 32 years old, married, and is the father of 5 children who are 15, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. The 3 older children attend school. Orlando only studied through 6th grade and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and also helps support his older sister, sending her money to cover her household expenses. He left Maputo for Boane when his brother sold his home. They set up residence there and continued with their business. Orlando works in a business that grows and sells bananas, called Bananalandia. He works around 8 hours a day. In his free time he works selling basic everyday necessities. He has a monthly salary of 1500.00 Meticales and an income from his business of around 3000.00 Meticales. He uses these earnings to cover household expenses and also saves some money in his bank account. Orlando has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a neighbor who also works with the institution. This is his 4th loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy products (sugar, rice, cooking oil, peanuts and other items) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. His earlier loans were for 3000.00, 6000.00 and 10,000.00 Meticales, and were used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to apply for more loans for construction and to raise animals for sale in order to further develop his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (sugar, rice, cooking oil, peanuts and other items)

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mr. Ne N. (pictured with his wife, daughter, and nephew), has been married since 2004 and they have two children: one son who attends school and one young daughter. The family is living in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ne has been driving a motor remorque for over two years; 'remorque' is a motorbike with a trailer at the back. His wife has been a garment factory worker for over eleven years as well. 

Ne’s wife does not have transportation for commuting to work, so she needs to spend a lot of money for traveling costs. Facing this, Ne is applying for loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his wife to get work. 

When she has her own transportation, Ne’s wife will be able to save some money by not spending it on traveling costs any more.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his wife to drive to work.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane G., 31 years old, is a rice farmer. She lives in Norala Cotabato together with her two children. She started farming back in 1999. The farm that she has tilled for ten years is the one helping her cover daily expenses in their home. She desires a bountiful harvest so that she could be able to accommodate the needs of her family.

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. If she gets a loan, she will be able to grow her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Miguel Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Miguel Sebastiao M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 19, 16, 10 e 6 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando valores monetários para custear as despesas caseiras. 
Saiu da cidade de Namaacha para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, actualmente trabalha na empresa ARA SUL e desenvolve uma actividade comercial a mais de 10 anos. Faz cerca de 6 horas de trabalho por dia, tem um empregado que auxilia no seu nogocio. Tem um salário de 4.523.00mt e um rendimento de 3.000.00mt por mês proveniente do seu negócio que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (roupa usada diversa) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.0000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a construir o seu murro de vedação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Miguel Sebastiao M. was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 19, 16, 10 and 6 years old. The children all attend school. Miguel only studied through 6th grade, and didn't continue because he had to fulfill the obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his family and helps support his mother, sending her money to cover her household expenses. Miguel left Namaacha for Boane searching for a better life. He currently works for a company called ARA SUL and has also run his own business for more than 10 years. He works around 6 hours a day and has an employee who helps him with his business. He has a monthly salary of 4523.00 Meticales and an income of 3000.00 Meticales per month from his business. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some money in his bank account. Miguel has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a neighbor who also works with the institution. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy products (various types of used clothing) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. His earlier loans were for 10,000.00, 15,000.00 and 15,000.00 Meticales, and were used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to apply for more loans in order to build a protective wall around his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo is an honest and hard-working man. He produces and sells paint in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He loves this business because he is able to produce paint himself. He has been in this business for 4 years. He hopes to own a big paint company in the future. 

Taiwo is 39 years and married with a child. His child is 5 years old and attends school. Taiwo is requesting the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more materials to produce more paint to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce more paint to sell

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide Paulino M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 32 anos de idade casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 6 e 1 anos de idade, apenas o de 6 anos é que vai a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
Nunca saiu da cidade, cresceu e sempre viveu em Maputo. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha das 06 as 23:00horas. Esta actividade aprendeu da sua mãe há 14 anos, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.200.00mt por dia, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Xitique mensal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua vizinha que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 4.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 9.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e outros para aquisição de uma viatura.
texts.en:
Adelaide Paulino M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 32 years old, married, and is the mother of 2 children who are 6 and 1 years old. The 6 year old attends school. Adelaide only studied through 6th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her family and she isn't responsible for supporting anyone financially besides her children. Adelaide never left Maputo, she grew up there and has always lived there. She has owned her own business for more than 5 years and doesn't have any other employees. She works from 6:00 AM to 11:00 PM. She learned about this business from her mother 14 years ago, and earns approximately 1200.00 meticales a day. She uses this money to pay for household expenses, and also saves some money each month through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Adelaide has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a neighbor who also works with the institution. This is her 5th loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (sand, cement, iron, and other items) in order to continue with the construction of her home. Her earlier loans were for 4000.00, 8000.00, and 9000.00 Meticales, and were used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish building her house and to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement and other items)

loans.name: Joaquim Luís

texts.pt:
Joaquim luís Jo B. nasceu na cidade da Beira, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 8 anos de idade, que vai a escola. Fez o ensino técnico profissional não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu irmão e para alem dele sustenta o filho que vive com a mãe.
Saiu da cidade da Beira para Maputo sozinho para vir morar com os seus pais há 15 anos, pois na Beira vivia com os tios. E docente e é do quadro do Ministério de Educação há 5 anos e faz um horário das 12 as 17:00 horas. Foi formado há 6 anos no Instituto do Magistério Primário de Chibututuine, aufere um salário de 6.577.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária no Banco Millenium Bim.
Já teve empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA, e dicidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do Sr. Francisco Chamancono que também é cliente da mesma instituição e havia lhe solicitado para o servir de avalista no seu empréstimo. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 12.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, chapas de Zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua residência de forma a garantir melhor conforto de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Joaquim Luís Jo B. was born in the city of Beira, Sofala province, in central Mozambique. He is 29 years old, single, and has one son who is 8 years old and goes to school. He received professional technical instruction, but was not able to continue due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his brother, whom he supports. Joaquim Luís also supports his own son who lives with his mother. He left Beira for Maputo by himself 15 years ago to live with his parents; in Beira, he had lived with his aunt and uncle. He is a teacher and has been on the staff of the Ministry of Education for 5 years; he works from 12pm to 5pm. He graduated six years ago from the Primary Education Institute in Chibututuine. As a teacher, he earns a monthly salary of 6,577 MZN, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He even saves some in his account with the Millenium Bim bank. He had a loan with the TCHUMA credit cooperative, but decided not to continue with them for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku through Mr. Francisco Chamancono who is also a client with the institution. Joaquim Luís has asked Francisco to serve as a guarantor for his loan. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, which has a value of 12,500 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, zinc plates, etc.) in order to continue building his house. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to finish and furnish his home in order to ensure better comfort and living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, etc.)

loans.name: Gloria Fatima

texts.pt:
Gloria da Fátima D. nasceu no Distrito de Altomolocue, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de idade casada e mãe de 7 filhos de 34, 32, 25, 16, 14, 12 e 10 anos de idade, três deste vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, tem ajudado no sustento da seu neto em despesas alimentares.
Sai da Zambézia para Boane com seus pais quando foram transferidos pelos serviços, depois de seu casamento continuou a residir em Boane. E funcionaria permanente do Ministério de Educação, faz horário único das 7h as 15:30horas todos os dias de semana e não possui nenhum empregado. Aufere um salário mensal de 5.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, barrotes, tubos de canalização, cimento, areia e outros) para poder concluir com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Gloria da Fátima D. was born in the Altomolocue district, Zambézia province, in central Mozambique. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children who are 34, 42, 25, 16, 14, 12, and 10 years old. Three of her children attend school. She finished 12th grade, and did not continue on due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family, and has helped to support her grandson with food expenses. She left Zambézia for Boane with her parents when they were transferred from their jobs. After she got married, she continued to live in Boane. She is a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education, and works each day from 7am to 3:30pm; she doesn't have any other employees. She earns a monthly salary of 5,500 MZN, which she uses to pay for household expenses. She even saves some in her bank account. She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her 2nd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy construction material (rebar, support beams, drainage pipes, cement, sand, etc.) in order to continue with her work [building of her house]. Her other loan was for 10,000 MZN, for the same purpose. In the future she would like to request more loans to finish and furnish her house in order to offer better comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, etc.)

loans.name: Domingos Cumbane

texts.pt:
Domingos Cumbane S. nasceu na Província de Tete, Norte de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 5, 3, anos e gémeos de 10 meses de idade, o mais velho vai a escolinha. Frequenta 11ą classe, não foi possível continuar antes porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com seus familiares não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de sua família.
Sai da Província de Tete para Borne afim de cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório no ano de 1984. Depois de terminar com a sua carreira militar decidiu continuar a trabalhar no Ministério da Defesa como motorista. Mais tarde casou se com a sua esposa e fixaram uma residência no bairro 07 no Distrito de Boane onde vive actualmente com a sua família. Faz este trabalho há mais de 24 anos e tem como salário o valor de 3.300.00mt por, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Millenium Bim, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, barrotes, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar perfeitamente a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Domingos Cumbane S. was born in Tete province in northern Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 4 children who are 5, 3, and 10 months (twins). The oldest goes to school. He attended 11th grade, but was not able to continue because he was drafted into obligatory military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and doesn't support anyone else besides them. He left Tete province for Boane to fulfill his obligatory military service in 1984. After finishing his military career, he decided to continue to work in the Ministry of Defense as a driver. Later, he married his wife and they secured a house in Bairro 07 in Boane district, where he lives now with his family. He has been at this job for more than 24 years and earns a monthly salary of 3,300 MZN. He uses this to pay for household expenses and he even saves some in his bank account. He has had loans with the Millennium Bim bank, but he later decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction material (rebar, support beams, cement, sand, etc.) in order to finish with his work [building his house]. The previous loan was for 7,000 MZN, for the same purpose. In the future, he would like to request more loans to perfectly finish and furnish his house in order to offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Ricardo Orlando

texts.pt:
Ricardo Orlando M. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de13, 10 e 6 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Inhambane para Boane com seus irmãos em 1992 a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 17 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha das 7h as 17:00 horas todos os dias. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também já se beneficiaram dos serviços desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (saias, fatinhos de roupa e outra roupa diversa) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 11.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Ricardo Orlando M. was born in Inhambane province in southern Mozambique. He is 38 years old, married, and the father of 3 children who are 13, 10, and 6 years old. All of them attend school. He only finished 5th grade and did not continue because of his parents' lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Inhambane for Boane with his siblings in 1992 in order to search for a better life. He has had his own business for more than 17 years and does not have any employees. He works daily from 7am to 5pm and earns about 5,000 MZN per month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He even saves some in his bank account. He has had other loans through the TCHUMA credit cooperative, but he later decided not to continue with them for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku through friends who also have benefitted from the services of this institution. This is his 3rd loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy goods (skirts, suits, and other types of clothes) in order to increase his supply. The previous loans were for 11,000 MZN and 15,000 MZN, both for the same purpose. He promises to duly pay back this loan in order to have access to others. In the future, he would like to request more loans to finish building his house in order to offer better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell used clothing

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric S. is married and has three children. He has senior high educational background. Eric makes palm kernel oil for sale, he also sells palm fruit and wild meat at Elmina. Eric has been in this business for quite a long time. His wife is a petty trader.  

Eric uses his income to pay his children’s school fees, the family utility bills and cover other expenditures.  Eric will use the loan as additional capital to purchase more palm nuts for sale and also for the preparation of palm kennel oil, and for bush meat for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to save to establish a livestock farm.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase more palm nuts and bush meat for sale

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yamoussa Dembélé  est âgé de 27 ans, marié et sans enfant, il réside avec son épouse à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Yamoussa Dembélé a très vite abandonné les études pour des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, qu’il décida d’apprendre le métier de tailleur brodeur depuis l’année 2002. Son atelier de couture se trouve devant son domicile à Sanoubougou I où il dispose déjà 4 machines dont une machine de broderie et trois machines simples. 
Monsieur Dembélé est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter une machine de broderie dans le souci de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yamoussa Dembélé is 27 years old and married, but he has no children. He lives with his wife in Sanoubougou 1, one of the popular districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Yamoussa Dembélé abandoned his studies at a very early stage in favour of finding an income generating activity. Only after having unsuccessfully carried out a number of activities did he decide to learn the trade of a tailor/embroiderer in 2002. In his sewing workshop, which is just in front of his house in Sanoubougou 1, he already has four machines, one of which is an embroidery machine and the others simple sewing machines. Mr. Dembélé is in great demand from his customers owing to the quality of his service. In order to satisfy better the ever increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance company, with which he in on his first individual loan. With this first loan he is planning on buying an embroidery machine in order to respond to customer demand which continues to increase. He hopes, by taking up this loan, to make a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to expand his business, to contribute to family expenses and to pay the interest on the loan; he will invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new embroidery machine

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celina M. nasceu Gaza tem 45 anos de idade e divorciada mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 10 aos 26 anos, Duas é que vão a escola. Responsabiliza se pelos seus netos que vivem com ela em sua casa consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00mt.


Celina sai de Inhambane para Vila de Namaacha quando seu marido é transferido, anos depois é abandonada pelo marido deixando a com 5 filhos por criar, então ela vende seus utensílios domésticos nomeadamente (mantas, capulanas e loiça) e dá início do seu próprio negócio de venda de potes. Pois alguns filhos já nem podiam ir a escola, hoje é uma grande negociante de potes tem vendido duas vezes por semana (quartas e sábados) no Mercado Informal das 5h as 17h assim como também tem tido encomendas na Suazilândia de 15 em 15 dias fazendo a entrega nos meados do mês e o levantamento do valor no fim de cada mês assim sucessivamente. Tem gastando 15.000.00mt por viagem tendo de lucro de 8.000.00mt dependendo muito mas da estação do tempo porque o reino suazi aprecia muito este tipo de panelas de alumínio.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Celina na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 10.000.00mt foi usado para aumentar o volume dos seus potes, o segundo de 10.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade e este terceiro de 13.000.00mt serão usados para adquirir mais potes e satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes a tempo recorde.
texts.en:
Celina M. was born in Gaza province. She is 45 years old and the divorced mother of 5 children who are between 10 and 26 years old. Two of them attend school. She is also responsible for her grandchildren who live with her in her house. Celina is able to save 1,000 MZN per month. Celina left Inhambane for the town of Namaacha when her husband was transferred. Years later, she was abandoned by her husband and left to raise her 5 children. She sells namely domestic goods (blankets, traditional capulana skirts, and kitchenware) and has started her own business selling pots. Some of her children are not able to go to school anymore. Today, Celina is a big seller of pots; she sells her goods two times per week (Wednesdays and Saturdays) in the Informal Market ("Shoprite") from 5am to 5pm. She also takes order from Swaziland; every 15 days she makes her deliveries, around the middle of the month. She also raises the value of her products around the end of each month. She has spent 15,000 MZN per trip, making a profit of around 8,000 MZN depending on the season as Swaziland values these types of aluminum pots. This is Celina's third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first loan was for 10,000 MZN, which she used to increase her supply of pots. The second loan of 10,000 MZN was used for the same purpose. This third loan of 13,000 MZN will be used to acquire more pots in order to satisfy the needs of her clients in record time.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell aluminum pots

loans.name: Ticana Gaspar

texts.pt:
Ticana Gaspar M. nasceu em Manhiça, tem 41 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 24 aos 31 anos. 3 Dos seus filhos estão na universidade e os restantes estão empregados, responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa, não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque tem que pagar as despesas dos seus filhos que na universidade, uma vez que seu marido teve problemas no serviço e perdeu o emprego.

Devido a falta de condições financeiras Ticana teve que interromper os estudos na 8ª classe, anos depois sai de Manhiça para  Marracuene com seu marido em emissão de serviço este que era director da Agricultura daquele Distrito onde governou durante 5 anos.Ticana porque tinha um nível de escolaridade adequado o administrador convida lhe para trabalhar como secretária particular dele, mas seu esposo e transferido para Vila de Namaacha na fronteira da Suazilândia e ela não consegue separar a vida profissional da familiar, assim abandona o emprego. Chegado a Namaacha com o fundo colectado ela inicia com o negocio de criação de pintos e conta com ajuda do seu esposo que e técnico agrónomo, para além de criar é proprietária de uma barraca de refeições, os pintos precisam de muita atenção ela não tem horário fixo do trabalho tem criado no máximo 100x5caixas de pintos gastando 40.000.00mt e revende cada a 100.00mt, tem criado em fases para poder vender alternadamente. Tem como melhor produto o frango já preparado que vende em sua barraca tem tido um lucro de 10.000.00mt mensalmente

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Ticana na Hluvuku e segundo com kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00mt foi usado para comprar pintos, o segundo de 12.000.00mt foi para reforçar na criação e pede este terceiro de 20.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto porque para além de negociante e também funcionária do CMVN (conselho municipal).
texts.en:
Ticana Gaspar M. was born in Manhiça. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children between 24 and 31 years old. 3 of her children attend university and the others are employed. She is responsible for her niece who lives with her in her house. She is not able to save any money because she has to pay for her children's university expenses; she has do to this as her husband lost his job after having problems at work. Due to the lack of financial means, Ticana had to discontinue her studies in the 8th grade. Years later, she left Manhiça for Marracuene with her husband due to his job as Agriculture Director in that District where he governed for 5 years. Because Ticana had level of schooling that was deemed adequate, the administrator invited her to work as his secretary. However, he husband was transferred to the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland; she wasn't able to have a separate professional and family life, so she left her job. After she arrived in Namaacha, she used the money that she had collected to start a business raising baby chicks. She counts on the help of her husband, who is an expert agronomist. Besides this business, she is also the owner of a meal stand. The chicks require a lot of attention; she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She raises at most 5 boxes with 100 chicks each, spending 40,000 MZN. She resells each box for 100 MZN. She has raised them in different stages in order to alternate her sales. Her best product that she sells in her meal stand is already-cooked chicken. From her stand, she makes of monthly profit of 10,000 MZN. This is Ticana's 3rd loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first loan was for 15,000 MZN, which she used to buy chicks. The second loan of 12,000 MZN was used to reinforce her chick-raising business. She has asked for this third loan of 20,000 MZN for the same purpose. She is confident that she can pay off the loan before the deadline arrives, as she is also an employee of CMVN (Municipal Council) in addition to being a businesswoman.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise and sell chickens

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher has been working as a home project electrician since 1998. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of house projects in his town and its surroundings. He's 30 years old and living with his parents and one brother, and they cooperate together to satisfy their needs and expenses.

With the help of the loan requested of US$ 1,000, he managed to add the amount needed to his savings to expand his business by buying new tools and taking on more projects and  becoming known by other entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buying new tools

loans.name: Atalia Acacio

texts.pt:
Atalia Acácio C. nasceu em Maputo tem 28 anos de idade é viúva mãe de um filho de 8 anos que se encontra a estudar. Para alem do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Gaza enviando lhe mensalmente 500.00mt para pagar a empregada que toma conta dela pois já e muito idosa.

Atalia tinha apenas 6 anos quando muda se de Maputo para vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia devido a separação dos seus pais e passa a viver com a tia esta que a maltratava, inicia os estudos muito tarde e quando frequentava a 7ª classe esta fica grávida e é expulsa de casa e abandona os estudos. No mesmo ano consegue arranjar um emprego num restaurante onde trabalhou durante 4 anos, teve que abandonar quando contrai a tuberculose (TB) e tinha que cumprir com os tratamentos num período de um ano. Após sua recuperação ela consegue arranjar um emprego nas águas de Namaacha como servente. E funcionaria permanente a mais de 4 anos trabalha das 7h as 17h auferindo mensalmente 2.500.00mt, mas devido a morte do seu marido ela não consegue mas cobrir com as despesas porque vive numa casa alugada e paga 800.00mt por mês então aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo para legalização de um terreno e a construção no mesmo.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Atalia na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 8.000.00mt foi usado para legalização de seu terreno, o segundo de 12.000.00mt foi para dar inicio da sua obra que se encontra na parte da viga, estes 15.000.00mt serão usados para iniciar com a cobertura da mesma e em breve poderá mudar se para sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um outro empréstimo para reboco da mesma.
texts.en:
Atalia Acácio C. was born in Maputo. She is a 28-year-old widow and mother to an 8-year-old son who goes to school. Besides her son, she also cares for her mother, who lives in Gaza, by sending her 500 MZN every month to pay the person who takes care of her since she is very old. Atalia was only 6 years old when she moved from Maputo to the village of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland, owing to the separation of her parents. She went to live with an aunt who mistreated her. She began school very late, and when she was in 7th grade, she became pregnant, was thrown out of the house, and left school. That same year she got a job in a restaurant, where she worked for 4 years. She had to quit when she contracted tuberculosis (TB) and had to have treatments over the course of a year. After her recovery, she got a job as an assistant at the Namaacha water company. She has been a permanent employee there for more than 4 years, working from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and earning 2,500 MZN monthly, but because of her husband's death she can no longer cover her expenses, since she lives in a rented house and pays 800 MZN per month. She approached Hluvuku and Kiva to ask for a loan to purchase a title to some land and build a house on it. This is Atalia's third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first, for 8,000 MZN, was used to purchase the title to her land, and the second loan of 12,000 MZN was to begin construction, which has been completed up to the roof beams. These 15,000 MZN will be used to begin roofing the house, and soon she will be able to move in. She is confident that she will pay ahead of time and ask for another loan to plaster the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, etc.)

loans.name: Cristina Julio

texts.pt:
Cristina Júlio B. nasceu em Maputo tem 33 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos a primeira de 13 e o segundo de 4 anos todos vão a escola. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Maputo enviando lhe 500.00mt mensalmente, não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque vive numa casa alugada.

Cristina muda se para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia quando é abandonada pelo marido, no mesmo ano ela inicia com os estudos vivendo na casa do avo pois a mãe não tinha condições. Quando frequentava a 8ª classe fica grávida da sua primeira filha e é expulsa de casa, mas como ela entendia de trabalhos de beleza sua tia convida lhe para trabalharem juntas, anos depois ela opta em abrir seu próprio salão de beleza com o fundo que havia colectado e de seguida aproxima se ao Banco novo (uma outra instituição Bancária) solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt para reforçar o seu salão pagou cem problema mas o seu negócio não rendia o suficiente porque tinha que alugar o estabelecimento. Anos depois consegue arranjar um emprego como servente no laboratório da botânica trabalhando das 7;30h as 15:30h auferindo 1.825.00mt e fica sem tempo de cuidar dos seus negócios então emprega alguém que lhe deixou na falência. Hoje ela tem feito trabalhos de beleza em sua casa nos (sábados e domingos) devido a aderência que tem tido, e vende roupas diversas adquiridas na Africa do Sul no mercado informal Shoprite.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Cristina na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. Os dois primeiros de (4.500.00mt e 8.000.00mt) foram usados para aumentar os produtos de beleza, o terceiro de 12.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade, estes 15.000.00mt serão usados para comprar roupas diversas vendidas por encomenda. Está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para construção de seu próprio salão de Beleza.
texts.en:
Cristina Júlio B. was born in Maputo. She is a 33-year-old single mother of two children. The first is 13, and the second is 4 years old. Both go to school. She takes care of her mother, who lives in Maputo, by sending her 500 meticales monthly. She can't save anything because she lives in a rented house. Cristina moved to the village of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland when her husband abandoned her. That same year she began her studies while living in her grandparents' house because her mother could not support her. When she was in eighth grade, she became pregnant with her first daughter and was kicked out of the house, but since she understood salon work, her aunt invited Cristina to work together with her. Some years later she chose to open her own beauty salon with the money she had saved, and she approached Banco Novo (another banking institution) asking for a loan of 20,000 meticales to strengthen her business. She paid it off with no problems, but her business didn't earn enough because she had to rent the shop. Some years later she managed to get a job as an assistant in a botany lab, working from 7:30 am until 3:30 pm and earning 1,825 meticales. She had no time to take care of her business, so she employed someone, which left her bankrupt.
