These days she does beauty work in her house on Saturdays and Sundays because of the demand she has had, and she sells a variety of clothing acquired in South Africa at the Shoprite informal market. This is Cristina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two loans (for 4,500 meticales and 8,000 meticales) were used to increase her stock of beauty products, and the third for 12,000 meticales was used for the same purpose. These 15,000 meticales will be used to buy a variety of clothing sold by pre-order. She is confident that she will pay it back ahead of time and ask for another loan to build her own beauty salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man and has 4 children. He alone takes care of his family's expenses: household expenses, hospitality, schooling expenses etc. So he works hard to provide better living conditions for his children. He has owned a mini-market in his town since 1998 and has 20 years of experience in this occupation. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow US$ 1,100 to purchase additional inventory to fill his market with food products, dairy products, drinks, etc., to satisfy always the demand of his customers.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mavchihol

texts.ru: Тагайкулова Мавчихол проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Старший сын на заработках в России. Дочь, занимается растениеводством. Сама Мавчихол не имеет высшего образования. Она более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. В этой деятельности ей помогает муж. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mavchihol T. lives in the Yavan district. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. The oldest son is working in Russia. The daughter is involved in agriculture. Mavchihol does not have a higher education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. She breeds cattle at home. Her husband helps her with this business. Mavchihol primarily raises and sells livestock. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Sobhy

texts.en:
Sobhy is a 55-year-old married man and has 2 unemployed children. He has been working since 2005 in the Department of Motor Vehicles. He works in providing transaction clearance for vehicle documents. 

Sobhy has repaid his first loan successfully and he has chosen to take out a new loan of US$ 1,500 because he's planning to open his own office in the department and provide the needed decor and installations in order to improve his business and earn a good profit.

loans.use: open his own office

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is a 30-year-old engaged man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Razmik has owned a barber shop since 2002. He also sells men's personal care products like gel, hair cleaning products, and more. 

Razmik is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers, as well as making his clients feel comfortable going to his shop since he offers a lot of services; when washing hair, he does head massages. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

Razmik requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase personal care products for his shop and save for his wedding expenses. This is the first time that Razmik has requested a loan.

When Razmik first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties especially since he already had faithful customers from his previous job. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase personal care products for his shop

loans.name: Ghamilet

texts.en:
Ghamilet is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Ghamilet has owned a grocery store for three years now. She sells candies, drinks, canned food like beans, tuna, corn, mushrooms, hot dogs, etc… 

Ghamilet is special in her work because of her experience in sales, as well as her welcoming attitude with her customers. Her customers are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for her store. Ghamilet has been a micro-credit client for eight years now and has always repaid on time.  

When she first started her business, she had some financial issues purchasing all the necessary merchandise, but her previous loans allowed her to continually expand her stock and diversify her merchandise. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to have an independent job, as well as considering her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her little store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 38-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Abass has been selling automobile spare parts and car repairing tools since 2001. 

Abass is special in his work because of his experience in sales. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car spare parts for his work. This is his third loanr and he has alwayse paid on time. 

When Abass first started his business, he had some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, as well as due to his experience. In the future, he plans on enlarging his business.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for his work

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Fatima has been working as an esthetician for five years now. She doesn’t own a salon; she goes to her clients' houses. 

There, she does manicure and pedicure, special make-up, tattoos and hair removal, as well as hand and foot massages. She is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients, and also her clients feel comfortable with her services because she is very gentle. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. 

Fatima requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a massage machine for feet and beauty products for her work. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. 

Her previous loans allowed Fatima to purchase the necessary products and tools for her work, but Fatima is someone who is aware of new fashions and believes that she always has to have the best products and tools for her clients. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties except making herself known by the public. 

Fatima decided on doing her business because she wanted to have an independent job, and also, she is good at what she does. In the future, she plans on expanding her work and maybe opening a beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase a massage machine for feet and beauty products for her work

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 33-year-old married man with one child who is still attending school. He has been working in painting for the past 10 years. He took out his first loan and he has repaid it successfully. He's very thankful for his first loan and he has chosen to take out a new loan of US$ 1,200 to buy more tools and painting supplies to improve his business that was ameliorated automatically. He's expecting to make more profit and he's very happy with the results that also had an effect on his family's situation.

loans.use: buy more tools and painting supplies

loans.name: Rehema Musa

texts.en:
Rehema is a 52-year-old woman married to Musa Konde who works as a driver and together they have seven children of whom five are grown up with families of their own and two are in secondary school. 

Rehema has been practicing subsistence farming for 30 years in Kibaoni-Malindi and sells her produce in Gongoni and Marereni centers which are in Malindi. She is able to make a profit of Kshs 3,000 a month. She also sells cereals as a secondary business.

Rehema is servicing her second loan and was introduced to Kadet by her group secretary. She had a previous loan with another Micro-finance Institution before joining Kadet. She plans to use this loan amount to prepare her farm and also buy seedlings and fertilizers. With the extra income from this loan Rehema plans to buy a grade-one cow for milk supply. 

Rehema describes herself as a diligent lady and she hopes to be self-sustainable through farming and milk production. She also wants to have piped water at her home.

loans.use: To prepare the farm and buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine runs a combination cafe/clothes selling business and has received a KES 50,000 loan from SMEP to add stock to her cafe and buy more clothes to sell. She has 3 employees and her business is located in a residential area. She's been in the business for 4 years and states that her biggest challenges are finding adequate space to expand and acquiring financing. 

Josephine is married and has a 9-month-old baby. She describes herself as hard-working, welcoming, clean and patient.

loans.use: restocking her cafe, buying clothes to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Mariam has been selling fruits and vegetables. She sells iceberg lettuce, pumpkins, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, apples, oranges and more, depending on the season. Her products are all 'bio'. 

Mariam is special in her work because her customers feel comfortable buying from her. Her customers are her friends, neighbors and people in her region. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fruits and vegetables. Mariam has been a micro-credit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

When Mariam first started her business, she didn’t use to own her shop, she used to sell her merchandise by knocking on doors. Therefore, she decided on doing her business because she saw that the number of customers she had was increasing and she was capable of opening her own fruit and vegetable shop. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah has been working as a farmer for the past 20 years. He's 48 years old and the father of 5 children, and he is the only provider for his family, thanks to his business. In 2000, he started to cultivate his land with all types of vegetables, according to the season. And he also owns 'vegetable tents' to facilitate cultivation. 

Today, Abdallah is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase farming tools and supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to be ready for the summer harvest and earn a good income.

loans.use: purchase farming tools and supplies

loans.name: Maisaa

texts.en:
Maisaa is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. Maisaa has been selling perfumes. She actually has the perfume fragrances and sometimes (depending on her client’s wishes) she makes combinations. Her clients are her friends and neighbors, and sometimes people from the surrounding villages. 

When she first started her business, she had some financial issues. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income and have an independent job; she came up with her shop idea since she is the only one in her region doing this, and she felt before opening her shop that this was a much-demanded product. 

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase perfumes for the summer season--more fruity smells and less strong than those for winter. This is the first time that Maisaa has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes for the summer season

loans.name: Batiome

texts.en:
Batiome runs the Jaka general store located near industrial and residential areas in Mombasa. She sells items like detergents, cooking oil, cereals, and green groceries. Her business challenges are lack of transportation to the area she sells in. 

Previously, Batiome had a video business, but she has been in the general store business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to have an expanded store and have other stores in other parts of Mombasa and maybe other towns. Batiome is currently married and has one young son, aged 4.

loans.use: increasing her inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has owned a nut roasting shop since 1980 because it is a family business, therefore, he took up his father’s work. He sells all sorts of nuts like almonds, cashews, pistachios, macadamias, pecans, hazelnuts, seeds, peanuts, coated peanuts and more. 

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and offers a big variety of products, and his customers feel comfortable purchasing from him. His customers are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. 

When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulty since he took up his family’s business. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a roaster for his shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 

In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his shop by selling outside of Lebanon.

loans.use: To purchase a roaster for his shop.

loans.name: Mohamad Diaa

texts.en:
Mohamad Diaa is a 30 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife. Mohamad owns a bakery, and makes croissants which are a flaky crescent-shaped bread roll made of a yeast dough similar to puff pastry: they can be either plain or sweet, such as a chocolate croissant. In Lebanon we also eat many salty croissant with zaatar (thyme) and jebneh (cheese). You can eat them anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mohamad Diaa is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty croissant; he does croissant His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. This is the first time that Mohamad Diaa has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. 
Mohamad Diaa decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.



(Dear Kiva lenders, I just want to specify that Mohamad Diaa is the man we see in the foreground).

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet has received a KES 30,000 loan from SMEP to restock her pharmacy, 'Shibuye Chemist', in the town center of Kakamega, Kenya. She has been in the business for 6 years and prior to starting her own pharmacy, she was working as a pharmacist in the local hospital. 

Linet is married with two young girls. She describes herself as hard-working and visionary - and eventually she wishes to expand her business to open a dispensary, and to own a plot of land of her own.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to restock her shop (Amoxyl, Ampiclox, Erylthomycis, and Septin)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood for his work

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has a business at the side of a busy highway, selling used clothing and plastic items such as buckets, basins, cups, and flasks. In addition to this business, Josephine grows maize and vegetables. She is currently married, and has three children whom she would like to provide with a quality education. 

Josephine hopes one day to be a rich lady and eventually to be a wholesaler of clothing, maybe in 5 years. Josephine describes herself as hard-working, welcoming, jovial and charming.

loans.use: purchase additional used clothing and for farming

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 32-year-old married woman. After finalizing her university studies, she got married and opened a photography studio in 2008 to help her husband with the family income. During this short period, she has been able to acquire a good number of customers. In order to improve and expand her business, Fatmeh is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a new digital camera and additional photography supplies such as film, albums, frames, etc. to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: buy a new digital camera and photography supplies

loans.name: Medina

texts.en: Medina runs a small grocery store located in a busy market area in Kakamega, Kenya. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to increase her stock. She has been in business for 3 years, and previously sold cereals. Medina is married with three children, and eventually would like to be a wholesaler of goods in the market. Some of the challenges that Medina faces are fluctuating prices for staple goods and competition in her market area.

loans.use: increasing stock in her small grocery shop

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady, 44, lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Fady has been working as a car repairer since 2006. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he said that, as with every startup business, he had some difficulties, but nothing to talk about. He decided to start his own business because of his experience, his enjoyment of this trade and his desire for independent work. He has requested his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Fayrouz

texts.en:
Fayrouz is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of 3 unemployed children. She and her husband are the only providers for the family. She has been working as a hair stylist for the past 22 years in her town and has become well known in the whole region. Due to her lengthy experience in this occupation, she has a large number of customers. 

Today, Fayrouz is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy hair accessories and beauty products to satisfy the needs of the market and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy hair accessories and beauty products

loans.name: Serious Women In Jesus Group

texts.en:
Korto W. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Serious Women In Jesus. She is married, and has six children who range from 5 to 26 years old. She was unable to attend school beyond the elementary level.

For 20 years, Korto has been selling cooked food and drinks at the the Zone #5 Depot in Paynesville, on the outskirts of Liberia's capital, Monrovia. She sells her cooked food and drinks in a friendly manner, which keeps her customers returning.  

Korto plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more goods and pay some of her debts. Her goal is to open a restaurant and improve her living conditions.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Korto is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make food and drinks, and to pay some of her debts

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 36-year-old single man living with his parents and 5 siblings. He has been selling DVDs and computers since 2001 to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has always tried to work hard to develop his business.  

Today, Abbas is requesting a loan of $1,000 which he wants to add to his savings in order to purchase a large quantity of merchandise available at good prices. He will then be able to offer more items to his clients and earn more income.

loans.use: purchase a large quantity of merchandise available at good prices

loans.name: Dani

texts.en:
Dani is a 27-year-old single man who has worked as a home electrician since 2000. Working on a freelance basis, he works upon request of his clients in his town and the surrounding villages.

Dani is thankful for his first loan from Kiva and today he is asking for a second loan of $1,000 to buy tools and supplies like cables because he will take on a new home project in the coming month and he needs to be ready to meet his customer’s requirements.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for his business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 24-year-old single woman living alone. After getting her university certificates, she started working as a private teacher from her home. She helps her family members who live in the village by sending income to them. 

Today, Rita is requesting $1,000 to buy a laptop computer and a printer with scanner. This will improve her work and facilitate her research and homework preparation because she's planning to receive more students.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer and a printer with scanner

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old, is married to Agnes Kwambuka, and they have one school-going child. Patrick’s field of business is livestock, rearing both poultry and dairy cows.

Patrick was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to buy another dairy cow to increase his milk output. This will enable him to cater to all his clients’ demands and his own personal needs.

Patrick hopes that one day he will expand his animal farming business and become a major supplier of animal products around the town.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Julianna

texts.es:
Julianna tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Castilla, de la provincia de Piura en la región Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la distribución de ropa y calzado en su domicilio. Ella viaja frecuentemente a las ciudades de Trujillo y Lima para comprar la mercadería que necesita y distribuirla en base a pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Este negocio le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para seguir manteniendo a sus hijos y también apoyar a su madre con los gastos familiares.

Debido al inicio de clases escolares en la mayoría de colegios del país, Julianna ha estado recibiendo pedidos de zapatos de colegio por parte de sus clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de calzado para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Julianna es una mujer que ha sabido responder con calma, responsabilidad y buen ánimo a los retos que le ha puesto la vida. Ella no se avergüenza de su situación de madre soltera, sino que lucha diariamente para salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Juliana, age 32, is a single mother and has two minor children. She lives with her mother in the Castilla district, Piura province, Piura region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the the Lambayeque region. For three years she has been distributing clothes and footwear from her home. She frequently travels to the cities of Trujillo and Lima to buy the merchandise she needs. She delivers it according to orders that her customers make. This business has given her the necessary income to keep supporting her children. It also helps her mother with the family expenses. Due to the start up of classes in most schools in the country, Juliana has been receiving orders for school shoes from her customers. That is why she is asking for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 PEN. She plans to use the money to buy footwear to satisfy her customers’ demand. Julianna is a woman who has known how to respond calmly, responsibly, and in good spirits to the challenges life has presented. She is not embarrassed about being a single mother, and she fights everyday to get ahead. Her biggest desire is to see her sons become professionals and upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school shoes to expand her business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo, dos de sus hijos y un nieto en el distrito de Castilla, de la provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de apoyar al mantenimiento de su familia hizo que desde hace seis años se dedicara a la venta de verduras en el mercado del distrito de Castilla. Todos los días ella ofrece una variedad de verduras y legumbres a sus clientes, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad, ella apoya al sostenimiento de los suyos.

Guillermina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más verduras, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más mercadería para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer humilde y trabajadora. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece acomodando su mercadería luego de ardua jornada de labor.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a 53 year old mother. She lives with her husband, two of her children, and a grandson in the Castilla district, Piura province, Piura region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Because she needed to help support her family, six years ago she started selling vegetables in the market in the Castilla district. Everyday she offers a variety of vegetables to her customers. She uses the income from this activity to help support her family. Guillermina wishes to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables. To do this she is requesting a loan from the Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN. She plans to use the money to buy more merchandise to achieve her objective. She is a humble and hard-working woman. She has worked with our institution before, and she has demonstrated responsibility when it is time to make payments. In the photo she appears arranging her merchandise after a hard day’s work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables to expand her sales business

loans.name: Oluwole

texts.en:
Oluwole has a pig farm where he rears pigs to sell. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He has been in this business for a long time and he is well known in his community. He hopes to expand his business in the future by adding a fish pond.

Oluwole is married and he is 45 years old. He has four children and they are excelling in school. He is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more feed for his pigs. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Oluwole is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more feed for his pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman who sells colorful sarongs to make a living in Nigeria. She is a very busy woman and she is happy because she makes sales daily from her sarong business.

Elizabeth hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Elizabeth lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and is married with four children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports their home.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah, 34 years old, is married to a vehicle spare parts seller. Despite her husband's efforts to make a comfortable home, Deborah insisted on setting up her own business so she could empower herself and assist her husband financially.

Deborah owns a beauty salon in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she styles hair and sells hair extensions, styling creams and other hair accessories. She has been in this business for twelve years. She wants to expand her business by purchasing more items to sell.

Deborah is requesting a loan of NGN 70, 000 to purchase more hair extensions and accessories to sell. She says thank you and promises to repay her loan when due.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions and accessories to sell

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford A. is married and has seven dependents. He has a senior high school education. Clifford sells palm oil and nut crackings for the making of palm kennel oil in Elmina. His wife is a petty trader. The loan acquired by Clifford will be used to purchase gas/oil for his mill processor (machine) and palm fruits for making palm oil. Clifford uses his income to take care of his wife and dependents and for the general upkeep of the home. With the new profits from his expanded business, Clifford plans to save money for a good educational foundation for the children.

To prepare his locally made palm oil, Clifford gets his palm nuts from farmers. He washes them and boils them for about forty minutes until they become soft and tender. The cooked fruits are scooped into a big mortar and gently squashed with a pestle to squeeze out the juice covering the pulp while avoiding damaging the nut. Once this is done, the juice is filtered to remove the chaff (which is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires). The juice is boiled again and the fresh oil floats on the contents of the pot. It is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. Fresh oil from palm fruits is traditionally used in eating roasted yam or plantain in Africa, especially on the farms after a hard day's work.

loans.use: to purchase gas/oil for his mill processor (machine) and palm fruits for making palm oil

loans.name: Mufatau

texts.en: Mufatau is a 44-year-old married man with 3 children, who are all making good progress in their school. He has a bar where he sells drinks at retail prices to his customers. Business is very good for him in the evenings when his customers get together to drink and chat after the day’s work. He loves this business because he does not sell on credit to his customers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell in order to make more profit. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. sells raw corn and beans in large bags at Elmina. Helena has received junior high education. She is married with four children. Her husband is a herbalist who uses herbs to make medicine. She helps her husband in feeding and educating their children. 

Her loan will serve as increased capital to enable her to buy bags of corn and beans in larger quantities to meet the demand of her customers. The profits accrued from her business as a result of the loan will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy bags of  corn and beans in larger quantities

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Mirlanda is the coordinator of her group 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her children.

Mirlanda is excited to be taking her fourth loan  with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small general store by investing in a freezer as well as oil, sugar, rice and vegetables to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her children's well-being by purchasing them food and clothes as well as school supplies and a computer to learn on. Additionally, she would like to improve her home and move her business to an area with more traffic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A freezer, rice, sugar , cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es: María Angelica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija que aún no estudia, ella vive en una comunidad cercana a la ciudad capital, que se llama Sumpango, Angelica vende comida todos los dias en el mercado municipal de Sumpango desde hace 17 años; ella solicita crédito, para poder arreglar su cocina en donde prepara la venta de comida. Tiene problemas con su cocina ya que en tiempo de lluvia el agua se cuela por las laminas, lo cual le crea dificultad para cocinar. También es dueña de un terreno que su padre le heredo en el cual siembra frijol. Su sueño es tener una cocina amplia para poder cocinar y con el dinero del crédito piensa comprar material para ampliar su cocina y comprar fertilizante para su siembra de frijol.
texts.en:
María Angelica, age 29, is married and has one daughter who isn’t yet in school. She lives in a community called Sumpango near the capital city. For 17 years Angelica has sold food in the municipal market of Sumpango. She is applying for the loan in order to repair the kitchen where she prepares the food she sells. She has problems with her kitchen because when it rains water leaks in, which makes it difficult to cook. With the money from the loan she wants to buy material for enlarging her kitchen and fertilizer for her bean crop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the enlargement of her kitchen

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 36 years old, married and has 4 children under her care. Her eldest child is 11 years old and is doing well in school. She styles clothes for both men and women. She also sells tailoring accessories; she has been in this business for ten years. 

She hopes to expand her business in future and improve herself financially. Bola works hard to help her husband in providing family basic needs- food, clothing, paying the children's school fees.

Bola is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Élisabeth

texts.fr: Élisabeth N. est une femme de 67 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois du Banc Villageois de PEYCKOUK-LELO depuis 12 ans et demi. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 25 fois de suite. Elle est vendeuse de poissons séchés et de pâte d'arachide. Son petit commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins personnel et à améliorer son cadre de vie par la restauration de sa maison
texts.en:
Élisabeth N., aged 67, is single and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyckouk-Lelo for twelve and a half years. She is very experienced with the credit process, since she has received already 25 consecutive loans. She sells dried fish and peanut butter. Her small business enables her to provide for her needs and improve her living environment through the restoration of her house.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Lorena Michele

texts.es:
La Sra. Lorena esta separada y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la separacion cuenta que ha sido muy dificil para ella y para sus dos hijos pero supo salir adelante a pesar de todos los problemas y ahora su principal objetivo son sus hijos y su trabajo, tiene como actividad la venta de ropa, ropa interior, calzados y perfumes  por  catalogo, en distintos lugares y oficinas, actividad que es la principal fuente de ingreso para ellla y su familia.

El destino del credito sera para la compra de meraderia que le ofrecieron con descuento es por esta razon que solicita  un financiamiento para aumentar su ingresos.  

La Sra. Lorena esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lorena is separated and has 2 school-aged children. The separation, she says, has been very difficult for her and for her 2 children but she knows how to forge ahead, in spite of all the problems. Now, her principal objectives are her children and her work. Her business activity is selling clothes, underwear, shoes and perfumes by catalog, in various places and offices, an activity that is the principal source of income for her and her family. The loan will be used to buy merchandise which she offers at a discount. This is why she is soliciting financing -- to augment her income. Mrs. Lorena is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in her and for providing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh Koromo is a happy and always smiling lady, who has been a member of LAPO,SL for almost 2 years now. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children (all of them boys) and lives with her family in Tegbeh town. The eldest of the children is in secondary school and the other two are in primary school.

Jenneh sells medicine, soap, body oil, water and toothpaste in Tegbeh town market.She has taken 4 previous loans and used her past loans to buy those goods. She has used the profit to pay her children's school fees and feed her family. 

Jenneh said she will use her present loan to purchase medicine.

loans.use: will be used to buy medicine

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su padre y hermanos en el distrito de La Unión, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha (bebida típica del país) desde hace cinco años. El nos comenta que aprendió la elaboración de esta bebida de sus padres ya que los apoyaba en su negocio cuando era menor de edad, ahora el ya prepara su propia chicha y la vende a sus propios clientes, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en apoyar a la economía de su familia.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, esta elaborada  base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que vive en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su productos, especialmente de leña y carbon (la chicha se prepara en cocinas de leña y carbon), ya que debido a la temporada de lluvias, propia del verano, el carbón y la leña se vuelven escasos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Jose es un joven bastante trabajador y optimista. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y apoyar a sus padres cuando lo necesiten.
texts.en:
José, age 25, is single and lives with his father and brothers in the La Unión district, Piura Province, in the Piura region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For five years, he has been engaged in the making and sale of chicha (a traditional drink of Peru). He tells us that he learned how to make this drink from his parents since he helped them with this business when he was young. Now, he is preparing his own chicha and selling it to his own customers. He uses the income that he gets from this business for his personal expenses and to support his family.

Chicha is a traditional drink of the entire country. It is made from a variety of corn and a great deal is consumed by people who live in rural areas since it gives them energy needed to continue working.

José wants to expand his business by purchasing raw materials used to make his product, especially firewood and charcoal (chicha is prepared in kitchens using firewood and charcoal) since, due to the spring rainy season, charcoal and firewood have become scarce. This is why he is applying for the first time for a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He wants to use the loan to reach his objective. José is a very hard working and optimistic young man. His greatest wishes are to continue growing as a businessman and to support his parents when they need him.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials for making chicha

loans.name: Feyikemi

texts.en:
Feyikemi is 40 years old; she lives with her family in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is married and blessed with 4 children. Her husband manages to earn his living in a private hotel in Lagos.

Feyikemi sells groceries like tea, tinned milk, corn flakes, etc. She has been in the business for five years. She hopes to stock her shop with more goods as this will attract more customers to her shop and increase her proceeds after sales. She is asking for a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more groceries at a reduced price. This, she said, will increase her profit and her ability to satisfy her customers. Feyikemi expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana es soltera y tiene dos hijas que se encuentran en colegio, tiene como actividad la venta de comida rapida ( Hanburguesa Salchipapa y otros), en su micro snack, esta actividad es la principal  fuente de ingreso para ellla y su familia donde tambien le ayudan sus dos hijas quienes tambien trabajan para ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, la Sra. Juana es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora siempre esta abierta a otras actividades segun la temporada.

El destino del credito sera para la conclucion de la construccion de su casa donde ellas viviran a demas de aumentar su capital de trabajo. 

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brinadada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is single and has two daughters who are in school. She sells fast food (hamburgers, hotdogs, fries and other combinations), in her mini snack stall, which is the main source of income for her and her family as her two daughters also work to help with household expenses. Mrs. Juana is a responsible and hardworking person always open to other types of work depending on the season. The loan is dedicated towards the completed construction of her home where she lives with her daughters as well as increasing her working capital. She is very grateful to field partner Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in awarding her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of her home

loans.name: Elma Beatriz

texts.es:
Doña Elma S. de 28 años de edad, viuda y con un hijo de 1 año, tiene una carniceria en Chimaltenango, vive en San Martín Jilotepeque, viaja todos los dias para su negocio.
Anteriormente el encargado de la carnicería era su esposo, pero fue privado de su vida y ahora Doña Elma atiende la carnicería y con el tiempo ha podido ir superando la perdida de su esposo. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar un molino de carne y asi poder preparar longanizas y chorizos, con anterioridad tenia uno pero ya no funciona. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener su propio local ya que por el momento alquila.
texts.en:
Elma S. is 28 years old, widowed, and has a one year old son. She owns a butcher’s shop in Chimaltenango, lives in San Martin Jilotepeque, and travels everyday to her business. The butcher’s shop was previously managed by her husband, but he lost his life and now Elma attends to it and with time she has been able to get beyond the loss of her husband.

She is asking for a loan to buy a meat grinder with which to prepare various sausages. She had one before, but it no longer functions. Her dream is to grow her business and to own her own store, as at the moment she rents.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in butcher's shop equipment

loans.name: Nannah

texts.en:
Nannah T. is married with three children. She lives in the Wilberforce area of Freetown with her husband, two daughters, and a son. She has been a member of LAPO, SL credit group for 2 years now.

Nannah T. has gone through four loans and with the profit made from previous loans she was able to assist her husband in sending all her three kids to a tertiary institution.

With this loan of 2,000,000 Leones, she will purchase more soft drinks, bags of sachet water, razor blades, and wines for sale. She hopes that one day she will realize her dream of having all her children graduate from higher education.

loans.use: soft drinks, bags of sachet water, razor blades and wines

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el distrito de La Unión, en la provincia de Piura, de la región Piura, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de chicha (bebida tipica de la región) y cerveza en el domicilio donde actualmente reside. Ella misma prepara la chicha y la ofrece a sus clientes. Este negocio es una fuente de ayuda a los ingresos que percibe su esposo, ya que ambos se encuentran ahorrando dinero para construir su casa.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, esta elaborada  base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que viven en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

Leonor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para elaborar chicha (maíz y leña) y también con la compra de más cerveza, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Leonor es una mujer responsable y muy estimada por sus vecinos y clientes. Su mayor anhelo es tener su casa donde ella y su futura familia puedan vivir tranquilos y felices.
texts.en:
Leonor is 30 years old and lives with her husband in the home of her in-laws, located in the La Unión district of Piura province, in the Piura region, 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has a business selling chicha (a drink that is typical of the region) and beer from the home where she currently resides. She prepares the chicha herself and offers it to her customers. This business provides helpful income in addition to that earned by her husband, since they are both saving money to build their own house. Chicha is a drink that is often consumed in Peru, it is made with a specific kind of corn, and is widely consumed by the people who live in the rural areas, since they believe that it gives them energy to continue with their work. Leonor wishes to expand her business with the purchase of supplies to make chicha (corn and firewood), and also with the purchase of more beer. For this reason she requests a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Leonor is a very responsible woman who is held in high regard by her neighbors and customers. Her main desire is to have her own house where she and her future family can live tranquilly and happily.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to make chicha and to buy beer to expand her business

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es: José emilio P. de 51 años, sastre conocido en Sn. Martín Jilotepeque, casado y tienen 6 hijos, la familia lucha por obtener ganancias en sus trabajos. Emilio es sastre elabora pantalones, camisas, sacos y faldas, el nombre de su sastrería es "El Nuevo Peren" . Don José solicita el crédito para la comprar de un moloino de nixtamal, ya que donde viven no hay molinos, y el quiere sacarle provecho a eso, y el resto de dinero utilizarlo en comprar mas tela para su sastrería. Su sueño es tener un negocio donde pueda vender telas de todas las clases.
texts.en:
P. Emilio José is 51 years old and is a known tailor in San Martín Jilotepeque. Married with 6 children the family strives to earn money from their work. As a tailor, Emilio works on pants, shirts, bags and skirts. The name of his tailor shop is “The New Peren”. Mr. José is seeking a loan for the purchase of corn meal mill as they live in an area where there are mills and he hopes to be able to take advantage of that. The remaining money would be used to buy cloth for tailoring. His dream is to have a business where he could sell all types of fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the tailor shop as well as start a new business [with the corn mill]

loans.name: Nilda Karina

texts.es:
Nilda es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de La Unión, un distrito de la zona rural de la provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la preparación y venta de chicha (bebida típica del país); el lugar está ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha desde hace nueve años, adicionalmente también vende cerveza en su domicilio, este negocio es de mucha ayuda para los ingresos familiares, ya que su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, esta elaborada  base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que viven en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

Nilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha, así como en la compra de más cerveza, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Nilda is a 30 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the District of La Unión, which lies in a rural area within the Province and Region of Piura. The majority of its inhabitants prepares and sells “chicha” (a traditional beverage of the country). This place is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Region.

Nilda has been making and selling chicha for nine years. She also sells beer out of her home. This business has been of great help for the family income. Her husband already works as a farm laborer, but his earnings are not enough to meet the family expenses.

Chicha is a traditional beverage found throughout the country. It is made from a variety of corn and is widely consumed by people who live in the rural areas since it is believed to provide a boost of energy needed to finish their jobs. Nilda hopes to grow her business by purchasing more supplies for making chicha, as well as more beer. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals and develop into good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & ingredients for making "chicha"

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
La sra.Juana es una persona que trabaja en la crianza de cerdos desde hace  unos 35 años la cual con esta actividad ha logrado desarrollarse y le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda.
Esta solicitando un cuarto crédito en nuestra institución para la compra de cerdos para aumentar su producción ya que con los créditos otorgados en nuestra institución ella ha podido mantenerse en esta actividad
texts.en:
Sra. Juana earns her living by raising pigs, a job she has been doing for thirty-five years. The work has allowed her to make a decent life for herself and to make improvements to her house. Juana is seeking a fourth loan from our institution to buy pigs so that she can increase production. With the money obtained to date, she has been able to keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Nuestros  socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Las Hormiguitas”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios son un grupo D. 11 personas entre varones y mujeres, todos ellos amigos, nuestros socios son personas emprendedoras y ansiosos D. seguir creciendo más con el capital que mediante este medio se les otorga; los señores alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio, todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en  sus diferentes negocios.

Una D. las socias, Roxana, tiene 32 años D. edad, tiene dos hijos uno varón y otra mujer es la primera vez que esta perteneciendo a Arariwa, nuestra socia tiene un negocio D. venta D. casacas para varón, mujer y niños. Ella los venD. en la feria del altiplano que es una feria que se realiza los sábados y domingos, su mercadería los trae D. la paz Bolivia, ella viaja dos veces al mes, también trae zapatos, enlatados D. jugos D. durazno, también nos cuenta que venD. productos D. belleza unique D. forma ambulatoria, ella nos cuenta ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar más casacas. 

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
Las socias Juliana y Silvia no aparecen en la foto porque pidieron permiso a la junta del banco comunal para no estar presentes el día del desembolso.
texts.en:
We all belong to the "Las Hormiguitas [Little Ants]" Village Bank, located in the city of Cusco. Our group consists of eleven men and women, all friends. We're enterprising people and we're excited about continuing to grow with the capital granted to us here. Members are engaged in a variety of commercial activities and they are each seeking a loan to reinvest in their respective businesses. One member, Roxana, is thirty-two and has two children, a boy and a girl. This is her first time as a member of Arariwa. She sells men's, women's, and kids' jackets at the Altiplano [Highlands] Market, which runs on Saturdays and Sundays. She travels to La Paz twice a month to get her merchandise. She also brings back shoes and cartons of peach juice. She tells us she also sells beauty products, but only door to door. She says she asked for the loan to buy more jackets. Our members appeciate and value the loans we get here, and promise to pay back all of our debts in the established time-period. Members Juliana and Silvia are not shown in the photo because they asked the bank's board for permission to be absent on loan-day.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell at the Sunday market

loans.name: Celia Carlota

texts.es: Doña Celia de 47 años de edad, casada y tiene 7 hijos, 4 de ellos estan en edad escolar, Doña Celia tiene 7 años de tener una tortilleria, aparte de esto ella tiene terrenos con plantacion de café, ella solicita crédito para la compra de plantillas de café para llenar por completo el terreno de café, comprar abono y maíz. Sueña con exportar su café.
texts.en:
Celia is 47 years old. She is married with seven children; four of whom are school-aged. Celia has had a tortilla bakery for seven years. She also has some land where she raises coffee. She is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer and corn. She hopes to someday be able to export her coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is Hawa B.. She sells slippers. She is a 30-year-old married woman. 

Hawa B. lives in Freetown. She is been a client of LAPO,SL for 2 years now and she has received 4 loans.   With her previous loan  she expanded her business by purchasing more slippers for sale, and by so doing her business has expanded. 

Hawa B. is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 Leones with which she intends taking her business to a new height by purchasing more slippers for sale.

loans.use: slippers

loans.name: Sayo

texts.en:
Sayo S. trades in fish. She is married and has four children, three boys and one girl. She had been a LAPO,SL client for 2 years. She is of great benefit to her husband because she has been able to take on the responsibility of paying the children's fees as a result of the profit from her previous loan.

With this loan Sayo S. will expand her business by purchasing more fish for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus tres hijos de los cuales los dos ultimos están a su cargo. Reside en el caserío El Vichayal, del distrito de La Arena, en la provincia de Piura, una comunidad rural donde la mayoría de habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, crianza y venta de animales y a la venta de chicha (bebida tipica del país). Esta zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de chicha en su domicilio, también cría animales de corral para luego venderlos a los negociantes de la zona o consumirlos y ofrecerlos en la venta de comida que realiza los fines de semana en su propio domicilio. Estas actividades le han servido para mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante.

Asunciona desea implementar un pequeño restaurante – bar en su domicilio, se ha dado cuenta de que los dos principales productos que ofrece (la chicha y la comida) tienen bastante aceptación por parte de sus clientes y desea aprovechar esa situación y la ubicación céntrica de su vivienda para instalar el negocio, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas para ofrecer una mejor atención.

Asunciona es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 39 years old. She is separated and lives with her three children, two of whom she still supports. She lives in the “El Vichayal” neighborhood, in the La Arena district in the Piura province. This is a rural community, where most of the residents farm, raise livestock, and also sell “chica” a typical fermented beverage in Peru. This zone is located in the Piura region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling chicha from her home for the past two years. She also raises penned animals and sells them to the businesses within the zone or slaughters them and uses the meat to prepare the food which she sells on the weekends, also out of her home. These activities have helped her support her children and help get them ahead. Asunciona would like to open a small restaurant-bar in her home. We know of the principal products she offers (chicha and food) and that she has loyal customers, and she wants to take advantage of this and her home’s central location. She is asking for her first loan for 800 PEN ($300) through Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy tables and chairs to be able to give better service. Asunciona is a hard working enterprising woman, very dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to watch her sons become well off men with professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant tables and chairs

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa E. is a single parent with three children. She has no educational background.  Abenawa is into the production and sale of 'Fante kenkey' at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. The income generated from her 'Fante kenkey' production is used to take care of her children.  Abenawa will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase more corn to make 'kenkey'. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to provide good education for her children.

To prepare her 'Fante kenkey' she buys maize form the market, then soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes the grains of maize on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to 'prove' till the next day.

She divides the 'proved' dough in two, and uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough. She mixes it with water to get it to a porridge consistency, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough, and mixes the remainder of the uncooked one with the half cooked. She moulds it into balls and wraps them in plantain leaves. The plantain leaves preserve them for three days or more before they start going bad. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish. It is very popular among the people of the Western and the Central Region of the country. On the table is some of the 'Fante kenkey' for display.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to make 'Fante kenkey'

loans.name: Agua De La Caña Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO DE "AGUA DE LA CAÑA" LLEVA EL NOMBRE DE LA COMUNIDAD QUE PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO DE PINOTEPA NACIONAL OAXACA. LAS INTEGRANTES TODOS SON COMERCIANTES. ALICIA M. R. Y VERONICA L. VENDEN POLLO FRESCO DESTAZADO. TERESA S. M., LEOVIGILDA H. M. Y ANGELA G. M. VENDEN TAMALES. MARGARITA O. R. Y PORFIRIA L. S. VENDEN COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO. ANDREA G. L. VENDE VERDURAS EN UNA LOCALIDAD. DOLORES H. C. VENDE PAN, Y CAROLINA A. C. VENDE PESCADO Y CAMARON SECO Ó FRESCO SEGUN PUEDA MERCAR EN PINOTEPA O CORRALERO DONDE PESCAN EL MARISCO.

LA SRA TERESA S. M. ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO. ES CASADA Y TIENE D0S HIJOS DE 14 Y 5 AÑOS DE EDAD.  ELLA VENDE TAMALES PORQUE TIENE MUCHOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN EL MISMO NEGOCIO YA QUE ES UN PRODUCTO QUE SE VENDE MUY RAPIDO EN LA COMUNIDAD Y EN CANTIDAD CONSIDERABLE. TRABAJA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS YA QUE DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SE SUPEREN Y ALGUN DIA SEAN PROFESIONISTAS.
CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A LA  FUNDACION LO INVERTIRÁ EN COMPRA DE INGREDIENTES PARA PREPARAR TAMALES COMO CHILES SECO, MANTECA, SAL, OREGANO, HOJAS DE PLATANO, MAIZ, LEÑA, Y PASAJES YA QUE SE TRASLADA A PINOTEPA A COMPRAR.

CONOCE MUY BIEN A TODOS SUS COMPAÑERAS DEL GRUPO Y NOS COMENTÓ QUE SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y QUE NO FALLARAN CON SUS PAGOS A FUNDACION. NOS COMENTÓ QUE DE CONTINUAR RECIBIENDO EL BENEFICIO DEL CREDITO, A FUTURO PIENSA EN PONER UN LUGAR ESTLABLECIDO PARA PODER OFRECER UNA VARIEDAD DE ANTOJITOS COMO SON SOPES, ENCHILADAS, TAMALES, TOSTADAS, ETC.  ESTA AGRADECIDA POR EL APOYO QUE LE DAN LOS PRESTATARIOS DE KIVA A TRAVES DE FUNDACION REALIDAD Y PIDE CONTINUEN OFRECIENDO CREDITO PARA QUE PUEDAN MEJORAR SU CONDICIÓN DE VIDA TRABAJANDO.
texts.en:
The group "agua de la caña" (sugar cane water) takes its name from the community that is a part of the municipality of Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca. Its members are businesswomen. Alicia and Veronica sell fresh cut up chicken. Teresa, Leovigilda, and Angela sell tamales. Margarita and Porfiria sell cosmetics from a catalog. Andrea sells vegetables. Dolores sells bread and Carolina sells fresh and dried fish and shrimp that she gets from Pinotepa or Corralero, where they fish for seafood. Teresa is the group’s representative. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 5. She sells tamales because she’s been working for many years in this trade and this is an item that sells quickly and in good quantity. She works so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and she hopes that her children will succeed and one day take professional careers. She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients, such as dried chili, lard, salt, oregano, banana leaves, corn, and firewood. She will also use some of the money to pay for trips to Pinotepa, where she buys her ingredients. She knows all of her fellow members very well and tells us that they are very responsible people who will not be delinquent with their payments. She also says that in the future she would like to open an establishment where she can offer a variety of food, such as sopes, enchiladas, tamales, tostadas, etc. She is thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders have given her through “Fundacion Realidad,” and asks that they continue to offer loans so that the ladies can improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Elias Ernesto

texts.es: Don Elias de edad de 49 años, se dedica a dos oficios, es albañil desde su juventud, y destaza cerdo, como a veces los proyectos de trabajos se detienen por falta de ingresos. El comenzó a invertir en cerdo lo cual cuando no tiene trabajo gana en sus productos de carne, venta de chicharrón, manteca, fritos, moronga entre otros. El inicio como albañil debido a que su papa trabajaba y le enseño  el oficio,  ya que era el  sustento de su familia. Con su esposa procreo tres hijos, estudiantes de la secundaria, su esposa a parte que le ayuda con el destace de cerdo es costurera y juntos han logrado el capital. Las dificultades que se le dieron fue la gripe porcina ya que se prohibió el destace del cerdo lo cual sus ventas decayeron y quedo trabajando con poco capital. Gracias a la ganancia de sus trabajos adquirió una camioneta con la que transporta los cerdo y la venta de carne, pero el mantenimiento de la camioneta se lo da con los financiamiento ya que invierte en el vehiculo en la compra de llantas, que en el crédito anterior compro llantas de segunda mano por que no ajusto con el dinero. Es con el financiamiento que  hace toda las mejoras para el vehiculo ya que no ajusta para esta inversión que es parte de instrumento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Elias age 49, is engaged in two trades, he is a mason since his youth, and he is also a pig butcher as sometimes jobs are stopped due to lack of funding. He started investing in pigs when he did not have a job. He earned money from the sale of meat product such as pork skins, butter, fried blood sausage among others. His start as a home as a builder he owes to his father who taught him the trade, as it was how their family was sustained. He has 3 high-school age children with his wife who helps with the butchering and is also a seamstress to earn money. Difficulties arose with swine flu [H1N1] as the butchering of pork was banned and sales dropped, so he is working with very little capital. Thanks to the earnings from his other jobs, he acquired a truck with which he transports the pork and sells the meat but the maintenance of the truck is provided with money he has already invested in the truck in the form of tires. His previous loan was used for the purchase of second-hand tires which made made money tight to provide maintenance on the truck. With the new loan he would be able to make at the improvements to the truck without having to scrimp to invest in this essential business instrument.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires for the truck and provide necessary maintenance

loans.name: Diana Julissa

texts.es:
Diana tiene 26 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el caserío El Vichayal, del distrito de La Arena, en la provincia de Piura, una comunidad rural donde la mayoría de habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, crianza y venta de animales y a la venta de chicha (bebida tipica del país). Esta zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de chicha e insumos para su preparación (harina de jora) en su vivienda desde hace dos años. Este negocio le ha brindado la oportunidad de mantener sola a su familia y sacarlos adelante, por lo que todos los dias da lo mejor de si para mantenerlo e implementarlo.

Diana desea implementar un bar en su vivienda, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de cerveza y bebidas gaseosas con las cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver crecer a su negocio de modo que pueda asegurarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Diana is 26 years old. She is separated and lives with her two children in El Vichayal, in the La Arena district of the Piura province. This is a rural community where most of the people, farm, raise livestock, or make and sell chicha (a fermented beverage typical in Peru). This zone is located in the Piura region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling chicha and chicha-making supplies (corn flour) from her home for two years. This business has given her the opportunity to support her family and help move them ahead. Every day she does her best to maintain and run her business. Diana would like to open a pub in her home, so she is asking for her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) though Edpyme Alternativa. She will use the money to buy beer and soft drinks to help meet her goal of starting the venture. She is a very responsible, hard working woman, dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to watch her business grow in such a way as to be able to secure a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soft drinks and beer to stock a pub

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is married and has five dependents. He has been through junior high school.  Stephen sells rechargeable cards, top-up phone unit cards and also does transfer units to individual phones at a fee. He has set up a small stand by the street where he sells most of the top-up credits. 

His clients  are mostly people walking along the street who happen to run out of units needed to make calls with their mobile phones. His business is doing well since almost everybody in his area uses mobile phones. His business is located at Elmina. His wife is a petty trader. 

Stephen uses the income from his sales to educate his children.  Stephen will use the loan received to purchase more rechargeable and top-up cards from all the mobile phone service providers for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stephen plans to save to buy a piece of land and hopes to get more profit to build a house on the land.

loans.use: to purchase more rechargeable and top-up cards

loans.name: Fuente De Vida 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Sobeida is the coordinator of her group 'Fuente D. Vida' (Source of Life), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, an agricultural area based around the sugarcane harvest where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Sobeida is excited to be taking her second loan  with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small 'colmado' or corner store, and she will invest by purchasing the essentials, rice, beans and cooking oil, to sell in her store. She will use the profits to save towards investing in her business further. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, beans and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2 Group

texts.en:
Bladimir is the coordinator of his group Unidos Venceremos (Together We Will Overcome), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Bladimir’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area dominated by the sugarcane industry and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his longterm partner and their two children.

Bladimir is excited to be taking his fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business running a small cafeteria by purchasing sugar, oil, rice, beans and some perfumes to sell on the side.

Bladimir will use the profits to invest in saving towards a vehicle which will help his business and family at the same time. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, rice and beans for his cafeteria plus perfumes to sell

loans.name: Freddy Rene

texts.es:
El Sr.Freddy, tiene un transporte de radiotaxi por la zona sur, tambien se dedica por temporadas a la venta de arena juntamente con su cuñado, y también se dedica a colocar tepes (cesped que se coloca en los jardines) en domicilios con su esposa, quien se dedica a esta actividad, a la vez venta de abono, tierra en su puesto ubicado en la zona de Achumani, son una pareja joven que viven en la casa de su mamá, tienen dos hijos pequeños, quienes acompañan al puesto de venta de su mamá. El Sr. Freddy trabajo anteriomente con grupo "Sastres", tiene buena predisposicón y voluntad de pago, el crédito invertirá en algunos repuestos para su transporte y para la compra de una puesto en la zona de Achumani para la esposa, es un cliente que solo trabaja con nuestra institución.

El Sr. Freddy esta agradecido con Emprender Y Kiva por la Confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Freddy drives a radio dispatch taxi in the southern zone and sells sand seasonally with his brother-in-law; he also installs tepes (green sod that is installed in gardens) in homes with his wife, who has this business and also sells manure and planting soil in a stand in the Achumani area. They are a young couple who live in his mother's house; they have two small children, who keep their mother company in her sales stand. Freddy collaborated with the "Sastres" group previously and has a good predisposition to repay his loan. He will use the funds to buy some vehicle replacement parts and to buy a sales stand for his wife in the Achumani area. He is a client that works exclusively with our institution. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and a sales stand.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El Señor Alfonso de 59 años de edad, tiene un negocio de taller de mecánica, que se caracteriza  para prestar servicio de reparación de de vehículos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que se le ha otorgado. Inicio con la necesidad de poder apoyar económicamente a sus padres ya que eran una familia de bajos recursos, aprendió el oficio y no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando solamente termino su educación primaria. la descripción del negocio se caracteriza de reparación   compra y venta de repuestos como: llantas, anillos chisperos, filtros, aceites, reparación de vehículos etc. A través de todos los años de experiencia con mi negocio fundación León 2000 me ha prestado su apoyo con respecto a los créditos que para el desarrollo de mi negocio y de mi familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo. He cumplido el sueño de poder tener una casa propia a través de mi trabajo y dedicación, he cumplido con mi propósito de mantener y superar mi negocio día a día.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 59, has a machine shop that specializes in vehicle repairs. This isn't the first loan he's had approved. He started out needing to help his parents economically because they were a very low income family. He learned his trade but was unable to continue with his formal education; he only finished elementary school. The business consists mostly in repairs and replacement parts, such as: tires, piston rings, sparkplugs, filters, lubricats, car repair, etc. "Throughout all my years of experience with my business, Fundación León 2000 has supported me with loans to develop my business and my family" The funding requested now is for working capital. "I have reached my dream of having my own home through my work and dedication; I have met my goal of maintaining and improving my business day to day"

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy auto repair merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Odalia del Carmen de 38 años de edad es casada con tres hijos menores a su cargo. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva de mujer, hombres, niños. Esta necesidad de buscar un nueva fuente de ingreso surge debido a que su esposo estaba en ese entonces desempleado y el era el proveedor para llevar el alimento diario. Este negocio consiste en la compra de ropa en el mercado el oriental de Managua la cual compra por docenas como es camisas, pantalones short, ropa interior, blusas, faldas, de esta forma le permite venderla  al por menor a mi clienta en un precio justo y equitativo. Hoy en día tengo una pequeña tienda ya que he obtenido mucho conocimiento y experiencia en el negocio. Ella sueña con brindarles seguridad emocional y económica a mis hijos, y en lo personal como mujer sentirme realizada porque se que tengo una fuente de ingresos. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento que es tan importante.
texts.en:
Odalia del Carmen, 38, is married and has three, minor children under her care. She sells new clothing for women, men and children. She needed to find a new source of income at a time when her husband became unemployed and he had been the sole source of support for the family. The business consists in clothing sales in Managua's Oriental market. She buys shirts, pants, shorts, underwear, blouses, and skirts by the dozen then sells them at retail for a fair price. "Today I have a small store and I have learned a lot and have experience in this business" She dreams with providing emotional and financial security for her children and personally, as a woman, "I want to feel fulfilled because I know that I have a source of income" For this reason she is asking for this important financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Beatriz es cliente antigua, trabaja desD. el año 2004 en grupo Virgen D. las Nieves en varias secuencias, con tres integrantes D. la zona D.
