Alto Ipavi, ella tiene la actividad D. la reposteria, elabora masitas, tortas, queques, empanadas, humintas, que reparte por la zona central, y por la zona sur, con esta actividad sacó adelante a sus dos hijos que al momento ya son profesionales, pues ella quedo viuda hace veinticinco años atras, la Sra. Beatriz tiene en su domicilio instalado un horno domestico en el que realiza sus trabajos, y otro horno industrial que utiliza solo fines D. año para elaborar panetones, es una persona muy responsable, generosa y trabajadora.

La Sra. Beatriz esta agradecida con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a long-standing client; she has been a member of the "Virgen D. las Nieves" (Our Lady of the Snows) group through several loan cycles. The group is composed of three members from the Alto Ipavi area. She is a pastry baker, making such items as: masitas (brownie-like pastries), tortas (cakes), queques (muffins, cupcakes, etc), empanadas (turnovers), humintas (a type of baked corn tamales) that she sells in the central and south districts. This activity maD. it possible for her to raise her two sons, who are now professionals; she was widowed 25 years ago. Beatriz has a domestic oven, in which she does her baking, installed in her home. She also has an industrial graD. oven that she only uses at the end of the year to make panetones [a typical bread of Milan, usually prepared and enjoyed for Christmas and New Year in Italy and Switzerland. In Latin America, especially in Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil, Bolivia, Chile and Peru, it is a Christmas dinner staple and in some places replaces roscón D. reyes (King cake)]. She is a responsible, generous and hard-working person. Beatriz is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Felicita del Socorro de 49 años de edad tiene una profesión que es maestra de primaria.  Una mujer que ha luchado con sus cuatro hijos. Ella tiene un negocio una pulpería, desde  11 años este negocio surge con la necesidad de obtener un ingreso mas para la subsistencia de sus hijos, ya que con el salario de maestra no cubría las necesidades básicas de la crianza de sus  hijos en ese entonces menores de edad. Al inicio de su negocio era una pequeña pulpería, hoy en día a través del financiamiento que le ha brindo Fundación León 2000 a lo largo de estos años ha podido cumplir sus sueños y metas propuesta como es la superación  académica de sus hijos porque hoy en la actualidad  son profesionales. Por tales motivos solicita este financiamiento para comprar productos para su pulpería.
texts.en:
Felicita del Socorro, 49, is an elementary school teacher. She has struggled to get her four children ahead in life. For the past 11 years she has had a grocery store. She began the business because she needed extra income to support her children because her teacher's salary was insufficient to meet basic needs when her children were still little. At the beginning, her store was a small operation. Today, thanks to financing through the years from Fundación León 2000 she has been able to have her dreams fulfilled and meet the goals she set for herself: her children's academic success because they are now professionals. She is asking for funding to buy stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La Sra. Felipa tiene como actividad principal la venta de verduras en el mercado los Pinos, es cliente antigua, trabajo en grupo Gladiolos, ahora con el credito individual se encuentra  en su septima secuencia, ella trabaja tambien con un horno de panadería juntamente con su esposo, El dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de una amasadora, ellos tienen sus hijos que trabajan indepencientemente, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona de Rosales, donde se encuentra la panaderia, este producto elaboran todos los dias y proveen a las tiendas de la zona y de las comunidades aledañas, como Uni, Collana, etc. En el anterior crédito se dió esta tasa preferencial y no tuvo problemas de pago se vuelve a considerar la tasa preferencial ya que la Sra. Felipa es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.

La Sr. Felipa esta agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Felipa's main commercial activity is vegetable sales in the Los Pinos market. She is a long-standing client and is part of the Gladiolos (Gladiolas) communal bank. This loan will be her 7th. She also has a bakery oven with her husband. The funds will be used to buy a kneader. Their children work independently. She lives in her own home in the Rosales neighborhood, which is where the bakery is. They bake every day and sell their product to stores in the area and neighboring communities like Uni, Collana, Etc. She received this preferential rate on her previous loan and she didn't have any problems with repayment so this preferential rate is being offered again because Felipa is considered to be a responsible and hard-working person. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a kneader for her bakery.

loans.name: Metztli Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Metztli que en náhuatl significa Luna, está ubicado en la colonia Zaragoza perteneciente al municipio de Yautepec  Morelos. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un crédito con Credicomún.
La Sra. Juana D. N.  es la Presidenta del grupo, tiene 55 años de edad, casada desde hace 33 años con 5 hijos; 3 mujeres y 2 hombres. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su crédito lo va a utilizar para poder surtir todos los pedidos que ya tiene de su negocio, se dedica a las ventas por catálogo desde hace 9 años, inició vendiendo colchas y sábanas, las cuales vendía a través de tandas y desde hace 6 años vende productos de belleza principalmente cosméticos.
La Sra. Juanita (como le gusta le llamen) está muy agradecida por los créditos que ha obtenido ya que le han permitido obtener un ingreso extra con el cual a podido apoyar la economía de su familia y principalmente a podido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, además de que piensa seguir invirtiendo aun mas en su negocio para que en futuro pueda hasta tener un local en donde pueda exhibir todos sus productos.

Las demas integrantes se dedican a los sig:
Angelica J. - venta de zapatos por catalogo.
Lorena S. - venta de abarrotes.
Juana T. - venta de zapatos por catalogo
Reyna H. - venta de papeleria
Liliana S. - venta de zapatos por catalogo.
Micaela L. - venta de art de herreria sobre pedido.
Reyna A. - venta de ropa y perfumes por catalogo.
Claudia N. - venta de comida en su domicilio.
Areli Judith S. - venta de zapatos por catalogo.
texts.en:
This group is called Metztli, whicn in Náhuatl means “moon.” It is in the Zaragoza neighborhood of Yautepec, Morelos. It has 10 members and it’s their second loan request from Credicomún. Juana D. N., 55, is the group president. She has been married for 33 years and has 5 children, 3 girls and 2 boys. She sells catalogue cosmetics and will use the funds to fill all of her pending orders. She has done catalogue sales for 9 years. She started out selling bedspreads and sheets that she would sell in batches. For the last 6 years she has sold beauty products, mainly cosmetics. Juanita (as she prefers to be called) is very grateful with the loans she has received because they have made it possible for her to earn extra income that she has used to help support her family’s economy, principally improving her children’s quality of life. In addition, she plans to continue to invest in her business so that in the future she may even have a locale from which to sell her products. The other group members are in the following lines of work: Angelica J. – catalogue shoe sales. Lorena S. – grocery sales. Juana T. - catalogue shoe sales. Reyna H. – stationery sales. Liliana S. - catalogue shoe sales. Micaela L. – iron art items by special order. Reyna A. – catalogue clothing and perfume sales. Claudia N. – food sales in her home. Areli Judith S. - catalogue shoe sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fill her pending bedspread orders.

loans.name: Dominga Lucia

texts.es: La Señora Dominga Lucia de 53 de edad, con tres hijos ya adultos, su actividad económica consiste en la venta y elaboración de comida, en el cual se desempeña desde hace 10 años, esta iniciativa surge a raíz de la crisis económica que atraviesa el país y las  familias Nicaragüenses.  La cual la  motivo a obtener  ingresos para su familia subsistiendo de la venta de comida. Ella prepara comida nacional como: gallo pinto, queso frito, enchiladas, tacos, maduros, tajadas, carne asada, pollo frito. La cual ofrece a sus diferentes clientes. Su negocio lo ha administrado de manera efectiva los recursos que le han confiando como organismo de apoyo ya que esto le ha permitido dar educación a su hijo. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento utilizado en materia prima necesaria.
texts.en:
Dominga Lucia, 53, has three adult children. Her commercial activity consists in the elaboration and sale of food. She has been in this line of work for 10 years now. She began because of the economic crisis that the country and Nicaraguan families are going through. She needed to produce income for her family's support and she decided to do so through food sales. She prepares national dishes like: gallo pinto (rice and beans), queso frito (fried cheese), enchiladas, tacos, fried plantain, grilled meat, fried chicken for her customers. She runs an efficient business and she has managed her loans well; this has made it possible for her to educate her son. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: La Señora Julia Narda tiene 39 años, su negocio que consiste en el servicio de sastrería en el cual se desempeña desde hace 18 años, dentro de las característica de su negocio consiste en la elaboración de prenda de vestir tanto de hombre, mujeres, y niños,  elaborando un promedio de cien trajes o los encargos que tiene solicitado. Por lo que el financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de agujas, tijeras, hilos, botones, carretes aceite de máquina. Por lo que esto le ha permito en el transcurso de sus dieciocho años mantenerse en el mercado e ir creciendo tanto económicamente  como con sus clientes. Beneficio que le ha permitido sentirse realizada como persona, y  madre sabiendo que es una buenas proveedora para su hogar.
texts.en:
Julia Narda, 39, has had a tailor shop for 18 years; she makes clothing for men, women and children. She makes an average of 100 items or the pending orders she has. She is asking for funding to buy supplies like: needles, scissors, thread, buttons, large spools of thread, sewing machine oil, etc. This has allowed her over these eighteen years to remain in the marketplace and to grow economically and with her customer base; a benefit that has made it possible for her to feel fulfilled as a person and as a mother, knowing that she has been a good provider.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Verónica del Socorro de 37 madre soltera y con 3 hijos. Tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa. Ella tiene una educación secundaria incompleta y sin ningún apoyo económico se ha visto en la necesidad de obtener un negocio propio para la manutención de sus hijos y la educación. Por lo que la distribución de sus productos es de forma ambulante y por encargo, actividad que ha venido desarrollando desde hace  5 años. El negocio consiste en compra de ropa comercial para los diferente géneros y edades  es así que este financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Verónica del Socorro is a 37 year old single mother with three children. She has a business selling clothes. She did not finish high school, and she does not have any economic help. She saw the need to have her own business to support and educate her children. She distributes her products on the street and by request. She has been developing her business for five years. Her business consists of buying clothes for men and women and for different ages. This loan she is requesting is to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La Señora Paulina es cliente D. Emprender desD. el año 2002, trabajo con grupo solidario "Gardenia", ella y su familia viven en la zona D. Chiaraqui, más conocida como la "muela del Diablo", un lugar turistico que se encuentra  a dos horas D. caminata desD. Chasquipampa, ella tiene un kiosco al lado D. la escuela, en el que venD. abarrotes, refrescos y golosinas para los habitantes del lugar y para los estudiantes, la señora tiene hijos ya casados, solo mantiene a uno D. 12 años que se encuentra estudiando. el esposo es jardinero en las épocas que no tiene que trabajar en su tierra D. cultivo, le  ayuda a su esposa en la venta D. los productos es una cliente buena, ella se transporta a pie desD. esa localidad para sus pagos y tramites del crédito, ya que no existe transporte urbano ni provincial a ese lugar, por lo que es conveniente para ella este trato preferencial. El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. refrescos y cerveza para surtir su kiosco. Esta Muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Paulina has been a client of Emprender since 2002. She works with the Gardenia Communal Bank. She and her family live in the Chiaraqui area, which is better known as the “Muela del Diablo” (Devil’s Tooth). It is a tourist spot, which is a two hour walk from Chasquipampa. She has a kiosk at the siD. of the school. She sells groceries, soft drinks, and sweets to the residents and students. She is married and has children. She is only supporting one, the 12 year old who goes to school. Her husband is a gardener. During the times that he does not have to work on the land he has planted, he helps his wife sell her products. She is a good client. She comes from her location on foot to make her payments and complete the loan transactions. There is no urban or provincial transportation in this area. This arrangement works well for her. She will use the money from the loan to buy soft drinks and beer to stock her kiosk. She is very grateful to Empender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Isidra Engracia

texts.es: La Señora Isidra Engracia de 57 de edad  del municipio está casada con cinco hijos, que trabajan por cuenta propia. Ella se dedica a la actividad del destace de cerdo. Por lo que desde muy joven conoce ya que ha sido la forma y subsistencia de vida de su familia, dicha negocio lo ha desarrollado de forma independiente. Actividad que consiste en  productos derivados del cerdo como son carne de cerdo nacatamales,  adobado, chicharrón, manteca de cerdo, moronga. La venta la desarrolla en su casa de habitación, la  compra de  los cerdos la hace en la comarca aledaña, los cuales son compras de contado y al crédito. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Isidra Engracia is 57, married, and has five children who work on their own. She butchers pigs. She has known how to do this since she was very young because it has been the way of life and the support of her family. She has developed the business independently. This activity consists of products derived from pork like pork “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), pickled meat, “chicharrón” (made from 3 or 4 chunks of pork, served with fried potatoes, sweet or savory corn, onion and spearmint salad), lard, and blood sausage. She sells from her home. She buys the pigs in the neighboring region. She buys them for cash and for credit. That is why she is requesting the loan for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santa Cruz 1 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Santa Cruz es originario de la Aldea Santa Cruz, departamento de Choluteca, las integrantes son mujeres todas y son muy unidas, a continuacion se detalla cada una de las actividades que ellas realizan diariamente para ganarse la vida:
la sra. Martha G. es una señora casada y trabajadora, hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, las vende en su comunidad y tambien en EXCOSUR que es una empresa melonera que esta muy cerca de su casa, Martha tiene 2 hijas las cuales viven con ella. sus hijas trabajan en esta exportadora de melon y su esposo tambien trabaja en la misma melonera. Las hijas en sus tiempos libres le ayudan a Martha con dicha actividad. Ahora Martha quiere comprar una pequeña maquina para elaborar mas tortillas ya que las ventas son buenas.
la sra. Ana O. se dedica a la fabricacion de tortillas, con esta actividad a logrado salir adelante
y poder ayudarle a su familia, se levanta muy temprano a preparar las tortillas ya que los clientes desde temprano las vende, quiere crecer en con su negocio es por eso que a solicitado este prestamo.
la sra. Egna E. es una persona joven que se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas. Egna  trabaja duro para salir adelante y ayudar a su familia,  tiene 2 niños.
la sra. Juana R. es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta y elaboracion de tortillas, lucha para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles un mejor futuro, sus hijos estan en la escuela de la comunidad. En los tiempos libres sus hijos le ayudan a juana., ella quiere incrementar mas su negocio es por eso que a solicitado el credito.
texts.en:
The Santa Cruz group is from the Santa Cruz village in the Choluteca department. The members are all women who are very united. The following are details of each one of the daily activities they do to earn a living: Martha G. is married, and she is a hard-worker. She has been making and selling tortillas for a long time. She sells in her community. She also sells to Excosur, which is a melon business very close to her house. Martha has two daughters who live with her. They work for the melon exporter. Her husband also works for the same melon dealer. Matha’s daughters help her with the business during their free time. Martha now wants to buy a small machine to make more tortillas because sales have been good. Ana O. makes tortillas. With this business she has gotten ahead and been able to help her family. She gets up very early to prepare the tortillas because she starts selling them early. She wants to grow in her business, and that is why she is requesting this loan. Egna E. is a young person who makes and sells tortillas. Egna works hard to get ahead and help her family. She has two children. Juana R. is a single mother, and she has three children. She makes and sells tortillas. She struggles to be able to get her children ahead and give them a better future. Her children go to school in the community. The children help Juana during their free time. She wants to increase her business, and that is why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy corn flour, lime, water, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento PICAFLOR  representadas por su mesa directiva:

La sra. Maria es la Presidenta del Banco  tiene como actividad la venta víveres a pedido en la zona D. Villa Fátima en su domicicilio, esta casada y tiene hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del credito comprara viveres para poder cumplir con sus clientes; 

la Sra. Wendy  es la secretaria D. actas ella se dedica  a la promoción D. cosméticos D. diferentes marcas reconocidas en el medio, el dinero lo utilizara para la compra D. productos D. belleza que se encuentran en promocion para despues poder venderlos al precio original.

El sr. Miguel es el tesorero su actividad es la venta por mayor D. ropa nueva que lo trae directamente D. Iquique y lo reparte por los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad D. La Paz, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor. 

Como representantes del Banco D. emprendimiento Picaflor compuesta por 8 personas se garantizan mutuamente, porque se conocen  y ponen su garantia para este segundo crédito con nuestra institución pues el 100% tienen negocios estables y rentables.

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Picaflor Communal Bank is represented by its governing board: Maria is the president of the bank. She sells supplies by order in the Villa Fátima area. She sells at home. She is married and has school-age children. She will use the money from the loan to buy supplies to be able to satisfy her customers. Wendy is the secretary, and she promotes different well known brands of cosmetics. She will use the money to buy beauty products that she finds on promotional sales and later sell them at the original price. Miguel is the treasurer. He sells new clothes wholesale. He brings them from Iquique and distributes them to the different markets in the city of La Paz. He will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. As representatives of the Picaflor Communal Bank, which is comprised of eight people, they mutually guarantee this second loan. They do this because they know each other and 100% of them have stable and profitable businesses. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
LA Sra. Catalina  anteriormente fue favorecida con la tasa preferencial, por lo que ella pudo invertir y pagar sus cuotas sin retraso, ella se dedica al hilado y tejido de mantas de lana de vicuña dese hace más de veinte años, ella compra generalmente la lana en la feria de R. que se realiza en la zona de El Alto cada año, razón por la cual ella  solicita el crédito con anticipación, las mantas reparte po la zona sur, ella vive con dos hijos menores, ya que el esposo viaja constantemente siendo ella la que mantiene a ellos, y tiene tambien que cuidar de un hijo enfermo, además de estos gastos ella paga puntualmente  sus pagos mensuales, ya que recupera de sus ventas mensualmente. Con el dinero del credito comprara lana por mayor para la realizacion de sus mantas.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada por la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Catalina was previously granted a preferential rate which made it possible for her to invest and repay on time. She has woven and knit vicuña wool blankets for more than 20 years. She usually buys the wool in the R. fair that takes place in El Alto yearly. She needs funding ahead of time for this reason. She sells the blankets in the southern zone. She lives with her two youngest children because her husband travels constantly and it is she who supports them; she also must care for a sick child. Desite these expenses, she makes her monthly payments on time because she earns enough in her monthly sales to do so. She will use the funds to buy wool for her blankets at wholesale. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Esquipula Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esquipula está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Educebia López quien desde muy pequeña trabaja en la realización de tortillas cuyo oficio aprendió en ceno familiar. Ella se independizo a sus 18 años cuando forma su propia familia a la que también trasmitió este conocimiento.

Desde entonces han transcurrido 30 años en los cuales ha trabajado arduamente por su familia y su bienestar. López invertirá el crédito en la compra de maíz, leña y cal  que son la materia prima para realizar dicho producto. 

Sus compañeros de grupo son la joven Ignacia del Socorro U. Ramírez quien también realiza y vende tortillas con la esperanza de poder brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos y Margarito Antonio R. V. vende ropa desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The Esquipula group is composed of three hard-working people. One of them is Educebia López, who has been a tortilla maker since a very young age; she learned this skill in the bosom of her family. At the age of 18, she became independent when she started her own family to whom she also passed on this skill. Since then, ít's been 30 years in which she has worked hard for her family and for her wellbeing. She will use the funds to buy corn, firewood and lime powder, which are the raw ingredients for tortillas. Her fellow group members are: Ignacia del Socorro U. Ramírez, who also makes tortillas to provide a better future for her children and Margarito Antonio R. V., who has sold clothing for the past two years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
el sr. Rigoberto es un hombre casado y muy trabajador, se dedica al servicio de moler maiz para hacer tortillas, en este lugar la mayoria de las mujeres acostumbran a hacer sus propias tortillas y necesitan de los servicios de Rigoberto. 
tambien tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual necesita abastecerla, por este motivo es que el esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar productos de la canasta basica y asi poder hacer crecer su pulperia, en este  negocio le ayuda su esposa, ella atiende la pulperia y el molino lo atiende Rigoberto.
Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana a atender a sus clientas por que a
esa hora empiesan a llegar a moler maiz, el quiere sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is married and a very hard working man. He grinds dried corn into flour to make tortillas. In this area most women make their own tortillas and are in need of Rigoberto’s services. He is requesting this loan because he also has a small food store that he needs to stock, and he would like to be able to buy some basic items in order to grow his store. His wife helps him by tending to the store, while he tends to the grinder. He rises at four in the morning to service his clients, because that is when they begin arriving with corn to grind. He would like to move his small businesses ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic items to stock food store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Espino está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Vilma Enmerita P. M. quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Esta señora de 52 años tiene una fritanga que ha ido surgiendo poco a poco, ella acredita este logro al poyo de sus hijos y la administración que ha hecho del préstamo luego de ser capacitada.

Para P. el  haber sido parte del proceso de capacitación y formación de género y desarrollo empresarial que Adim promueve fue un gran apoyo ya que izo cambiar su visión del negocio y tener mayores resultados en este. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son la joven Silvia María Pérez Díaz quien vende prendas de oro y plata y Nidia del Carmen C. Hernández que se dedica a la compra y venta de tamarindo, manís, cacao etc.
texts.en:
The group "Espino" is made up of 3 enterprising women, one of whom is Vilma Enmerita P. M., who is the coordinator of the group. She is 52 years old, and has a fritanga (street-side business selling fried foods) which has been growing little by little. She credits this success to the support of her children and the institution that made her the loan and later gave her training. For P., having been part of the process of this kind of training and business development that ADIM promotes was great support, since it changed her vision of the business, and she has had better results with this. Her fellow group members are the young Silvia María Pérez Díaz, who sells gold and silver jewelry, and Nidia del Carmen C. Hernández, who buys and sells tamarind, peanuts, cocoa, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, staple grains, cooking oil, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Nuvia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca es muy dedicada a su trabajo, es madre soltera, tiene una hija mayor la cual le ayuda en el negocio para atennder a sus clientes. Blanca es muy responsable y logro sacar adelante a su hija sola.
Blanca se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para arreglarse y luego atender a sus clientes.
en estos momentos necesita un prestamo para comprar mas fardos de ropa, en el lugar donde ella compra los fardos estan clasificados por el tipo de ropa, quiere comprar ropa que no sea caliente, como camisetas, calsonetas y camisas de vestir.
blanca necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio, las ganancias que obtenga las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is a single mother who is dedicated to her work. She has an adult daughter who helps with her business by attending to the customers. Blanca is very responsible and was able to support her daughter by herself. She wakes up at 6am every day to get dressed and later tend to her customers.

At the moment, Blanca needs a loan to buy more bundles of clothing. The place where she acquires her inventory assembles the bundles based on the type of clothing. She wants to buy clothes that are not too hot, such as T-shirts, bathing suits, and dress shirts. Blanca wants to access this loan so that she can get ahead in her business. The income she generates is needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janeth Margot

texts.es:
Janeth tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a la venta de abarrotes y de carne de pollo en su domicilio, donde tiene instalada una bodega – tienda. La idea del negocio nació ante la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional con el cual la economía de su familia pueda tener la estabilidad suficiente para progresar, ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como trabajador agrícola no les proporcionaban la estabilidad que necesitaban.

El negocio de Janeth goza de buena acogida gracias a su trato amable y a la calidad de servicio que brinda. El inicio de clases escolares a nivel nacional ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de útiles escolares, por ello se encuentra solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mercadería.

Janeth es una mujer bastante trabajadora y responsable, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior con la que se aseguren un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Janeth is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the District of Mochumí, in the Province of Lambayeque, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than ten years, Janeth has been selling groceries and chicken from a store located inside of her home. The idea for this business came about because of the need to secure additional income to stabilize her family’s finances and help them progress. Her husband’s earnings as a farm laborer are not enough to give them the stability they need.

Janeth’s business is well-received because of the friendly treatment and quality service she provides. Classes are starting all over the country and she is thinking about expanding her business by purchasing school supplies. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1300 PEN so that she can buy merchandise.

Janeth is a hardworking and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to pursue a college education so that they can secure themselves a prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to add to her inventory

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Martínez P. tiene 4 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera, actualmente habita en la comarca Ocotal, caserío Las Minitas, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su propia finca, asimismo su ganado y tierras dedicadas a  la agricultura específicamente la cosecha de café orgánico. Es necesario mencionar que tiene 20 años de experiencia de trabajar en las actividades agropecuarias con la intensión de generar ingresos para la familia y por ende para su sobrevivencia.
texts.en:
Martínez P. has been with the CEPRODEL loan financing partner for four years. He lives in the Ocotal region, in the hamlet of Las Minitas of El Sauce, Nicaragua. He runs his own farm, raising both livestock and organic coffee. He has been working for 20 years in agriculture to generate income for his family's survival.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one male calf, one female calf, and a cow.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Maria D. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Alfonzo en el municipio de Trojes departamento de El Paraiso. Jose se dedica al comercio, comenzo su  negocio vendiendo en su carrito y ahora tiene 3 puestos ubicados en diferentes puntos comerciales del municipio de trojes. Don Chema se caracteriza por los precios comodos que brinda a sus clientes y por la amabilidad con la que  atiende.
tambien sale a vender en su carrito a diferentes aldeas y caserios de la localidad lo que le genera ingresos permanentes. el credito lo invertira para surtir mas su negocio donde tenga varios prodcutos que ofrecer a sus clientes, de tal manera no dejar irse al cliente sin comprar nada.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Maria D. is 46 years old and lives in the Alfonzo neighborhood of the town of Trojes, Department of El Paraiso. He is a merchant who began his business selling from a small cart and now has three vending posts located in different commercial areas within the town of Trojes. Don Chema is known for offering his customers comfortable prices and providing them friendly service. He also travels to different neighborhoods and villages with his cart as a way of generating permanent income. The loan he is requesting will be invested in more merchandise for his business so that he will have everything and can prevent a customer from leaving without having bought something.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rubber sandals & plastic utensils

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fence repair materials, build a water trough and a corral.

loans.name: Dunia Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. Dunia Lizeth P. M. tiene una pulperia en la aldea del Chichicaste, Jamastran, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "DUNIA" actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 4 años. Dunia es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería,  ese es un robro de mayor afluencia en esa zona, tienen un hijo el cual depende a un 100% de ellos.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio, ella cubre a un 100% los gastos personales, Dunia es Bachiller de Administracion de empresa, pero en la actualidad sigue cursando sus estudios superiores, y es pasante de la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Honduras, en la metodologia a Distancia, dichos gastos los cubre con los ingresos del negocio.
necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio y asi tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Dunia Lizeth P. M. owns a general store in the town of Chichicaste, Jamastran. Her business, which goes by the name of "DUNIA," has been around for 4 years. Dunia is married to a man who works in agriculture and stockbreeding, the most lucrative fields in the area. They have one son who depends on them 100%.

With the income from this business, she covers her personal expenses 100%. Dunia has a certificate in Business Administration, but she is currently enrolled in distance learning courses at the Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Honduras. She covers her university tuition with the profits from her business.

She needs a loan in order to restock her business, thus boosting both sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, rice, soap, bathroom tissue, pasta, coffee, chicken, eggs, flour, dairy products, and grains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mi Jardin Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Jardín lo integran personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. El coordinador de dicho grupo es el señor Alberto Hernández Chavarria quien comenzó siendo chofer de un taxi pero sus deseos y determinación de ir creciendo lo ayudaron a lograr tener su propio vehículo.  El invertirá el crédito en mantenimiento para el vehículo  ya que estos lo requieren para su funcionamiento adecuado y evitar posibles accidentes. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Isabel C. Rodríguez quien comercializa ropa y cosméticos y Ángela del Socorro López tiene una tortillería.
texts.en:
The Mi Jardín (My Garden) Group is comprised of hardworking, enterprising people. The group coordinator is Mr. Alberto Hernández Chavarria, who started out as a taxi cab driver. However, due to his determination to grow as a person, he was able to obtain his own vehicle. He will invest this loan in taxi cab maintenance so that it can keep functioning properly, thus avoiding accidents. His fellow group members are María Isabel C. Rodríguez, who sells clothing and cosmetics, and Ángela del Socorro López, who has a tortilla factory.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi cab maintenance

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El señor M. P. tiene 4 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera, actualmente habita en la comarca San Miguelito, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su propia finca, asimismo su ganado y tierras dedicadas a la actividad  agropecuaria. Es necesario mencionar que tiene 41 años de experiencia de trabajar en la explotación de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Mr. M. P. has collaborated with this financial institution for 4 years. He currently resides in San Miguelito, El Sauce. He is a farmer/cattleman. He has his own farm, cattle and farmlands dedicated to these activities. It's worth mentioning that he has farmed his land for 41 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young bull, a young cow, wire fencing and staples.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: El señor Velásquez E. tiene 2 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera con la responsabilidad de codeudor, actualmente habita en la comarca San Miguelito, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su propia finca, asimismo su ganado y tierras dedicadas a la explotación agropecuaria. Es necesario mencionar que tiene 15 años de experiencia de trabajar en las actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Mr. Velásquez E. has collaborated with this financial institution for 2 years as a co-borrower; he lives in San Miguelito, El Sauce. He is a farmer/cattleman; he has his own farm, cattle and farmlands which he uses for these activities. It must be mentioned that he has 15 years experience in the farming/cattle raising areas of expertise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Angel G. A. se dedica la venta de golosinas, el lugar donde lleva a cabo sus ventas es en la caseta que se encuantra ubicada dentro de la Escuela José Trinidad Reyes ubicada en la misma aldea en donde reside.
Don Santos es casado y tiene 3 hijos, les ciubre todos los gastos y esta brindandoles estudios. Su esposa es el apoyo que el tiene en el negocio ya que ella es la que se encarga de elaborar las golosinas como ser: Tacos, Enchiladas, Baleadas, Catrachitas, Tajaditas de platano, tortillas con quesillo y otras. tiene la ayuda de su hija para la atencion de los clientes.
tambien  tiene un negocio en su casa de habitación, la actividad es la venta de Verduras este negocio lo administra su esposa. ya que anteriormente solo trabajaba en la epoca escolar.
Sus condiciones de vida han mejorado en gran manera e igual el crecimento de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Angel G. A. sells snacks for a living. He conducts business in a stand that is located inside José Trinidad Reyes School, located in his town of residence.

Mr. Santos is a married father of 3 children. He covers all their expenses and is providing them with an education. His wife supports him with the business because she is the one who prepares the snacks, such as tacos, enchiladas, baleadas (breakfast burritos), catrachitas (small tostadas), banana chips, quesadillas, and other snacks. They have the help of one of their daughters to attend to their patrons.

They also sell vegetables from home. This business is run by his wife because she used to work only during the school year.

Their living conditions have greatly improved, and so have their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, cookies, churros, pastries, candy, cheese, butter, flour, beans, plantains, yucca, and potatoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Cleofes

texts.es:
doña Maria Cleofes C. tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son de su primer matrimonio, hoy tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de una pequeña niña de 8 años de edad. 
 
su negocio es la venta de baleadas y otros alimentos tipicos de las mañanas, esta actividad la realiza en las afueras del mercado municipal de Nacaome, todos los dias, tiene la ayuda de uno de sus hijos como de su esposo, con este trabajo han logrado mejorar su casa y han comprado un carro.
 
esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que han confiado en ella y dice que hara todo lo posible por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Cleofes C. has 4 children, 3 of whom are from her first marriage. She is 42 years old and has an 8-year-old daughter.

She sells baleadas (wheat flour tortillas filled with beans and other ingredients) and other local breakfast foods at the Nacaome municipal market every day with the help of one of her children and her husband. With this business, they have managed to improve their home and purchase a car.

She is very grateful to all the people who have trusted her, and she states that she will do everything she possibly can to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour, beans, cheese, butter, coffee, milk, sugar, drinks, juice, beef, pork, and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melvin Armando

texts.es:
el joven Melvin Armando A. C. tiene 28 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños en la ciudad de nacaome y en las comunidades cercanas.
anteriormente hacia esta actividad junto a su esposa Oneyda Almendares pero adquirieron un local en el mercado municipal e instalaron un comedor el cual ella atiende.
el trabajo de ambos les ha servido para poder construir su casa la cual estrenaran en mes de abril del 2010 y por lo cual dicen sentirse muy contentos y felices.
las ganancias que obtenga las nececita para cubrir con los gastos de su nuevo hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Melvin Armando A. C. is 28 years old and sells new clothing for men, women, and children in the city of Nacaome and in surrounding areas. He used to do this with his wife, Oneyda Almendares, but they then obtained a business space at the municipal market, where they set up a small restaurant that she now attends to. Their work has helped them get a chance to build their own house, which they will be occupying for the first time in April of 2010. For this reason, they state that they are very happy. The profits that he earns will be used to cover the new house expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shirts, undershirts, blouses, pants, jeans and skirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Lupario

texts.es:
el señor Santos Lupario F. vive en el barrio Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de nacaome, tiene 25 años y es padre de una niñita de un año.
junto a su esposa atiende una pulperia de su propiedad.
a partir de las 4 de la mañana sale junto a su esposa a vender baleadas, café, osmil y otros alimentos para desayunar, el resto del dia atiende a sus clientes en su pulperia.
Santos esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su pulperia, dice sentirse contento ya que esta viendo que su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco. 
 
Santos Lupario goza de buena reputacion tanto en su familia como en su comunidad y su sueño es convertir su pulperia en un mercadito.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Lupario F. lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. He is 25 years of age and has a one-year-old daughter.

He and his wife run their own general store. Starting from 4am, they go out to sell baleadas (wheat flour tortillas filled with beans and other ingredients), coffee, oatmeal, and other breakfast foods. The rest of the day, he attends to his customers at the general store.

Santos is requesting a loan so that he can stock up his general store. He states that he is happy because he can see that his business is growing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, lard, cooking oil, beans, bread, cookies, pastries, eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Angel Antonio A. tiene 19 años de edad, esta soltero, es el ultimo de cinco hermanos y se dedica a la reparacion y activacion de celulares desde hace 2 años.
 
su centro de trabajo esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y desea trasladarlo a una zona mas centrica para captar mas clientes.
esta solicitando el credito para comprar repuestos para reparar telefonos moviles.
 
su sueño es modernizar su taller con nuevas herramientas y ponerse al dia con sus competidores.
texts.en:
Young Angel Antonio is 19 years of age, single, and the youngest of five brothers. For two years he has been repairing and setting-up cell phones.

His work place is located in his home and he wants to move it to a more central area in order to attract more customers.

He is requesting this loan to buy parts for repairing cell phones.

His dream is to modernize his workshop with new tools and catch-up with his competitors.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy screens, keyboards, housings, chargers, and circuits for cell phones

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
la señora Virginia S. Agüero tiene 52 años de edad y se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de quesillo, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus productos los vende a distribuidores minoritarios que llegan a su fabrica a traerlos. esta actividad la realiza con ayuda de dos de sus hijos, asi como de cuatro empleados que tiene permanentemente.
 
gracias a esta actividad a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que tuvo que educarlos y mantenerlos 
sola sin ayuda alguna.
por su dedicacion y trabajo a logrado dia a dia ir aumentando la cantidad de leche comprada para la fabricacion del quesillo.
 
su deseo es aumentar mas su produccion para poder generar mas empleos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia S. Agüero is 52 years old and has been producing and selling cheese for ten years. Her products are sold to small distributors who come to her to pick up the products. Virginia manages her business with the help of two of her children, as well as four full-time employees.

Thanks to her business, she has helped her children get ahead by providing them with an education and supporting them on her own without any help. Out of dedication and hard work, she has managed each day to increase the amount of milk she buys for making cheese. Her wish is to continue increasing her production so that she can create more jobs in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk & supplies for making cheese

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive junto a su padre y a su hermana en el caserío Chepito Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Morrope, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral (chivos, patos y pavos). Jorge cría sus animales en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, luego los vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio le provee los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Jorge desea ampliar su corral, ya que sus animales han aumentado y el espacio con el que cuenta no es suficiente. Por ello está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utlizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Jorge es una persona conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, ellos lo consideran una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old, single, and does not have any dependent children. He lives with his father and sister in the village of Chepito Alto, a rural area in the Distirct of Morrope. This community is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years, Jorge has been raising and selling corralled animals (such as goats, ducks, and turkeys). He keeps his animals in a pen located behind his house and later sells them to merchants who pass through the area. This business provides the income necessary to cover his personal expenses and help support his family.

Jorge wants to expand his corral because the number of animals on hand has increased and there is not enough space. For this reason, he requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN so that he can meet his objective.

Jorge is a person who is known and respected by his neighbors. They consider him to be a responsible and hardworking person. His greatest wish is to offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his corral

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Invest in a new restaurant

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca Aurora G. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia, la cual esta ubicada en la aldea Jicaro Galan de Nacaome desde hace 12 años. es madre de 2 hijos ya adolecentes que estan estudiando, su esposo se marcho a Estados Unidos hace 11 años y desde alla les brinda ayuda.
 
su proposito es construir su propia casa ya que viven en casa de un familiar hace mucho tiempo.
esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su negocio
texts.en:
For 12 years Blanca Aurora G. has been selling groceries in her shop, which is located in the small village of Jicaro Galan de Nacaome in Honduras. She is the mother of two children who are now adolescents. He husband left for the United States 11 years ago. From there, he helps to support his family. Blanca wants to construct her own house, as she has been living with a family member for a long time. She is seeking a loan to be able to provision her store better.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereal, milk, sardines, milk, rice, sugar, beans, tortillas, eggs, salt, soup, churros, toothpaste, soap, toilet paper, oats.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Areas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Áreas está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras  y emprendedoras los cuales se dedican a comercializar perecederos. Uno de ellos es la señora  Sebastiana de los Ángeles Áreas López  quien comercializa frutas y verduras de acuerdo a la temporada. Ella lleva 5 años trabajando en este negocio junto con su compañero de vida e invertirá el crédito en la compra de cosechas especialmente de mango, aguacate, jocote que es la fruta de temporada.

Los otros integrantes son José Alberto R. quien desde 1992 se dedica a la compra y venta de piña y Graciela del Carmen C. González comercializa frutas y verduras y tiene una pequeña venta en su casa.
Este grupo tiene cinco ciclos de trabajar con Adim en los cuales fueron participes del proceso del proceso de capacitación y formación en desarrollo empresarial y autoestima que Adim oferta. Según ellos esto les beneficio mucho ya que aprendieron a invertir, hacer mas ordenados, ampliar sus negocios y como poder ajustar con su dinero.
texts.en:
The group "Áreas" consists of three hardworking, entrepreneurial people who work selling perishable produce. One of them is Sebastiana, who sells seasonal fruits and vegatables. She has been working in this business with her partner for five years and will use the loan to buy crops of mangos, avocados, and jocotes, which are fruits of this season.

The other members are José who has been buying and selling pineapples since 1992 and Graciela who sells fruits and vegetables and has a small store in her house.

This group has been working with Adim for five loan cycles in which they have been participants in the trainings on capacity building, business development, and self esteem that Adim offers. According to them, this has benefited them greatly as they learned to invest, gain more orders, grow their businesses, and arrange their money.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy harvests of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jicaltepec Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO DE "JICALTEPEC" LLEVA ESE NOMBRE PORQUE ASI SE LLAMA LA LOCALIDAD DONDE HABITAN CERCA DE PINOTEPA NACIONAL OAXACA, LOS CLIENTES SE DEDICAN A COMERCIALIZAR ALIMENTOS,REBECA M. Y JUANA G. VENDEN TACOS, SOTERA G.,EUSTOLIA V. Y RICARDA S. VENDEN DESAYUNOS EN UNA ESCUELA,ORALIA S. ELABORA SERVILLETAS TEJIDAS A MANO Y LAS VENDE, TERESA T., CARMELA L. M. Y EUSTOLIA G. VEDEN TAMALES, OFELIA S. VENDE TOTOPOS, MARIA L. VENDE CENA (COMIDA PREPARADAS Y ANTOJITOS COMO SON:SOPES,ENCHILADAS,TACOS, EMPANADAS)
LA SEÑORA MARIA L. G. ES CASADA TIENE 3 HIJOS DE 9, 12, Y 14 AÑOS DE EDAD,ELLA DECIDIO VENDER ALIMENTOS DEBIDO A QUE ESTE TRABAJO LO HA REALIZADO YA POR MUCHOS AÑOS YA QUE AHORA TRABAJA EN SU PROPIO LOCAL Y EL DINERO DEL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A FUNDACION LO VA A UTILIZAR PARA COMPRAR MATERIAL COMO ES CEMENTO, ARENA, CALHIDRA, Y PAGAR LA MANO DE OBRA PARA AMPLIAR SU LOCAL PORQUE QUIERE QUE SUS CLIENTES SE SIENTAN A GUSTO CUANDO VAN A CONSUMIR.
ELLA COMENTA QUE LE AGRADA TRABAJAR CON LAS COMPAÑERAS DE SU GRUPO YA QUE DICE CONOCE A TODAS Y QUE CONFIA QUE NO VAMOS A TENER PROBLEMAS PRA LA RECUPERACION DEL CREDITO YA QUE TODAS SON RESPONSABLES Y PAGADORAS.
TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE LOS PRESTATARIOS DE KIVA CONTINUEN APOYANDO A LA FUNDACION PARA QUE ELLAS SIGAN RECIBIENDO EL BENEFICIO DEL CREDITO Y HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO ADEMAS COMENTÓ ENVIEN NUESTROS AGRADECIMIENTOS A LOS QUE PRESTAN EL DINERO EN KIVA Y QUE NO SE OLVIDEN DE NOSOTROS.
texts.en:
The “Jicaltepec” group is called thus because that’s the name of the place the members are from; it is near Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. The members are merchants selling a variety of food products: Rebeca M. and Juana G. sell tacos; Sotera G., Eustolia V. and Ricardo S. sell breakfasts in a school; Oralia S. hand knits napkins to sell; Teresa T., Carmela L. M. and Eustolia G. sell tamales; Ofelia S. sells Totopos (corn chips); Maria L. sells dinners (prepared meals and snacks like: sopes (fried tortilla dough circles topped with various toppings), enchiladas, tacos, empanadas). Maria L. G. is married and has three children; they are 9, 12, and 14 years of age. She decided to sell food because this is something she has done for many years. She now has her own work place and the loan money that she has requested from the Foundation will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand and whitewash and to pay labor costs to enlarge her eatery because she wants her customers to be comfortable when they come. She comments that she likes working with her fellow group members because she knows all of them and trusts that they won’t have any problems repaying the loan because they are all hard-working and good payers. She also hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support the Foundation so that they can continue to receive the benefits that credit represents and to help their businesses grow. She also asked that we send their appreciation to all those who lend money to Kiva and that don’t forget them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
"LOS TULIPANES" SE LLAMA ASI DEBIDO A QUE EN EL LUGAR DONDE SE REUNEN HAY PLANTAS QUE LLEVAN ESTE NOMBRE,TODOS SON ORIGINARIOS DE LA CD. DE PINOTEPA NACIONAL OAXACA Y SON COMERCIANTES. MARINA C. M. Y CRISTINA VIRGINIA VENDEN CHOCOMILK EN LAS FERIAS DE LOS PUEBLOS, ZULMA R. VENDE REFRESCOS EN SU DOMICILIO, MARGARITA R. L. VENDE SUPLEMENTOS ALIMENTICIOS NATURAL, JULIA P. Y SOFIA O. L. VENDEN COSMETICOS POR CATALAGOS,ALMA ROSA T. Y MAYRAN NALLELY E. VENDEN LIBROS, INES LOURDES A. Y VIRGINIA INES R. M. VENDEN DULCES EN LA EXPLANA DE UNA ESCUELA PRIMARIA, JUSTINA MAXIMA C. Y LILIA ELIA C. C. VENDE ANTOJITOS EN SU DOMICILIO (SOPES, TACOS DORADOS, ENCHILADAS, TAMALES, EMPANADAS). 

LA SEÑORA VIRGINIA INES R. ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO. ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE TRES HIJOS DE LOS CUALES UNO DEPENDE ECONOMICAMENTE DE ELLA Y YA QUE ESTA ESTUDIANDO LA PREPARATORIA. ELLA TRABAJA VENDIENDO DULCES YA QUE PARA ELLA ES COMODO PORQUE LA ESCUELA SE ENCUENTRA MUY CERCA DE SU DOMICILIO Y SE SIENTE QUE PUEDE OBTENER BUENOS INGRESOS. ELLA SUEÑA CON QUE SU HIJO MENOR OBTENGA SU CARRERA PROFESIONAL ADEMAS DE DEJARLE UN LUGAR PARA VIVIR.  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO INVIERTE EN LA COMPRA DE FRITURAS COMO SON:PAPAS FRITAS,INGREDIENTES PARA PREPARAR CHICHARRON, SALSA BONATERA, BOLSAS DE PLASTICO,PLATOS DESECHABLES, ACEITE VEGETAL, Y DULCES.  COMENTA QUE CONOCE A TODAS LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES QUE ADEMAS ESTAN AGRADECIDAS CON LOS PRESTATARIOS DE KIVA PORQUE CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO ATRAVEZ DE FUNDACION REALIDAD LES DA LA OPORTUNIDAD DE TRABAJAR Y APOYAR EN LA ECONOMIA DE SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
They call themselves "The Tulips" because they meet at a place where these plants grow. They all are from City of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca and are all business people. Marina C. M. and Virginia sell chocolate milk in the village markets, Zulma R. sells refreshments at her home, Margarita R. L. sells natural food supplements, Julia P. and Sofia O. L. sell cosmetics from catalogs, Alma Rosa T. and Mayran Nallely E. sell books, Inez Lourdes A. and Virginia Inez R. M. sell candies in the terrace of a primary school, Justina Maxima C. and Lilia Elia C. C. sell snacks from their home (sopes (fried tortillas), gold tacos, enchiladas, tamales and empanadas (turnovers)). Mrs Virginia Inez R. is the representative of the group. She is a single mother and has three children which financially depend on her since they are high school students. She works in the sale of sweets, it is convenient for her because the school is very close to her home and she feels that she can earn a good income. She dreams of her youngest son obtaining a professional career in addition to having a place to live. The loan will be invested in the purchase of fried items such as: fried potatoes, ingredients to make chicharron (cracklings), Salsa Bonatera (hot sauce), plastic bags, disposable plates, vegetable oil, and sweets. She notes that she know all the members of the group and that they are responsible people. They also are very grateful to the lenders from Kiva. The money from the loans through the Realidad Foundation gives them the opportunity to work and help support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of books for resale, refreshments, food supplements, cosmetics, sweets and purchase of ingredients for the making of snacks.

loans.name: Arturo Celso

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Tiene instalada una bodega en su vivienda desde hace dos años. En ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad. Instaló su bodega poco a poco con los ahorros que percibía de sus trabajos como obrero eventual, la bodega fue creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y al buen trato que ofrecia a sus clientes, y ahora que sus hijos ya estudian y el ya tiene un trabajo estable mas como vigilante, esta bodega se ha convertido en una fuente importante de apoyo a la economía familiar.

Arturo desea invertir en la ampliación de su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y bebidas, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es un hombre empeñoso y que ha sabido progresar de acuerdo a sus posibilidades. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Arturo is 37, married and has 2 children, ages 10 and 7. He lives with his family in the Paiján district in Ascope province, La Libertad region, about two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque province. He has had a store in his house for the last two years. In it he sells all kinds of groceries and basic necessities to his customers. He built the store little by little with the savings that he had from his work as a temporary laborer. The store grew thanks to his effort and to his good service to the customers. Now that his children are in school and that he has a regular job as a guard, the store has become an important source of income for the family. Arturo wants to invest in enlarging his business by buying groceries and drinks. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles to help him with this goal. He is a hard-working man that has learned how to get ahead the best way he can. He has worked with our institution in the past and shown himself to be punctual and responsible when he has to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and drinks to enlarge his store

loans.name: Fredi Maritza

texts.es:
Fredi es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de diez meses de nacido en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega desde hace ocho años, en ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Este negocio se ha constituido como una fuente importante de ingreso familiar por lo que ella da todo de si diariamente para hacerlo funcionar y sacarlo adelante.

Fredi desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes para seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Fredi es una madre muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, sus vecinos y clientes prefieren la bodega por la amabilidad y carisma con la que los atiende.
texts.en:
Fredi is 29 years old and a mother, she lives with her husband and a son of ten months in the Paiján district, province of Ascope, region La Libertad, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Eight years ago she set up a general store in her home. She offers her customers all kinds of groceries, drinks and candies. This business has turned out to be an important source of the family income and she gives it her all every day to make it work and prosper. Fredi wants to enlarge her business with the purchase of more groceries because she wants to continue satisfying the needs of her customers. This is the reason for her requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, a loan of 1000 new soles. Fredi is a mother very devoted to her family and her work. Her neighbors prefer her general store for the friendliness and charisma with which she attends to them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to expand her business.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. S. was born in 1950 and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She has a partner in her husband who is a disabled person who stays at home to do the housework. This old couple is married and is blessed with a daughter. Their child helps to contribute to the family by working in the garment factory.

To earn a living, S. always relies on using her old bicycle to transport the used-goods that she buys going door-to-door around the commune and which she then resells to gain income. She will take out her loan to improve her used-goods enterprise.

loans.use: To improve her used-goods enterprise

loans.name: Poa

texts.en:
A lot of Cambodian people earn a living by driving a motorcycle taxi. One of those citizens, Mr. Poa P., is a motorcycle taxi driver and is able to earn a salary of $5 a day. He uses this income to support all his family expenses such as meals, his child’s clothing, medical bills, and his child's school fees. In order to help him, his wife works sewing clothes in industry and earns a specific salary.

Recently Poa P. is hardly finding passengers because his motorcycle taxi is too old and not attractive. To solve this problem, he decided to pursue a loan to be used to replace his old motorcycle taxi. From this he is hopeful that he will able to increase his number of customers and his income.

loans.use: To replace his old motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun S., 37 years old, is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for her children. She has three teenage kids who are employed at different jobs. They provide their income to help contribute to the family.

Sun S. is also relying on income from her husband who works as an internal staff person for a company in Phnom Penh. He commutes to his work location by car and recently the car has often broken down. Because of this, Sun S. requests a loan to mend her husband’s broken-down car.

loans.use: To mend her husband's broken-down car

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak K. is a village woman who lives with other family member in an area of the capital, Phnom Penh. She is aged 40, is a housewife, and she is married and blessed with three children. One of her daughters is an employee in Naga club.

The family is supported by Prak K.’s husband who operates a vehicle sales business. He buys and sells second-hand motorcycles that he also buys from the people who live in the rural areas. He is conducting his job very well but currently he lacks some cash to buy more vehicles for resale. He discussed this with his wife and she has decided to ask a loan of $1,000 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycles for her husband to sell

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. S. owns and operates a small furniture business in her village, selling items such as plastic chairs, tables, and housing accessories. She has a life partner in her husband who is a temporary construction laborer. The couple helps each other in order to feed their three children, who are students in the local public school. S. will be using her loan to accumulate a larger inventory of furniture. Some of the loan will be used to buy tools to squeeze sugar cane, to earn some extra profit.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger inventory of furniture

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Ruos R., 39, resides in Reusey Keo District, about 10 km from Phnom Penh. She earns a living as a local farmer. She plants rice and vegetable crops, which she will sell in the market. In addition, she fishes with her husband at the public pond. Ruos R. has seven children: one is married and the others are students who also work at different occupations. Ruos R. lacks farming accessories and is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 52 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredó su madre, junto a su hijo y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes. Lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de la ciudad, pues los sacos con los productos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos para poder obtener mejores precios.

Este es el primer préstamo de Maximiliana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, también comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 52 years old and a hardworking and cheerful mother. She lives in the house she inherited from her mother with her son, for whom she wants to improve their quality of life.

The products she grows require much effort and dedication, and have helped her progress in life. Every morning she works on her land, knowing that the care she provides her crops will determine their quality. What she enjoys most about her work is looking after her crops and feeling joyful whenever her harvest is large and abundant. Maximiliana has been farming for 22 years and considers the most difficult part to be hauling her crops to the city market because the bags of produce are so heavy. Later on she hopes to improve her products so that she can command better prices.

This is her first loan with MFP. Maximiliana knows she has to submit all of her payments on time and is committed to doing so. In her Communal Bank, she is a very cooperative and responsible member. With her loan of 1000 PEN, she plans to buy seeds for her crops of peas. She will also buy compost and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, compost, and insecticides

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela, de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar de 28 años, ambos son agricultores y juntos desean poderle brindar a su querido hijo una mejor vida.

Junto a su esposo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y flores (gladiolos), los cuales venden en los mercados de las ciudades de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras para que no sean atacadas por las plagas, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Marcela con MFP y cree que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará 5 sacos de semillas de alverja, en lo cual invertirá todo el dinero, ya que el valor por saco es de seiscientos nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcels, 38, is a cheerful, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Omar, 28; both are farmers and together want to provide a better life for their beloved son. Together, she and her husband plant broad beans, corn, and gladioli that they then sell in the markets in Tarma and La Merced, which is where they get the best prices. What she likes best about her work is caring for her crops so that they will be safe from pests; she has been a farmer for 18 years. She considers the most difficult part of the job having to carry her crops to the markets where she sells because the sacks are very heavy. This is Marcela's 7th loan with MFP and she believes that the loan will be very helpful to her in her development as a farmer. She is a very participatory and supportive member of her communal bank. She will use the 3000 new soles requested to buy 5 sacks of pea seed; she will invest the entire loan in this purchase because each sack costs 600 new soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y su hija, en su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de carteras, calzado y bisutería, vendiendo según la temporada a sus vecinas y amistades. Usualmente desarrolla esta labor sola, puesto que su pareja se dedica a otra actividad y su hija a los estudios. Su negocio obtiene buenas ganancias gracias a que ella se esfuerza mucho ejerciéndolo, sale desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y regresa a su casa sólo para preparar el almuerzo y atender a su familia. 
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un bazar en su vivienda para tener mayor comodidad a la hora de ofrecer su mercadería, pero para esto requiere de mayor capital y aún no dispone de todo el tiempo para dedicarle a su negocio, puesto que debe velar por su hija y las labores de su hogar, es por eso que este negocio aún está en sus planes futuros. 

Es el cuarto préstamo de Betty con MFP y promete ser tan puntual en sus pagos como lo fue en sus préstamos pasados. Con el dinero que solicita ahora comprará mayor cantidad de carteras y collares que es lo que más se está vendiendo en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Betty, 30, lives with her life partner and their daugher in her own home. For the last 2 years she has sold seasonal purses, shoes and costume jewelry to her neighbors and acquaintances. She usually works alone because her partner is involved in a different activity and her daugher is in school. Her business earns good profits thanks to the effort she puts into it. She goes out at 9am and works until 6pm only coming home to prepare lunch and care for her family. For the future, she plans to set up a store in her house so that she can sell more comfortably. For this, however, she needs more capital and she still doesn't have the necessary time to dedicate to her business because she must care for her daughter and see to household chores. This is why the store is still in her future plans. This is Betty's 4th loan with MFP and she promisses to be as punctual now with her repayments as she's been in the past. She will use the funds to buy larger quantities of purses and necklaces, which are the items that sell best during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy necklaces and purses.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una emprendedora mujer de 34 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus hijos de 16, 15 y 14 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos, actualmente está vendiendo sandalias, ya que el verano amerita el uso de este calzado, es por ello que viene teniendo buenas ventas. Elva compra las sandalias por docenas y en variedad de diseños, para que cuando las ofrezca tenga diversidad para sus clientes. Todo este tiempo, su trabajo ha hecho que se sienta independiente y con mucha fortaleza para seguir mejorando su negocio, es así que quisiera tener un puesto fijo en una zona muy concurrida para vender con mayor comodidad sus zapatos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y su grupo denominado “Mujeres Triunfadoras de Ventanilla” es muy unido y responsable, por lo cual cree que no tendrá problemas con los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de sandalias para aumentar sus ventas en esta época veraniega.
texts.en:
Elva, 34, is an enterprising woman; she lives in her own house with her husband and their children, who are 16, 15 and 14 years of age. For the last 2 years she has sold shoes, even selling sandals, because Summer calls for this type of footwear. This is why her sales have been good. Elva buys sandals by the dozen in an assortment of styles so that when she puts them on display there is much diversity for her customers. All this time, her work has made it possible for her to feel independent and strong in order to continue improving her business. She wants to have a fixed locale in a busy part of town to sell her shoes in more comfortably. This is her first loan with MFP and her communal bank called, "Mujeres Triunfadoras de Ventanilla" (Winning Women from Ventanilla). It is a very unified and responsible group so she does not anticipate any problems with repayments. She will use the funds to buy larger amounts of sandals to increase sales during Summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals.

loans.name: Abdulvakhob

texts.ru: Худжаназаров Абдулвахоб проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Абдулвахоб имеет земельный участок, где засаживает разные культуры. Он в основном разводит мелкий рогатый скот у себя дома. Одновременно занимается строительными работами по найму. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Этим он хочет увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Abdulvahob K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdulvahob has a plot of land where he sows different crops.
