He mainly breeds small cattle at his home. At the same time he also does hired construction work. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle. He wants to increase the number of his stock.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Kholikul

texts.ru: Лолаев Холикул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Дети, работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Имеет большой опыт. В этом ему помогает жена. На полученный кредит хочет купить дойную корову. Он намерен обеспечить насиление молоком и кисло- молочным продуктом.
texts.en:
Kholikul L. lives in the Yavan region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has four children. His children work as farmers. He does animal husbandry. He feeds and sells cattle and has very good experience. His wife helps him in this business. He wants to use the loan to buy a milk cow. He plans to supply the residents with milk and milk products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn O., 44, is from the village of Santa Filomena. She is married and has 1 school-aged and 4 adult-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn is just starting this business.

In 2007, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Evelyn is requesting her third loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for the construction of a bathroom. She plans to have a comfortable and sanitized room for family use. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Qamer Group

texts.en:
Noorzia is a member of Qamer Group. She is 40 years old and married with five children. One of her sons has graduated from school, and her other children are students at school. Although her husband works, she wants to support him as well.

Noorzia has been a tailor for more than fifteen years. She is interested in her job, and she sews different kinds of clothes in small and big sizes. With the loan, she would like to purchase a new machine, because she had lots of problems during work with the old one. In addition, she needs to purchase different kinds of threads and needles.

She hopes to progress her business and to increase her income in order to support her family members in a better way and send her son to a better university.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for her business

loans.name: Magaui

texts.en:
Magaui N. is 44 and married with 7 children (ages 8 - 28).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Magaui has many years of experience in this business.  Magaui needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Magaui joined SPBD.    This is her 6th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Magaui's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Magaui N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.name: Safya Hama Group

texts.en:
Homa is the group leader of the Safya Hama group. She is 52 years old, and she lives in the 1st district of Kabul Province in Afghanistan. She is married with five children. She has three daughters and two sons who are in school.

Homa wants a loan for her husband's business. He has a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He wants to expand his business by buying more materials, especially the things that are more in demand, such as canned meat and drinks. He wants to attract more clients. He hopes to have a bigger shop and a higher monthly income in order to send their children to good schools.

The group has requested a loan of 30,000 AFN. Homa's husband is happy that there is a nice process that can solve the entrepreneurs' problems.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell, such as canned meat and drinks

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard B., age 45, is a farmer. He started his business in 1997. He has two children; the eldest is 17 years old. He owns one carabao and a 1-hectare farm. The income that he gets from growing rice is what he uses to support his family's daily needs.

He would like to grow his business. He would like a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Исмоилов Сафарбек проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, занимается торговлей. Сам Сафарбек предоставляет услугу, такси. Перевозками занимается более 5 лет. Этот вид деятельности приносит мало прибыли. На полученный кредит хочет открыть магазин, т.к. у них в кишлаке мало продуктовых магазинов. Этим способом он сможет обеспечить насиление продуктовым товаром и получить хороший доход.
texts.en:
Safarbek I. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 25 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is involved in retail sales. Safarbek provides taxi service. He has been involved in transportation for over 5 years. This type of business brings little income. He wants to use this loan to open a store because their village does not have many food stores. This way Safarbek will be able to provide people with food products and receive a good income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Opening a food store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C., age 56, is a rice farmer. She has five children that are already married. Aside from a farm, she has a sari-sari (variety) store and a small piggery. She ventures into different businesses to supplement their family income.

Emma would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies in order to grow her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Ruzimurod

texts.ru: Раджабов Рузимурод проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Рузимурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает мелко- рогатый скот. Этот бизнес приносит ему доход. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Ризимурод хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен продавать их в оптом по более выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Ruzimurod R. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife takes care of the household. Ruzimurod has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years. He primarily raises and sells small livestock. This business brings him an income. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity. Ruzimurod wants to expand his business. He intends to sell livestock wholesale at a more profitable price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Habiburahman Group

texts.en:
Habib is the group leader of Habiburahman Group and he lives in 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 45 and is married with four children: three sons and one daughter. One of his sons, Imran, supports him in his business and the others are students in school.

Habib has a general store where he works together with his son. Habib is a hardworking man. He works seven days a week in his shop to support his family members and pay for the rental house they live in.

Habib needs the loan to purchase more stock like beverages and the other essential items which support his progress. He hopes to be a good businessman in the future and so that he will be able to have his own house in which to live together with his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to make his shop larger

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
"I have a two hectare farm. I focus a lot on farming since I don't have a family yet. It was May 2008 that I started having a business. I like the CEVI program because it has the lowest interest rate. It also has other benefits aside from loans like a hospitalization package and savings," says Bernardo G. a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato.

Bernardo would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his crop.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph G. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old, is a widower, and has one adult child. Joseph owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Joseph joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for registration, franchise and licenses. This loan will be his first loan from GDMPC. Joseph plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise and licenses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G., 50 years old, is a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. Evelyn has been married for 30 years now. She has six children, her eldest child being 28 years old. She started tilling her rice field in 1990.

Evelyn would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest and help her family more.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is from Barangay Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old, is single, and has one adult child. Esmeralda works in a family member's business operating tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Sarkiss

texts.en:
Sarkiss is a 50-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Sarkiss has been working as a car electrician and mechanic for twenty-four years. When Sarkiss first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided on doing his business, because he had learned the trade since he was young.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his work, such as car batteries, car accessories, car radios, alarms, and wipers. This is his second loan, and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work and purchase more sophisticated tools. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his work

loans.name: Gonantano

texts.en: Gonantano R. is 47 years old, married to an accountant, and has nine school-aged children. She currently sells bags of charcoal and groundnut paste at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. In the future, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children in higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marotyon

texts.en:
Marotyon is a 46-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has been working as a jewelry designer since 1993. He produces necklaces, earrings, bracelets, pins and other type of jewelry. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties since he learned his trade from his father. When he was young, he used to help his father during his free time; he loves his work and produces beautiful jewelry.
Marotyon is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase gold for his work. He has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work. In the future, he plans to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase gold for his work

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old, widowed, and has nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Regina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Regina joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 18th from GDMPC. Regina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 35 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Since 2000, he has owned a bakery from which he sells mankoucheh, a food that looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese), and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.
Ahmad is successful in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. Rashid decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, he plans on expanding his bakery.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Nusa Sejahtera Group

texts.en:
I WAYAN  N. (0) is a 60-year-old man living in the town of MELAYA-JEMBRANA-BALI.  I WAYAN  is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 'NUSA SEJAHTERA' (MUK-0007).

I WAYAN  is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, I WAYAN owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  I WAYAN  has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, I WAYAN  joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  I WAYAN  is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  He is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  I WAYAN  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





I WAYAN  N. (0) merupakan 60 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota MELAYA-JEMBRANA-BALI.  I WAYAN  adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 6 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah NUSA SEJAHTERA (MUK-0007).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  I WAYAN  sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I WAYAN  menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR.  Dalam 2008, I WAYAN  bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I WAYAN  meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina is 33 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. She has been running a sewing business for almost two years. She works from her house, repairing all type of clothes, and also making clothes, scarves, cushions covers and more. When Jina first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to start her business because of her experience – she has been sewing from an early age and likes her work. Jina is successful because she sews well and knows how to treat her customers, who are mostly friends and neighbors.
Jina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a new sewing machine for work. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her work, possibly by opening a sewing factory.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for work

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel C. is from the village of Kinangay Norte. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a business offering transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Raquel joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so that she can offer a better service. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is 25 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Since 2003, he has owed a barber shop. He is successful in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and is aware of new haircuts. His customers are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had some financial difficulties in purchasing all the necessary tools. He decided to set up his barber shop because he wanted to have independent work.
Bilal is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work and change the décor of his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Since 1990, Mrs. Lim N. has cultivated rice and vegetable crops on her own land, located next to her house. She also harvests palm leaves that she uses to produce mats for sale. She is helped by her husband who assists her in the field. Her farming and business activities have helped her contribute to providing for her family through the financial crisis.
Lim N. has two married children who live away from home, while the other two are single. One of her sons works in the soap-producing industry. In order to earn extra cash, Lim N. is requesting a loan to dig a pond where she will raise small fish.

loans.use: To dig a pond where she will raise small fish

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, such as root crops (like gabi), for sale in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Tita joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Keyork

texts.en:
Keyork is 63 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and three children. He has been working in car repairs since 1985. He also sells car spare parts and car tires. Keyork is successful in his work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided to set up his business because he wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as people from the surrounding neighborhoods.
Keyork has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his garage such as tires, spare parts and car oil. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. In the future, he plans on enlarging his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 33 years old and widowed with two children, ages 8 and 10, both of whom are in school. She runs a mixed farm near Kitale, Kenya, where she has been farming for over two years. She sells a variety of products to generate her income, including milk, vegetables, sugar cane and tomatoes. Since her husband passed on recently, Emily also receives small pension amount from his past employer which supplements her income.

Emily recently completed a Kes 20,000 loan with Juhudi Kilimo, and has now requested this loan for Kes. 20,000 to purchase two goats and to improve her stock of poultry. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her attain financial independence. She currently relies on relatives at times for financial support, and she hopes that will no longer be necessary once she is able to improve her standard of living. She also wants to be in position where she can afford to educate both of her children.

In the future, Emily has numerous goals for the growth of her farm. She wants to acquire additional dairy animals and over 200 poultry layers. She also hopes to expand and plant up to five acres of maize.

loans.use: To purchase two goats and add to poultry stock

loans.name: Ragheb

texts.en:
Ragheb is a 24-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Ragheb has owned a mobile phone business for almost two years now. He sells all types of new and used mobile phones and he also repairs phones. He also sells mobile accessories like chargers, earphones, covers and more. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Ragheb has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.  When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ragheb decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, and his self confidence allowed him to do it. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Mouhyi Eldin

texts.en:
Mouhyi Eldin is a 26-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mouhyi Eldin has owned a coffee shop for almost two years. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his coffee shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 

Mouhyi Eldin is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and they feel comfortable coming to his shop and resting while enjoying a nice coffee with pleasant people. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he passed through financial issues. Mouhyi Eldin decided on doing his business because he likes owning his own business and working on his own, and he has experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Akob

texts.en:
Akob is a 60-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Akob has been working as a tailor since 1985. He is special in his work because he is known for his good and talented work. He produces and repairs all type of clothes. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for his work and repair his sewing machine. Akob has been a micro-credit client for ten years now and has always repaid on time.

His previous loans allowed him to improve his business, purchasing better thread and having a more sophisticated sewing machine. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Akob decided on doing his business because of his experience in the field. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase thread for his work and repair his sewing machine

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Mariam has owned a grocery store for almost two years. She sells canned food, candies, etc…She also offers coffee and tea to her customers.  She is special in her work because she knows how to treat her customers and is welcoming. 

Mariam requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. 

Her customers are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had to face some financial issues. Mariam decided on doing her business because of her networking in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 43, is a fish vendor.  The income she receives from her business supports the basic needs of her family.  She has four children in the family.  She works hard so that her children will have a good future.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to ask for financial support for her business with a low interest rate. She’s requesting a loan of Php 8,000 as additional capital to continue with her business.

loans.use: fish

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo is 45 years old and the mother of four children. She sells cooked food and drinks, and before now she hawked cooked food, but could only sell the little quantity she could carry around. She says thanks to LAPO Microfinance who have made it possible for her to own a shop so she can now sell more of what she used to sell.

Taiwo also sells eggs retail. She supplies eggs to customers at their business place. Presently, she opens her shop every day of the week except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Taiwo is asking for a loan of NGN 80,000 to enable her to expand her egg business (sold in cardboard crates). This, she said, will enable her to meet the demand of customers in a timely manner. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Since June 2007, Beatriz has been running a hog-raising business.  She is 53 years old with three children.  Her business helps in providing the basic needs of her family.  She needs more capital to continue with her piggery business and plans to make an expansion.  She’s requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for buying feed and piglets.

loans.use: feed and pigs

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo, 34, earns a living by transporting passengers with his motorcycle. He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to seek financial support for his small business. He requested a loan of 8,000 Php to add as capital in running his motorcycle. It will be of big help in having enough fuel and maintenance for his motorcycle. He is a family man. He supports three children in the family. He sometimes works at a sideline, selling fish to support his family.

loans.use: motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en: Silveria, 53, owns a 'sari-sari' (variety) store. She sells various types of goods in her store to provide the daily needs around her neighborhood. She started this kind of business a long time ago. Now she’s a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to gain access to a loan of 25,000 Php, enough to provide additional capital to fill her store with groceries. She has one child to support in her family. This loan will be of great help to provide more groceries for her store.

loans.use: groceries

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 42-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Mouhamad has owned a grocery store since 2004. He sells candies, drinks, household cleaning products, canned food like tuna, hot dogs, beans, corn, etc… 

Mouhamad is special in his work because he offers a big variety of products to his customers. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. 

When Mouhamad first started his business, he had some financial issues and couldn’t expand his stock and diversify his merchandise; however, his previous loans allowed him to do this. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, as well as due to his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Our

texts.en:
Mrs. Our R. is 47-year-old woman and lives in a community in Kompong Cham province. She is a widowed mother blessed with seven kids: two are married and the other five are single. Some among of them are employed and the remaining ones are attending school. 

Presently, she earns a living by cultivating crops on her farmland that she inherited from her grandparents who died of old age a long time ago. Because Our R. resides in a rural area, she always finds it hard irrigating her crop. She will be using her loan to dig a well where she will pump water for her crop and her family’s use.

loans.use: To dig a well for her crop and her family’s use

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda weaves nipa (palm frond) mats to earn a living. Nipa is a plant used for roofing and her business enables her to reach her dreams together with her family. Leonarda, 60, is the mother of three children. She sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital to run her nipa weaving business. She requested a loan of 6,000 Php to buy more materials and supplies for weaving. This loan will help her in terms of finances and sustain her family.

loans.use: weaving materials

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 6 and 9, both of whom are currently enrolled in school. She operates a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over six years. Her primary income comes from the sale of eggs at the local market, and she also runs a charcoal-selling kiosk for additional income. She says that the main challenge she has faced in recent times was acquiring the necessary capital to expand her farm, but with these loans she is happy to have found a source of credit. 

Annah recently completed her first loan through Juhudi Kilimo, and has now requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to add more chickens to her farm and to increase the supply of feed. She is also factoring in expected costs of veterinary services that she may need to use in the future to ensure the success of her poultry project. 

Overall, Annah says that this loan will help her family become self-sustainable in terms of food and for covering education expenses. She is also hopeful that in the future she will be able to expand her stock of chickens and also acquire dairy animals for increased income.

loans.use: To increase poultry stock and feed supply

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda weaves 'nipa' (palm frond) mats as her main source of income. 'Nipa' is a type of plant that is used for roofing. Her business enables her to send her children to school. Now at the age of 60, she is the mother of four children, and the eldest is still only 24 years old. 

Wilfreda sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital to run her 'nipa' weaving business. She requested a loan of 8,000 Php to buy more materials and supplies for weaving. This loan will help finance her business's working capital.

loans.use: weaving supplies

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik V. was born in 1973 in Ijevan city. He is married and has 3 school-aged children. Since 1992 Garik has been working as a hairdresser in his own hairdressing salon.  Garik has used his profits for his family's needs: he repaired his apartment, bought furniture for his apartment, etc. 

Garik is asking for a 900.000 AMD loan, which will allow him to repair his hairdressing salon and to buy modern hairdressing implements. 

Garik has taken loans three times from “Nor Horizon” and has never been delinquent his repayments.

loans.use: To repair his hairdressing salon and to buy modern hairdressing implements

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Annabelle is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like biscuits, cooking oil, vinegar, sugar, salt, etc., in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Annabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark C. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occdeinatl. He is 29 years old. Mark is single. To make a living, Mark works in someone else's business venture operating transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Mark has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mark joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mark has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Mark is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Mark from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Saliyu

texts.en:
Saliyu is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She designs both Nigerian and Western designs for her customers who are usually friends and residents. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Saliyu is 40 years old. She is happily married with three children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Abd

texts.en:
Abd is a 41-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Abd sells “falafel” sandwiches. Falafel is a fried ball or patty made from spiced chickpeas and/or fava beans. Originally from Egypt, falafel is a popular form of fast food in the Middle East, where it is also served as a mezze (hors d'oeuvres).

Abd is special in his work because he is known for his sandwiches. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his work.

Abd has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, and he opened a falafel place because it is one of his favorite foods. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his work

loans.name: Ruqayat

texts.en:
Ruqayat is a hardworking woman and she lives in Oyo State, Nigeria, where she sells groundnuts (peanuts), soya beans, and yam flour (elubo) at retail prices. Yam flour can be eaten with soup and it is the traditional food of the Yorubas (one of the largest ethno-linguistic or ethnic groups in west Africa). She has been in this business for a long time.

Ruqayat is married with two children. She is 27 years old and her husband also works to support their home. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more bags of yam flour to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of yam flour (elubo) to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda R. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Merlinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 17th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Sicila

texts.en:
Sicila is a 50-year-old widow with ten children. They range in age from 12 to 30 years old, and her three youngest are still enrolled in school.

Sicila owns and runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over fifteen years. Her main source of income comes from the sale of maize, milk and beans. She says that there are some challenges to overcome in order to have success, and they include fluctuation in market prices and frequent droughts which negatively affect production.

Sicila requested this Kes 31,200 loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help provide stability and enable her to meet her family's basic needs. In the future, she would like to expand her dairy operations and acquire additional cows for milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en: Mrs. C. is a 29-year-old fish seller earning approximately $3.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sun Rouen, is 35. He catches fish in the river to sell. They have four teenage children who go to school. C. hopes to earn additional income by investing in a new business but she doesn’t have the capital needed. Therefore, Mrs. C. decided to seek a loan from Kiva to buy piglets to raise; she has already built a stall for them.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Musili

texts.en: Musili, 62, is married with 4 children all of whom are doing well in business and in school. She is also a grandmother which gives her joy. Musili is a friendly and hard-working woman, determined to excel both in business and family life. She sells bags of onions and other foodstuffs in the market -- a business she has been in for a long time and which she hopes to expand. Musil has a good relationship with LAPO and is asking for a loan amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more bags of onions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad, 32, lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Ziad has owned a mobile phone for almost two years. He sells all type of new and used mobile phones and he also repairs them. He also sells mobile accessories like chargers, earphones, covers and more. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because his clients are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise to sell. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He hopes to expand his work in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline sells kerosene. She buys from an authorized dealer and sells at retail. She started her business in 2000 and she is a big dealer.          

Roseline is 44 years old, married with four children and her husband works in one of the printing presses in Lagos. With part of her profit and what her husband brings in, they are able to clothe and feed the family and take care of their house rent, as they do not yet have a building of their own. 

Roseline is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell to improve her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um S. is a 43-year-old widow and mother. She is skilled in cooking food and she has been using her knowledge to earn a living. She is also hired by people to cook meals for their wedding parties.  She has given birth to a pair of daughters who are single. One of them is a waitress for a restaurant and other one is a student. Um S. finds it hard traveling anywhere because she doesn’t have a vehicle. In order to help facilitate transportation, she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle. The loan will provide her with comfortable traveling and a fixed asset.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Selling sachet water and drinks is a business activity that is so dear to the heart of Nike. She has been selling sachet water and drinks for a long time and has lots of customers. She hopes to grow her business. Nike hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell. Nike is a Yoruba woman by tribe and she is married with four children. She is 40 years old and her husband also works to support the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. lives in Kabartonjo centre. She was born in 1975 and is married to Musa Chepsongol who is 39 years old and a secondary school teacher. They have three children who are aged between 12 years and 7 years.

Rebecca owns an auto spare-parts shop which she opened a year ago. She earns a monthly profit of Ksh 15,000 from this business and an additional Ksh 5,000 from dairy farming.

Rebecca was introduced to KADET by one of our staff and currently borrowed a loan of Ksh 80,000. She plans to use Ksh 50,000 to purchase spare parts for sale in her auto spares shop while Ksh 8,000 will be used to purchase a dairy goat, Ksh 20,000 will be used to purchase a dairy cow and the balance will be used to purchase drugs for the cow. If this loan boosts her business she will use the profit to purchase land and also expand her business.

Rebecca describes herself as hardworking. She dreams of, and hopes to open, a very big hardware shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her auto spares shop and to buy livestock

loans.name: Alchaykh Rachid

texts.en:
Alchaykh Rachid is a 57-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Alchaykh Rachid owns an Internet shop. He is special in his work because his clients like coming to his place; he also offers coffee and all type of juices, with candies and biscuits so that his clients enjoy their stay.

Alchaykh Rachid requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Alchaykh Rachid decided on his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as his experience, and it was also a business in demand in his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 54 year old widow woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Sabah has owned a grocery store since 2009. She sells canned food, candies, cleaning products, shampoos etc… Sabah requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Sabah has been a microcredit client for eleven years now and has always paid on time. Sabah is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had to face some financial issues. Sabah decided on doing her business because of her networking in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason J. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Jason is single. To make a living, Jason works in someone else's business venture operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Jason has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jason joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jason has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Jason is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Jason from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Kasmiro

texts.en:
Kasmiro R. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to open up a food stall.  Kasmiro is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a food stall

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
To earn a living in Oyo State, Victoria sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business so much because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is a hard-working woman. She sells daily from 7 am to 7 pm. She desires to own a supermarket in the future. 

Victoria is 47 years old and married with three children. Her youngest child is 13 years old. Her children are still dependent on her. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders in anticipation for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy M. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Juvy is single. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like coffee, Milo (cocoa powder), sugar, noodles, salt, etc. in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Juvy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business
